field.name: RoTK0_EN
field.description: RoT Key 0 enable. 00 - Invalid 01 - Enabled 10, 11 - Key revoked

field.name: RoTK1_EN
field.description: RoT Key 1 enable. 00 - Invalid 01 - Enabled 10, 11 - Key revoked

field.name: RoTK2_EN
field.description: RoT Key 2 enable. 00 - Invalid 01 - Enabled 10, 11 - Key revoked

field.name: DBG_VENDOR_USAGE
field.description: DBG_VENDOR_USAGE.

field.name: INVERSE_VALUE
field.description: inverse value of bits [15:0]

register.name: DCFG_CC_SOCU_PIN
register.description: With TZ-M, the part can be sold by level 1 customers (secure code developer) to level-2 customers who develops non-secure code only. - In this scenario, or easy of development, Level-I customer releases the part to always allow non-secure debug. - To allow level-2 customers to further seal the part DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS is used. - ROM will use this word to further restrict the debug access.

field.name: NIDEN
field.description: Non Secure non-invasive debug enable

field.description: Non Secure debug enable

field.name: SPIDEN

field.name: TAPEN
field.description: JTAG TAP enable

field.name: MCM33_DBGEN
field.description: Micro CM33 invasive debug enable

field.name: ISP_CMD_EN
field.description: ISP Boot Command enable

field.name: FA_CMD_EN

field.name: ME_CMD_EN
field.description: Flash Mass Erase Command enable

field.name: MCM33_NIDEN
field.description: Micro CM33 non-invasive debug enable

field.name: UUID_CHECK
field.description: Enforce UUID match during Debug authentication.

field.name: INVERSE_VALUE
field.description: inverse value of bits [15:0]

register.name: DCFG_CC_SOCU_DFLT
register.description: With TZ-M, the part can be sold by level 1 customers (secure code developer) to level-2 customers who develops non-secure code only. - In this scenario, or easy of development, Level-I customer releases the part to always allow non-secure debug. - To allow level-2 customers to further seal the part DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS is used. - ROM will use this word to further restrict the debug access.

register.name: ENABLE_FA_MODE
register.description: Enable FA mode. SET_FA_MODE Command should write 0xC33CA55A to this word to indicate boot ROM to enter FA mode.

register.name: CMPA_PROG_IN_PROGRESS
register.description: CMPA Page programming on going. This field shall be set to 0x5CC55AA5 in the active CFPA page each time CMPA page programming is going on. It shall always be set to 0x00000000 in the CFPA scratch area.

register.name: SHA256_DIGEST[%s]
register.description: SHA256_DIGEST0 for DIGEST[31:0] SHA256_DIGEST1 for DIGEST[63:32] SHA256_DIGEST2 for DIGEST[95:64] SHA256_DIGEST3 for DIGEST[127:96] SHA256_DIGEST4 for DIGEST[159:128] SHA256_DIGEST5 for DIGEST[191:160] SHA256_DIGEST6 for DIGEST[223:192] SHA256_DIGEST7 for DIGEST[255:224]

field.name: BOOT_FAILURE_PIN
field.description: GPIO port and pin number to use for indicating failure reason. The toggle rate of the pin is used to decode the error type. [2:0] - Defines GPIO port [7:3] - Defines GPIO pin

field.name: VENDOR_USAGE
field.description: Upper 16 bits of vendor usage field defined in DAP. Lower 16-bits come from customer field area.

field.name: RSA4K
field.description: Use RSA4096 keys only. 00- RSA2048 keys 01, 10, 11 - RSA4096 keys

field.name: DICE_ENC_NXP_CFG
field.description: Include NXP area in DICE computation. 00 - not included 01, 10, 11 - included

field.name: DICE_CUST_CFG
field.description: Include Customer factory area (including keys) in DICE computation. 00 - not included 01, 10, 11 - included

field.name: SKIP_DICE
field.description: Skip DICE computation. 00 - Enable DICE 01,10,11 - Disable DICE

field.name: TZM_IMAGE_TYPE
field.description: TrustZone-M mode. 00 - TZM mode in image header. 01 - Disable TZ-M. Boots to NonSecure. 10 - TZ-M enable boots to secure mode. 11 - Preset TZM checker from image header.

field.name: BLOCK_SET_KEY
field.description: Block PUF key code generation. 00 - Enable Key code generation 01, 10, 11 - Disable key code generation

field.name: BLOCK_ENROLL
field.description: Block PUF enrollement. 00 - Enable enrollment mode 01, 10, 11 - Disable further enrollmnet

field.name: SEC_BOOT_EN
field.description: Secure boot enable. 00 - Plain image (internal flash with or without CRC) 01, 10, 11 - Boot signed images. (internal flash, RSA signed)

field.name: ADDR0_PRG
field.description: Programmable portion of the base address of region 0.

field.name: ADDR1_PRG
field.description: Programmable portion of the base address of region 1.

field.name: ADDR2_PRG
field.description: Programmable portion of the base address of region 2.

field.name: LOCK_REG0
field.description: Lock PRINCE region0 settings. 00 - Region is not locked. 01, 10, 11 - Region is locked.

field.name: LOCK_REG1
field.description: Lock PRINCE region1 settings. 00 - Region is not locked. 01, 10, 11 - Region is locked.

field.name: LOCK_REG2
field.description: Lock PRINCE region2 settings. 00 - Region is not locked. 01, 10, 11 - Region is locked.

field.name: REG0_ERASE_CHECK_EN
field.description: For PRINCE region0 enable checking whether all encrypted pages are erased together. 00 - Check is disabled. 01, 10, 11 - Check is enabled.

field.name: REG1_ERASE_CHECK_EN
field.description: For PRINCE region1 enable checking whether all encrypted pages are erased together. 00 - Check is disabled. 01, 10, 11 - Check is enabled.

field.name: REG2_ERASE_CHECK_EN
field.description: For PRINCE region2 enable checking whether all encrypted pages are erased together. 00 - Check is disabled. 01, 10, 11 - Check is enabled.

register.name: ROTKH[%s]

field.name: IRQCPU0
field.description: The IRQ number of the interrupt that acts as the Non-Maskable Interrupt (NMI) for the CPU0, if enabled by NMIENCPU0.

field.name: IRQCPU1
field.description: The IRQ number of the interrupt that acts as the Non-Maskable Interrupt (NMI) for the CPU1, if enabled by NMIENCPU1.

field.name: NMIENCPU1
field.description: Write a 1 to this bit to enable the Non-Maskable Interrupt (NMI) source selected by IRQCPU1.

field.name: NMIENCPU0
field.description: Write a 1 to this bit to enable the Non-Maskable Interrupt (NMI) source selected by IRQCPU0.

field.name: BANK0
field.description: Flash Bank0 control.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Flash BANK0 checker is enabled (all Flash pages inside this bank cannot be erased nor programmed).

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: 1010: Flash BANK0 checker is disabled (all Flash pages inside this bank can be erased and programmed).

register.name: SDIOCLKCTRL
register.description: SDIO CCLKIN phase and delay control

field.name: CCLK_DRV_PHASE
field.description: Programmable delay value by which cclk_in_drv is phase-shifted with regard to cclk_in.

field.name: CCLK_SAMPLE_PHASE
field.description: Programmable delay value by which cclk_in_sample is delayed with regard to cclk_in.

field.name: PHASE_ACTIVE
field.description: Enables the delays CCLK_DRV_PHASE and CCLK_SAMPLE_PHASE.

enumeratedValue.name: PH_SHIFT
enumeratedValue.description: Activates phase shift logic. When active, the clock divider is active and phase delays are enabled.

field.name: CCLK_DRV_DELAY
field.description: Programmable delay value by which cclk_in_drv is delayed with regard to cclk_in.

field.name: CCLK_DRV_DELAY_ACTIVE
field.description: Enables drive delay, as controlled by the CCLK_DRV_DELAY field.

field.name: CCLK_SAMPLE_DELAY
field.description: Programmable delay value by which cclk_in_sample is delayed with regard to cclk_in.

field.name: CCLK_SAMPLE_DELAY_ACTIVE
field.description: Enables sample delay, as controlled by the CCLK_SAMPLE_DELAY field.

field.name: SELR
field.description: Bandwidth select R value.

field.name: SELI
field.description: Bandwidth select I value.

field.name: SELP
field.description: Bandwidth select P value.

field.name: BYPASSPLL
field.description: Bypass PLL input clock is sent directly to the PLL output (default).

enumeratedValue.name: BYPASSED
enumeratedValue.description: PLL input clock is sent directly to the PLL output.

field.name: BYPASSPOSTDIV2
field.description: bypass of the divide-by-2 divider in the post-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: USED
enumeratedValue.description: use the divide-by-2 divider in the post-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: BYPASSED
enumeratedValue.description: bypass of the divide-by-2 divider in the post-divider.

field.name: LIMUPOFF
field.description: limup_off = 1 in spread spectrum and fractional PLL applications.

field.name: BWDIRECT
field.description: control of the bandwidth of the PLL.

enumeratedValue.name: SYNC
enumeratedValue.description: the bandwidth is changed synchronously with the feedback-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: DIRECT
enumeratedValue.description: modify the bandwidth of the PLL directly.

register.name: PLL0SSCG0
register.description: PLL0 Spread Spectrum Wrapper control register 0

field.name: MD_LBS
field.description: input word of the wrapper bit 31 to 0.

register.name: PLL0SSCG1
register.description: PLL0 Spread Spectrum Wrapper control register 1

field.name: MD_MBS
field.description: input word of the wrapper bit 32.

field.name: MD_REQ
field.description: md change request.

field.name: MF
field.description: programmable modulation frequency fm = Fref/Nss mf[2:0] = 000 => Nss=512 (fm ~ 3.

field.name: MR
field.description: programmable frequency modulation depth Dfmodpk-pk = Fref*kss/Fcco = kss/(2*md[32:25]dec) mr[2:0] = 000 => kss = 0 (no spread spectrum) mr[2:0] = 001 => kss ~ 1 mr[2:0] = 010 => kss ~ 1.

field.name: MC
field.description: modulation waveform control Compensation for low pass filtering of the PLL to get a triangular modulation at the output of the PLL, giving a flat frequency spectrum.

field.name: MDIV_EXT
field.description: to select an external mdiv value.

field.name: MREQ
field.description: to select an external mreq value.

field.name: DITHER
field.description: dithering between two modulation frequencies in a random way or in a pseudo random way (white noise), in order to decrease the probability that the modulated waveform will occur with the same phase on a particular point on the screen.

field.name: SEL_EXT
field.description: to select mdiv_ext and mreq_ext sel_ext = 0: mdiv ~ md[32:0], mreq = 1 sel_ext = 1 : mdiv = mdiv_ext, mreq = mreq_ext.

field.description: Enable FRO 1MHz clock for Frequency Measure module and for UTICK.

field.name: FRO12MHZ_FREQM_ENA
field.description: Enable FRO 12MHz clock for Frequency Measure module.

field.name: FRO_HF_FREQM_ENA
field.description: Enable FRO 96MHz clock for Frequency Measure module.

field.name: CLKIN_ENA
field.description: Enable clock_in clock for clock module.

field.name: FRO1MHZ_CLK_ENA
field.description: Enable FRO 1MHz clock for clock muxing in clock gen.

field.name: ANA_FRO12M_CLK_ENA
field.description: Enable FRO 12MHz clock for analog control of the FRO 192MHz.

field.name: XO_CAL_CLK_ENA
field.description: Enable clock for cristal oscilator calibration.

field.name: PLU_DEGLITCH_CLK_ENA
field.description: Enable clocks FRO_1MHz and FRO_12MHz for PLU deglitching.

field.name: INT_ENABLE
field.description: Analog Comparator interrupt enable control:.

field.name: INT_CLEAR
field.description: Analog Comparator interrupt clear.

field.name: INT_CTRL
field.description: Comparator interrupt type selector:.

enumeratedValue.name: EDGE_DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: The analog comparator interrupt edge sensitive is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: LVL_DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: The analog comparator interrupt level sensitive is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: EDGE_RISING
enumeratedValue.description: analog comparator interrupt is rising edge sensitive.

enumeratedValue.name: LVL_HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: Analog Comparator interrupt is high level sensitive.

enumeratedValue.name: EDGE_FALLING
enumeratedValue.description: analog comparator interrupt is falling edge sensitive.

enumeratedValue.name: LVL_LOW
enumeratedValue.description: Analog Comparator interrupt is low level sensitive.

enumeratedValue.name: EDGE_BOTH
enumeratedValue.description: analog comparator interrupt is rising and falling edge sensitive.

enumeratedValue.name: LVL_DIS2
enumeratedValue.description: The analog comparator interrupt level sensitive is disabled.

field.name: INT_SOURCE
field.description: Select which Analog comparator output (filtered our un-filtered) is used for interrupt detection.

enumeratedValue.name: FILTER_INT
enumeratedValue.description: Select Analog Comparator filtered output as input for interrupt detection.

enumeratedValue.name: RAW_INT
enumeratedValue.description: Select Analog Comparator raw output (unfiltered) as input for interrupt detection. Must be used when Analog comparator is used as wake up source in Power down mode.

field.name: STATUS
field.description: Interrupt status BEFORE Interrupt Enable.

field.name: INT_STATUS
field.description: Interrupt status AFTER Interrupt Enable.

field.name: VAL
field.description: comparator analog output.

field.name: SSEL
field.description: Supply Selection bit.

field.name: FILTEROFF
field.description: Controls input glitch filter.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Filter enabled. Noise pulses below approximately 10 ns are filtered out.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Filter disabled. No input filtering is done.

field.name: ECS
field.description: Pull-up current source enable in IIC mode.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. IO is in open drain.

field.name: EGP
field.description: Controls slew rate of I2C pad.

field.name: I2CFILTER
field.description: Configures I2C features for standard mode, fast mode, and Fast Mode Plus operation.

enumeratedValue.name: FAST_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: I2C 50 ns glitch filter enabled. Typically used for Fast-mode and Fast-mode Plus I2C.

enumeratedValue.name: STANDARD_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: I2C 10 ns glitch filter enabled. Typically used for Standard-mode I2C.

field.name: INT
field.description: Group interrupt status. This bit is cleared by writing a one to it. Writing zero has no effect.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_REQUEST
enumeratedValue.description: No request. No interrupt request is pending.

enumeratedValue.name: REQUEST_ACTIVE
enumeratedValue.description: Request active. Interrupt request is active.

field.name: COMB
field.description: Combine enabled inputs for group interrupt

enumeratedValue.name: OR
enumeratedValue.description: Or. OR functionality: A grouped interrupt is generated when any one of the enabled inputs is active (based on its programmed polarity).

enumeratedValue.name: AND
enumeratedValue.description: And. AND functionality: An interrupt is generated when all enabled bits are active (based on their programmed polarity).

field.name: TRIG
field.description: Group interrupt trigger

register.name: PORT_POL[%s]
register.description: GPIO grouped interrupt port 0 polarity register

field.name: POL
field.description: Configure pin polarity of port m pins for group interrupt. Bit n corresponds to pin PIOm_n of port m. 0 = the pin is active LOW. If the level on this pin is LOW, the pin contributes to the group interrupt. 1 = the pin is active HIGH. If the level on this pin is HIGH, the pin contributes to the group interrupt.

register.name: PORT_ENA[%s]
register.description: GPIO grouped interrupt port 0 enable register

field.name: ENA
field.description: Enable port 0 pin for group interrupt. Bit n corresponds to pin Pm_n of port m. 0 = the port 0 pin is disabled and does not contribute to the grouped interrupt. 1 = the port 0 pin is enabled and contributes to the grouped interrupt.

field.name: PMODE
field.description: Selects the interrupt mode for each pin interrupt. Bit n configures the pin interrupt selected in PINTSELn. 0 = Edge sensitive 1 = Level sensitive

register.name: IENR
register.description: Pin interrupt level or rising edge interrupt enable register

field.name: ENRL
field.description: Enables the rising edge or level interrupt for each pin interrupt. Bit n configures the pin interrupt selected in PINTSELn. 0 = Disable rising edge or level interrupt. 1 = Enable rising edge or level interrupt.

register.name: SIENR
register.description: Pin interrupt level or rising edge interrupt set register

field.name: SETENRL
field.description: Ones written to this address set bits in the IENR, thus enabling interrupts. Bit n sets bit n in the IENR register. 0 = No operation. 1 = Enable rising edge or level interrupt.

register.name: CIENR
register.description: Pin interrupt level (rising edge interrupt) clear register

field.name: CENRL
field.description: Ones written to this address clear bits in the IENR, thus disabling the interrupts. Bit n clears bit n in the IENR register. 0 = No operation. 1 = Disable rising edge or level interrupt.

register.name: IENF
register.description: Pin interrupt active level or falling edge interrupt enable register

field.name: ENAF
field.description: Enables the falling edge or configures the active level interrupt for each pin interrupt. Bit n configures the pin interrupt selected in PINTSELn. 0 = Disable falling edge interrupt or set active interrupt level LOW. 1 = Enable falling edge interrupt enabled or set active interrupt level HIGH.

register.name: SIENF
register.description: Pin interrupt active level or falling edge interrupt set register

field.name: SETENAF
field.description: Ones written to this address set bits in the IENF, thus enabling interrupts. Bit n sets bit n in the IENF register. 0 = No operation. 1 = Select HIGH-active interrupt or enable falling edge interrupt.

register.name: CIENF
register.description: Pin interrupt active level or falling edge interrupt clear register

field.name: CENAF
field.description: Ones written to this address clears bits in the IENF, thus disabling interrupts. Bit n clears bit n in the IENF register. 0 = No operation. 1 = LOW-active interrupt selected or falling edge interrupt disabled.

field.name: RDET
field.description: Rising edge detect. Bit n detects the rising edge of the pin selected in PINTSELn. Read 0: No rising edge has been detected on this pin since Reset or the last time a one was written to this bit. Write 0: no operation. Read 1: a rising edge has been detected since Reset or the last time a one was written to this bit. Write 1: clear rising edge detection for this pin.

field.name: FDET
field.description: Falling edge detect. Bit n detects the falling edge of the pin selected in PINTSELn. Read 0: No falling edge has been detected on this pin since Reset or the last time a one was written to this bit. Write 0: no operation. Read 1: a falling edge has been detected since Reset or the last time a one was written to this bit. Write 1: clear falling edge detection for this pin.

field.name: PSTAT
field.description: Pin interrupt status. Bit n returns the status, clears the edge interrupt, or inverts the active level of the pin selected in PINTSELn. Read 0: interrupt is not being requested for this interrupt pin. Write 0: no operation. Read 1: interrupt is being requested for this interrupt pin. Write 1 (edge-sensitive): clear rising- and falling-edge detection for this pin. Write 1 (level-sensitive): switch the active level for this pin (in the IENF register).

field.name: SEL_PMATCH
field.description: Specifies whether the 8 pin interrupts are controlled by the pin interrupt function or by the pattern match function.

enumeratedValue.name: PIN_INTERRUPT
enumeratedValue.description: Pin interrupt. Interrupts are driven in response to the standard pin interrupt function.

enumeratedValue.name: PATTERN_MATCH
enumeratedValue.description: Pattern match. Interrupts are driven in response to pattern matches.

field.name: ENA_RXEV
field.description: Enables the RXEV output to the CPU and/or to a GPIO output when the specified boolean expression evaluates to true.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. RXEV output to the CPU is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. RXEV output to the CPU is enabled.

field.name: PMAT
field.description: This field displays the current state of pattern matches. A 1 in any bit of this field indicates that the corresponding product term is matched by the current state of the appropriate inputs.

register.name: PMSRC
register.description: Pattern match interrupt bit-slice source register

field.name: SRC0
field.description: Selects the input source for bit slice 0

enumeratedValue.name: INPUT0
enumeratedValue.description: Input 0. Selects the pin selected in the PINTSEL0 register as the source to bit slice 0.

register.name: PMCFG
register.description: Pattern match interrupt bit slice configuration register

field.name: PROD_ENDPTS0
field.description: Determines whether slice 0 is an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect. Slice 0 is not an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: ENDPOINT
enumeratedValue.description: endpoint. Slice 0 is the endpoint of a product term (minterm). Pin interrupt 0 in the NVIC is raised if the minterm evaluates as true.

field.name: PROD_ENDPTS1
field.description: Determines whether slice 1 is an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect. Slice 1 is not an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: ENDPOINT
enumeratedValue.description: endpoint. Slice 1 is the endpoint of a product term (minterm). Pin interrupt 1 in the NVIC is raised if the minterm evaluates as true.

field.name: PROD_ENDPTS2
field.description: Determines whether slice 2 is an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect. Slice 2 is not an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: ENDPOINT
enumeratedValue.description: endpoint. Slice 2 is the endpoint of a product term (minterm). Pin interrupt 2 in the NVIC is raised if the minterm evaluates as true.

field.name: PROD_ENDPTS3
field.description: Determines whether slice 3 is an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect. Slice 3 is not an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: ENDPOINT
enumeratedValue.description: endpoint. Slice 3 is the endpoint of a product term (minterm). Pin interrupt 3 in the NVIC is raised if the minterm evaluates as true.

field.name: PROD_ENDPTS4
field.description: Determines whether slice 4 is an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect. Slice 4 is not an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: ENDPOINT
enumeratedValue.description: endpoint. Slice 4 is the endpoint of a product term (minterm). Pin interrupt 4 in the NVIC is raised if the minterm evaluates as true.

field.name: PROD_ENDPTS5
field.description: Determines whether slice 5 is an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect. Slice 5 is not an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: ENDPOINT
enumeratedValue.description: endpoint. Slice 5 is the endpoint of a product term (minterm). Pin interrupt 5 in the NVIC is raised if the minterm evaluates as true.

field.name: PROD_ENDPTS6
field.description: Determines whether slice 6 is an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect. Slice 6 is not an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: ENDPOINT
enumeratedValue.description: endpoint. Slice 6 is the endpoint of a product term (minterm). Pin interrupt 6 in the NVIC is raised if the minterm evaluates as true.

field.name: CFG0
field.description: Specifies the match contribution condition for bit slice 0.

enumeratedValue.name: CONSTANT_HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: Constant HIGH. This bit slice always contributes to a product term match.

enumeratedValue.name: STICKY_RISING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Sticky rising edge. Match occurs if a rising edge on the specified input has occurred since the last time the edge detection for this bit slice was cleared. This bit is only cleared when the PMCFG or the PMSRC registers are written to.

enumeratedValue.name: STICKY_FALLING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Sticky falling edge. Match occurs if a falling edge on the specified input has occurred since the last time the edge detection for this bit slice was cleared. This bit is only cleared when the PMCFG or the PMSRC registers are written to.

enumeratedValue.name: STICKY_RISING_FALLING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Sticky rising or falling edge. Match occurs if either a rising or falling edge on the specified input has occurred since the last time the edge detection for this bit slice was cleared. This bit is only cleared when the PMCFG or the PMSRC registers are written to.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH_LEVEL
enumeratedValue.description: High level. Match (for this bit slice) occurs when there is a high level on the input specified for this bit slice in the PMSRC register.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW_LEVEL
enumeratedValue.description: Low level. Match occurs when there is a low level on the specified input.

enumeratedValue.name: CONSTANT_ZERO
enumeratedValue.description: Constant 0. This bit slice never contributes to a match (should be used to disable any unused bit slices).

enumeratedValue.name: EVENT
enumeratedValue.description: Event. Non-sticky rising or falling edge. Match occurs on an event - i.e. when either a rising or falling edge is first detected on the specified input (this is a non-sticky version of value 0x3) . This bit is cleared after one clock cycle.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW_LEVEL

enumeratedValue.name: STICKY_RISING_FALLING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Sticky rising or falling edge. Match occurs if either a rising or falling edge on the specified input has occurred since the last time the edge detection for this bit slice was cleared. This bit is only cleared when the PMCFG or the PMSRC registers are written to.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH_LEVEL
enumeratedValue.description: High level. Match (for this bit slice) occurs when there is a high level on the input specified for this bit slice in the PMSRC register.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW_LEVEL
enumeratedValue.description: Low level. Match occurs when there is a low level on the specified input.

enumeratedValue.name: CONSTANT_ZERO
enumeratedValue.description: Constant 0. This bit slice never contributes to a match (should be used to disable any unused bit slices).

enumeratedValue.name: EVENT
enumeratedValue.description: Event. Non-sticky rising or falling edge. Match occurs on an event - i.e. when either a rising or falling edge is first detected on the specified input (this is a non-sticky version of value 0x3) . This bit is cleared after one clock cycle.

field.name: CFG7
field.description: Specifies the match contribution condition for bit slice 7.

enumeratedValue.name: CONSTANT_HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: Constant HIGH. This bit slice always contributes to a product term match.

enumeratedValue.name: STICKY_RISING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Sticky rising edge. Match occurs if a rising edge on the specified input has occurred since the last time the edge detection for this bit slice was cleared. This bit is only cleared when the PMCFG or the PMSRC registers are written to.

enumeratedValue.name: STICKY_FALLING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Sticky falling edge. Match occurs if a falling edge on the specified input has occurred since the last time the edge detection for this bit slice was cleared. This bit is only cleared when the PMCFG or the PMSRC registers are written to.

enumeratedValue.name: STICKY_RISING_FALLING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Sticky rising or falling edge. Match occurs if either a rising or falling edge on the specified input has occurred since the last time the edge detection for this bit slice was cleared. This bit is only cleared when the PMCFG or the PMSRC registers are written to.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH_LEVEL
enumeratedValue.description: High level. Match (for this bit slice) occurs when there is a high level on the input specified for this bit slice in the PMSRC register.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW_LEVEL
enumeratedValue.description: Low level. Match occurs when there is a low level on the specified input.

enumeratedValue.name: CONSTANT_ZERO
enumeratedValue.description: Constant 0. This bit slice never contributes to a match (should be used to disable any unused bit slices).

enumeratedValue.name: EVENT
enumeratedValue.description: Event. Non-sticky rising or falling edge. Match occurs on an event - i.e. when either a rising or falling edge is first detected on the specified input (this is a non-sticky version of value 0x3) . This bit is cleared after one clock cycle.

register.name: DMA1_ITRIG_INMUX[%s]
register.description: Trigger select register for DMA1 channel

field.name: INP
field.description: Trigger input number (decimal value) for DMA channel n (n = 0 to 9).

register.name: DMA1_OTRIG_INMUX[%s]
register.description: DMA1 output trigger selection to become DMA1 trigger

field.name: INP
field.description: DMA trigger output number (decimal value) for DMA channel n (n = 0 to 9).

field.name: REQ_ENA
field.description: Controls the 23 request inputs of DMA0. If bit i is '1' the DMA request input #i is enabled.

register.name: DMA0_REQ_ENA_SET
register.description: Set one or several bits in DMA0_REQ_ENA register

field.name: SET
field.description: Write : If bit #i = 1, bit #i in DMA0_REQ_ENA register is set to 1; if bit #i = 0 , no change in DMA0_REQ_ENA register

register.name: DMA0_REQ_ENA_CLR
register.description: Clear one or several bits in DMA0_REQ_ENA register

field.name: CLR
field.description: Write : If bit #i = 1, bit #i in DMA0_REQ_ENA register is reset to 0; if bit #i = 0 , no change in DMA0_REQ_ENA register

field.name: REQ_ENA
field.description: Controls the 10 request inputs of DMA1. If bit i is '1' the DMA request input #i is enabled.

register.name: DMA1_REQ_ENA_SET
register.description: Set one or several bits in DMA1_REQ_ENA register

field.name: SET
field.description: Write : If bit #i = 1, bit #i in DMA1_REQ_ENA register is set to 1; if bit #i = 0 , no change in DMA1_REQ_ENA register

register.name: DMA1_REQ_ENA_CLR
register.description: Clear one or several bits in DMA1_REQ_ENA register

field.name: CLR
field.description: Write : If bit #i = 1, bit #i in DMA1_REQ_ENA register is reset to 0; if bit #i = 0 , no change in DMA1_REQ_ENA register

field.name: ITRIG_ENA
field.description: Controls the 22 trigger inputs of DMA0. If bit i is '1' the DMA trigger input #i is enabled.

register.name: DMA0_ITRIG_ENA_SET
register.description: Set one or several bits in DMA0_ITRIG_ENA register

field.name: SET
field.description: Write : If bit #i = 1, bit #i in DMA0_ITRIG_ENA register is set to 1; if bit #i = 0 , no change in DMA0_ITRIG_ENA register

register.name: DMA0_ITRIG_ENA_CLR
register.description: Clear one or several bits in DMA0_ITRIG_ENA register

field.name: CLR
field.description: Write : If bit #i = 1, bit #i in DMA0_ITRIG_ENA register is reset to 0; if bit #i = 0 , no change in DMA0_ITRIG_ENA register

field.name: ITRIG_ENA
field.description: Controls the 15 trigger inputs of DMA1. If bit i is '1' the DMA trigger input #i is enabled.

register.name: DMA1_ITRIG_ENA_SET
register.description: Set one or several bits in DMA1_ITRIG_ENA register

field.name: SET
field.description: Write : If bit #i = 1, bit #i in DMA1_ITRIG_ENA register is set to 1; if bit #i = 0 , no change in DMA1_ITRIG_ENA register

register.name: DMA1_ITRIG_ENA_CLR
register.description: Clear one or several bits in DMA1_ITRIG_ENA register

field.name: CLR
field.description: Write : If bit #i = 1, bit #i in DMA1_ITRIG_ENA register is reset to 0; if bit #i = 0 , no change in DMA1_ITRIG_ENA register

register.name: IR
register.description: Interrupt Register. The IR can be written to clear interrupts. The IR can be read to identify which of eight possible interrupt sources are pending.

field.name: MR0INT
field.description: Interrupt flag for match channel 0.

field.name: MR1INT
field.description: Interrupt flag for match channel 1.

field.name: MR2INT
field.description: Interrupt flag for match channel 2.

field.name: MR3INT
field.description: Interrupt flag for match channel 3.

field.name: CR0INT
field.description: Interrupt flag for capture channel 0 event.

field.name: CR1INT
field.description: Interrupt flag for capture channel 1 event.

field.name: CR2INT
field.description: Interrupt flag for capture channel 2 event.

field.name: CR3INT
field.description: Interrupt flag for capture channel 3 event.

register.name: TCR
register.description: Timer Control Register. The TCR is used to control the Timer Counter functions. The Timer Counter can be disabled or reset through the TCR.

field.name: CEN
field.description: Counter enable.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The Timer Counter and Prescale Counter are enabled.

field.name: CRST
field.description: Counter reset.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The Timer Counter and the Prescale Counter are synchronously reset on the next positive edge of the APB bus clock. The counters remain reset until TCR[1] is returned to zero.

field.name: TCVAL
field.description: Timer counter value.

field.name: PRVAL
field.description: Prescale counter value.

field.name: PCVAL
field.description: Prescale counter value.

field.name: MR0I
field.description: Interrupt on MR0: an interrupt is generated when MR0 matches the value in the TC.

field.name: MR0R
field.description: Reset on MR0: the TC will be reset if MR0 matches it.

field.name: MR0S
field.description: Stop on MR0: the TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR0 matches the TC.

field.name: MR1I
field.description: Interrupt on MR1: an interrupt is generated when MR1 matches the value in the TC.

field.name: MR1R
field.description: Reset on MR1: the TC will be reset if MR1 matches it.

field.name: MR1S
field.description: Stop on MR1: the TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR1 matches the TC.

field.name: MR2I
field.description: Interrupt on MR2: an interrupt is generated when MR2 matches the value in the TC.

field.name: MR2R
field.description: Reset on MR2: the TC will be reset if MR2 matches it.

field.name: MR2S
field.description: Stop on MR2: the TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR2 matches the TC.

field.name: MR3I
field.description: Interrupt on MR3: an interrupt is generated when MR3 matches the value in the TC.

field.name: MR3R
field.description: Reset on MR3: the TC will be reset if MR3 matches it.

field.name: MR3S
field.description: Stop on MR3: the TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR3 matches the TC.

field.name: MR0RL
field.description: Reload MR0 with the contents of the Match 0 Shadow Register when the TC is reset to zero (either via a match event or a write to bit 1 of the TCR).

field.name: MR1RL
field.description: Reload MR1 with the contents of the Match 1 Shadow Register when the TC is reset to zero (either via a match event or a write to bit 1 of the TCR).

field.name: MR2RL
field.description: Reload MR2 with the contents of the Match 2 Shadow Register when the TC is reset to zero (either via a match event or a write to bit 1 of the TCR).

field.name: MR3RL
field.description: Reload MR3 with the contents of the Match 3 Shadow Register when the TC is reset to zero (either via a match event or a write to bit 1 of the TCR).

register.name: MR[%s]
register.description: Match Register . MR can be enabled through the MCR to reset the TC, stop both the TC and PC, and/or generate an interrupt every time MR matches the TC.

field.name: MATCH
field.description: Timer counter match value.

register.name: CCR
register.description: Capture Control Register. The CCR controls which edges of the capture inputs are used to load the Capture Registers and whether or not an interrupt is generated when a capture takes place.

field.name: CAP0RE
field.description: Rising edge of capture channel 0: a sequence of 0 then 1 causes CR0 to be loaded with the contents of TC. 0 = disabled. 1 = enabled.

field.name: CAP0FE
field.description: Falling edge of capture channel 0: a sequence of 1 then 0 causes CR0 to be loaded with the contents of TC. 0 = disabled. 1 = enabled.

field.name: CAP0I
field.description: Generate interrupt on channel 0 capture event: a CR0 load generates an interrupt.

field.name: CAP1RE
field.description: Rising edge of capture channel 1: a sequence of 0 then 1 causes CR1 to be loaded with the contents of TC. 0 = disabled. 1 = enabled.

field.name: CAP1FE
field.description: Falling edge of capture channel 1: a sequence of 1 then 0 causes CR1 to be loaded with the contents of TC. 0 = disabled. 1 = enabled.

field.name: CAP1I
field.description: Generate interrupt on channel 1 capture event: a CR1 load generates an interrupt.

field.name: CAP2RE
field.description: Rising edge of capture channel 2: a sequence of 0 then 1 causes CR2 to be loaded with the contents of TC. 0 = disabled. 1 = enabled.

field.name: CAP2FE
field.description: Falling edge of capture channel 2: a sequence of 1 then 0 causes CR2 to be loaded with the contents of TC. 0 = disabled. 1 = enabled.

field.name: CAP2I
field.description: Generate interrupt on channel 2 capture event: a CR2 load generates an interrupt.

field.name: CAP3RE
field.description: Rising edge of capture channel 3: a sequence of 0 then 1 causes CR3 to be loaded with the contents of TC. 0 = disabled. 1 = enabled.

field.name: CAP3FE
field.description: Falling edge of capture channel 3: a sequence of 1 then 0 causes CR3 to be loaded with the contents of TC. 0 = disabled. 1 = enabled.

field.name: CAP3I
field.description: Generate interrupt on channel 3 capture event: a CR3 load generates an interrupt.

register.name: CR[%s]
register.description: Capture Register . CR is loaded with the value of TC when there is an event on the CAPn. input.

field.name: CAP
field.description: Timer counter capture value.

register.name: EMR
register.description: External Match Register. The EMR controls the match function and the external match pins.

field.name: EM0
field.description: External Match 0. This bit reflects the state of output MAT0, whether or not this output is connected to a pin. When a match occurs between the TC and MR0, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing, as selected by EMR[5:4]. This bit is driven to the MAT pins if the match function is selected via IOCON. 0 = LOW. 1 = HIGH.

field.name: EM1
field.description: External Match 1. This bit reflects the state of output MAT1, whether or not this output is connected to a pin. When a match occurs between the TC and MR1, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing, as selected by EMR[7:6]. This bit is driven to the MAT pins if the match function is selected via IOCON. 0 = LOW. 1 = HIGH.

field.name: EM2
field.description: External Match 2. This bit reflects the state of output MAT2, whether or not this output is connected to a pin. When a match occurs between the TC and MR2, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing, as selected by EMR[9:8]. This bit is driven to the MAT pins if the match function is selected via IOCON. 0 = LOW. 1 = HIGH.

field.name: EM3
field.description: External Match 3. This bit reflects the state of output MAT3, whether or not this output is connected to a pin. When a match occurs between the TC and MR3, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing, as selected by MR[11:10]. This bit is driven to the MAT pins if the match function is selected via IOCON. 0 = LOW. 1 = HIGH.

field.name: EMC0
field.description: External Match Control 0. Determines the functionality of External Match 0.

enumeratedValue.name: CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Clear. Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (MAT0 pin is LOW if pinned out).

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Set. Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (MAT0 pin is HIGH if pinned out).

enumeratedValue.name: TOGGLE
enumeratedValue.description: Toggle. Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

field.name: EMC1
field.description: External Match Control 1. Determines the functionality of External Match 1.

enumeratedValue.name: CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Clear. Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (MAT1 pin is LOW if pinned out).

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Set. Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (MAT1 pin is HIGH if pinned out).

enumeratedValue.name: TOGGLE
enumeratedValue.description: Toggle. Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

field.name: EMC2
field.description: External Match Control 2. Determines the functionality of External Match 2.

enumeratedValue.name: CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Clear. Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (MAT2 pin is LOW if pinned out).

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Set. Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (MAT2 pin is HIGH if pinned out).

enumeratedValue.name: TOGGLE
enumeratedValue.description: Toggle. Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

field.name: EMC3
field.description: External Match Control 3. Determines the functionality of External Match 3.

enumeratedValue.name: CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Clear. Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (MAT3 pin is LOW if pinned out).

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Set. Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (MAT3 pin is HIGH if pinned out).

enumeratedValue.name: TOGGLE
enumeratedValue.description: Toggle. Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

register.name: CTCR
register.description: Count Control Register. The CTCR selects between Timer and Counter mode, and in Counter mode selects the signal and edge(s) for counting.

field.name: CTMODE
field.description: Counter/Timer Mode This field selects which rising APB bus clock edges can increment Timer's Prescale Counter (PC), or clear PC and increment Timer Counter (TC). Timer Mode: the TC is incremented when the Prescale Counter matches the Prescale Register.

enumeratedValue.name: TIMER
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Mode. Incremented every rising APB bus clock edge.

enumeratedValue.name: COUNTER_RISING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Counter Mode rising edge. TC is incremented on rising edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

enumeratedValue.name: COUNTER_FALLING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Counter Mode falling edge. TC is incremented on falling edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

enumeratedValue.name: COUNTER_DUAL_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Counter Mode dual edge. TC is incremented on both edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

field.name: CINSEL
field.description: Count Input Select When bits 1:0 in this register are not 00, these bits select which CAP pin is sampled for clocking. Note: If Counter mode is selected for a particular CAPn input in the CTCR, the 3 bits for that input in the Capture Control Register (CCR) must be programmed as 000. However, capture and/or interrupt can be selected for the other 3 CAPn inputs in the same timer.

field.name: ENCC
field.description: Setting this bit to 1 enables clearing of the timer and the prescaler when the capture-edge event specified in bits 7:5 occurs.

field.name: SELCC
field.description: Edge select. When bit 4 is 1, these bits select which capture input edge will cause the timer and prescaler to be cleared. These bits have no effect when bit 4 is low. Values 0x2 to 0x3 and 0x6 to 0x7 are reserved.

enumeratedValue.name: CHANNEL_0_RISING
enumeratedValue.description: Channel 0 Rising Edge. Rising edge of the signal on capture channel 0 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set).

enumeratedValue.name: CHANNEL_0_FALLING
enumeratedValue.description: Channel 0 Falling Edge. Falling edge of the signal on capture channel 0 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set).

enumeratedValue.name: CHANNEL_1_RISING
enumeratedValue.description: Channel 1 Rising Edge. Rising edge of the signal on capture channel 1 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set).

enumeratedValue.name: CHANNEL_1_FALLING
enumeratedValue.description: Channel 1 Falling Edge. Falling edge of the signal on capture channel 1 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set).

enumeratedValue.name: CHANNEL_2_RISING
enumeratedValue.description: Channel 2 Rising Edge. Rising edge of the signal on capture channel 2 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set).

enumeratedValue.name: CHANNEL_2_FALLING
enumeratedValue.description: Channel 2 Falling Edge. Falling edge of the signal on capture channel 2 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set).

register.name: PWMC
register.description: PWM Control Register. This register enables PWM mode for the external match pins.

field.name: PWMEN0
field.description: PWM mode enable for channel0.

enumeratedValue.name: MATCH
enumeratedValue.description: Match. CTIMERn_MAT0 is controlled by EM0.

enumeratedValue.name: PWM
enumeratedValue.description: PWM. PWM mode is enabled for CTIMERn_MAT0.

field.name: PWMEN1
field.description: PWM mode enable for channel1.

enumeratedValue.name: MATCH
enumeratedValue.description: Match. CTIMERn_MAT01 is controlled by EM1.

enumeratedValue.name: PWM
enumeratedValue.description: PWM. PWM mode is enabled for CTIMERn_MAT1.

field.name: PWMEN2
field.description: PWM mode enable for channel2.

enumeratedValue.name: MATCH
enumeratedValue.description: Match. CTIMERn_MAT2 is controlled by EM2.

enumeratedValue.name: PWM
enumeratedValue.description: PWM. PWM mode is enabled for CTIMERn_MAT2.

field.name: PWMEN3
field.description: PWM mode enable for channel3. Note: It is recommended to use match channel 3 to set the PWM cycle.

enumeratedValue.name: MATCH
enumeratedValue.description: Match. CTIMERn_MAT3 is controlled by EM3.

enumeratedValue.name: PWM
enumeratedValue.description: PWM. PWM mode is enabled for CT132Bn_MAT3.

field.name: SHADOWW
field.description: Timer counter match shadow value.

register.name: MOD
register.description: Watchdog mode register. This register contains the basic mode and status of the Watchdog Timer.

field.name: WDEN
field.description: Watchdog enable bit. Once this bit is set to one and a watchdog feed is performed, the watchdog timer will run permanently.

enumeratedValue.name: STOP
enumeratedValue.description: Stop. The watchdog timer is stopped.

enumeratedValue.name: RUN
enumeratedValue.description: Run. The watchdog timer is running.

field.name: WDRESET
field.description: Watchdog reset enable bit. Once this bit has been written with a 1 it cannot be re-written with a 0.

enumeratedValue.name: INTERRUPT
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt. A watchdog time-out will not cause a chip reset.

enumeratedValue.name: RESET
enumeratedValue.description: Reset. A watchdog time-out will cause a chip reset.

field.name: WDTOF
field.description: Watchdog time-out flag. Set when the watchdog timer times out, by a feed error, or by events associated with WDPROTECT. Cleared by software writing a 0 to this bit position. Causes a chip reset if WDRESET = 1.

field.name: WDINT
field.description: Warning interrupt flag. Set when the timer is at or below the value in WDWARNINT. Cleared by software writing a 1 to this bit position. Note that this bit cannot be cleared while the WARNINT value is equal to the value of the TV register. This can occur if the value of WARNINT is 0 and the WDRESET bit is 0 when TV decrements to 0.

field.name: WDPROTECT
field.description: Watchdog update mode. This bit can be set once by software and is only cleared by a reset.

enumeratedValue.name: FLEXIBLE
enumeratedValue.description: Flexible. The watchdog time-out value (TC) can be changed at any time.

enumeratedValue.name: THRESHOLD
enumeratedValue.description: Threshold. The watchdog time-out value (TC) can be changed only after the counter is below the value of WDWARNINT and WDWINDOW.

register.name: TC
register.description: Watchdog timer constant register. This 24-bit register determines the time-out value.

field.name: COUNT
field.description: Watchdog time-out value.

register.name: FEED
register.description: Watchdog feed sequence register. Writing 0xAA followed by 0x55 to this register reloads the Watchdog timer with the value contained in TC.

field.name: FEED
field.description: Feed value should be 0xAA followed by 0x55.

register.name: TV
register.description: Watchdog timer value register. This 24-bit register reads out the current value of the Watchdog timer.

field.name: COUNT
field.description: Counter timer value.

field.name: WARNINT
field.description: Watchdog warning interrupt compare value.

field.name: WINDOW
field.description: Watchdog window value.

register.name: INTVAL
register.description: MRT Time interval value register. This value is loaded into the TIMER register.

field.name: IVALUE
field.description: Time interval load value. This value is loaded into the TIMERn register and the MRT channel n starts counting down from IVALUE -1. If the timer is idle, writing a non-zero value to this bit field starts the timer immediately. If the timer is running, writing a zero to this bit field does the following: If LOAD = 1, the timer stops immediately. If LOAD = 0, the timer stops at the end of the time interval.

field.name: LOAD
field.description: Determines how the timer interval value IVALUE -1 is loaded into the TIMERn register. This bit is write-only. Reading this bit always returns 0.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_FORCE_LOAD
enumeratedValue.description: No force load. The load from the INTVALn register to the TIMERn register is processed at the end of the time interval if the repeat mode is selected.

enumeratedValue.name: FORCE_LOAD
enumeratedValue.description: Force load. The INTVALn interval value IVALUE -1 is immediately loaded into the TIMERn register while TIMERn is running.

register.name: TIMER
register.description: MRT Timer register. This register reads the value of the down-counter.

field.name: VALUE
field.description: Holds the current timer value of the down-counter. The initial value of the TIMERn register is loaded as IVALUE - 1 from the INTVALn register either at the end of the time interval or immediately in the following cases: INTVALn register is updated in the idle state. INTVALn register is updated with LOAD = 1. When the timer is in idle state, reading this bit fields returns -1 (0x00FF FFFF).

register.name: CTRL
register.description: MRT Control register. This register controls the MRT modes.

field.name: INTEN
field.description: Enable the TIMERn interrupt.

field.name: MODE
field.description: Selects timer mode.

field.name: INTFLAG
field.description: Monitors the interrupt flag.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_PENDING_INTERRUPT
enumeratedValue.description: No pending interrupt. Writing a zero is equivalent to no operation.

enumeratedValue.name: PENDING_INTERRUPT
enumeratedValue.description: Pending interrupt. The interrupt is pending because TIMERn has reached the end of the time interval. If the INTEN bit in the CONTROLn is also set to 1, the interrupt for timer channel n and the global interrupt are raised. Writing a 1 to this bit clears the interrupt request.

field.name: RUN
field.description: Indicates the state of TIMERn. This bit is read-only.

field.name: INUSE
field.description: Channel In Use flag. Operating details depend on the MULTITASK bit in the MODCFG register, and affects the use of IDLE_CH. See Idle channel register for details of the two operating modes.

enumeratedValue.name: NO
enumeratedValue.description: This channel is not in use.

register.name: MODCFG
register.description: Module Configuration register. This register provides information about this particular MRT instance, and allows choosing an overall mode for the idle channel feature.

field.name: NOC
field.description: Identifies the number of channels in this MRT.(4 channels on this device.)

field.name: NOB
field.description: Identifies the number of timer bits in this MRT. (24 bits wide on this device.)

field.name: MULTITASK
field.description: Selects the operating mode for the INUSE flags and the IDLE_CH register.

enumeratedValue.name: HARDWARE_STATUS_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware status mode. In this mode, the INUSE(n) flags for all channels are reset.

register.name: IDLE_CH
register.description: Idle channel register. This register returns the number of the first idle channel.

field.name: CHAN
field.description: Idle channel. Reading the CHAN bits, returns the lowest idle timer channel. The number is positioned such that it can be used as an offset from the MRT base address in order to access the registers for the allocated channel. If all timer channels are running, CHAN = 0xF. See text above for more details.

field.name: GFLAG0
field.description: Monitors the interrupt flag of TIMER0.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_PENDING_INTERRUPT
enumeratedValue.description: No pending interrupt. Writing a zero is equivalent to no operation.

enumeratedValue.name: PENDING_INTERRUPT
enumeratedValue.description: Pending interrupt. The interrupt is pending because TIMER0 has reached the end of the time interval. If the INTEN bit in the CONTROL0 register is also set to 1, the interrupt for timer channel 0 and the global interrupt are raised. Writing a 1 to this bit clears the interrupt request.

field.name: GFLAG1
field.description: Monitors the interrupt flag of TIMER1. See description of channel 0.

field.name: GFLAG2
field.description: Monitors the interrupt flag of TIMER2. See description of channel 0.

field.name: GFLAG3
field.description: Monitors the interrupt flag of TIMER3. See description of channel 0.

field.name: DELAYVAL
field.description: Tick interval value. The delay will be equal to DELAYVAL + 1 periods of the timer clock. The minimum usable value is 1, for a delay of 2 timer clocks. A value of 0 stops the timer.

field.name: REPEAT
field.description: Repeat delay. 0 = One-time delay. 1 = Delay repeats continuously.

field.name: INTR
field.description: Interrupt flag. 0 = No interrupt is pending. 1 = An interrupt is pending. A write of any value to this register clears this flag.

field.name: ACTIVE
field.description: Active flag. 0 = The Micro-Tick Timer is stopped. 1 = The Micro-Tick Timer is currently active.

field.name: CAPEN0
field.description: Enable Capture 0. 1 = Enabled, 0 = Disabled.

field.name: CAPEN1
field.description: Enable Capture 1. 1 = Enabled, 0 = Disabled.

field.name: CAPEN2
field.description: Enable Capture 2. 1 = Enabled, 0 = Disabled.

field.name: CAPEN3
field.description: Enable Capture 3. 1 = Enabled, 0 = Disabled.

field.name: CAPPOL0
field.description: Capture Polarity 0. 0 = Positive edge capture, 1 = Negative edge capture.

field.name: CAPPOL1
field.description: Capture Polarity 1. 0 = Positive edge capture, 1 = Negative edge capture.

field.name: CAPPOL2
field.description: Capture Polarity 2. 0 = Positive edge capture, 1 = Negative edge capture.

field.name: CAPPOL3
field.description: Capture Polarity 3. 0 = Positive edge capture, 1 = Negative edge capture.

field.name: CAPCLR0
field.description: Clear capture 0. Writing 1 to this bit clears the CAP0 register value.

field.name: CAPCLR1
field.description: Clear capture 1. Writing 1 to this bit clears the CAP1 register value.

field.name: CAPCLR2
field.description: Clear capture 2. Writing 1 to this bit clears the CAP2 register value.

field.name: CAPCLR3
field.description: Clear capture 3. Writing 1 to this bit clears the CAP3 register value.

field.name: CAP_VALUE
field.description: Capture value for the related capture event (UTICK_CAPn. Note: the value is 1 lower than the actual value of the Micro-tick Timer at the moment of the capture event.

field.name: VALID
field.description: Capture Valid. When 1, a value has been captured based on a transition of the related UTICK_CAPn pin. Cleared by writing to the related bit in the CAPCLR register.

register.name: ANALOG_CTRL_CFG
register.description: Various Analog blocks configuration (like FRO 192MHz trimmings source ...)

field.name: FRO192M_TRIM_SRC
field.description: FRO192M trimming and 'Enable' source.

enumeratedValue.name: EFUSE
enumeratedValue.description: FRO192M trimming and 'Enable' comes from eFUSE.

enumeratedValue.name: FRO192MCTRL
enumeratedValue.description: FRO192M trimming and 'Enable' comes from FRO192M_CTRL registers.

register.name: ANALOG_CTRL_STATUS
register.description: Analog Macroblock Identity registers, Flash Status registers

field.name: PMU_ID
field.description: Power Management Unit (PMU) Analog macro-bloc identification number : .

field.name: OSC_ID
field.description: Oscillators Analog macro-bloc identification number : .

field.name: FLASH_PWRDWN
field.description: Flash Power Down status.

enumeratedValue.name: PWRUP
enumeratedValue.description: Flash is not in power down mode.

enumeratedValue.name: PWRDWN
enumeratedValue.description: Flash is in power down mode.

field.name: FLASH_INIT_ERROR
field.description: Flash initialization error status.

enumeratedValue.name: ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: At least one error occured during flash initialization..

field.name: FINAL_TEST_DONE_VECT
field.description: Indicates current status of Final Test.

field.name: CAPVAL_SCALE
field.description: Frequency measure result /Frequency measur scale

field.name: PROG
field.description: Set this bit to one to initiate a frequency measurement cycle. Hardware clears this bit when the measurement cycle has completed and there is valid capture data in the CAPVAL field (bits 30:0).

field.name: BIAS_TRIM
field.description: Bias trimming bits (course frequency trimming).

field.name: TEMP_TRIM
field.description: Temperature coefficient trimming bits.

field.name: ENA_12MHZCLK
field.description: 12 MHz clock control.

field.name: ENA_48MHZCLK
field.description: 48 MHz clock control.

field.name: DAC_TRIM
field.description: Curdac trimming bits (fine frequency trimming) This trim is used to adjust the frequency, given that the bias and temperature trim are set.

field.name: USBCLKADJ
field.description: If this bit is set and the USB peripheral is enabled into full speed device mode, the USB block will provide FRO clock adjustments to lock it to the host clock using the SOF packets.

field.name: USBMODCHG
field.description: If this reads as 1 when reading the DAC_TRIM field and USBCLKADJ=1, it should be reread until it is 0.

field.name: ATB_CTRL
field.description: Analog Test Bus control.

field.name: ENA_96MHZCLK
field.description: 96 MHz clock control.

field.name: WRTRIM
field.description: This must be written to 1 to modify the BIAS_TRIM and TEMP_TRIM fields.

field.name: CLK_VALID
field.description: Output clock valid signal. Indicates that CCO clock has settled.

enumeratedValue.name: NOCLKOUT
enumeratedValue.description: No output clock present (None of 12 MHz, 48 MHz or 96 MHz clock is available).

enumeratedValue.name: CLKOUT
enumeratedValue.description: Clock is present (12 MHz, 48 MHz or 96 MHz can be output if they are enable respectively by FRO192M_CTRL.ENA_12MHZCLK/ENA_48MHZCLK/ENA_96MHZCLK).

field.name: ATB_VCTRL
field.description: CCO threshold voltage detector output (signal vcco_ok). Once the CCO voltage crosses the threshold voltage of a SLVT transistor, this output signal will go high. It is also possible to observe the clk_valid signal.

register.name: ADC_CTRL
register.description: General Purpose ADC VBAT Divider branch control

field.name: VBATDIVENABLE
field.description: Switch On/Off VBAT divider branch.

field.name: GM
field.description: Gm value for Xo.

field.name: SLAVE
field.description: Xo in slave mode.

field.name: AMP
field.description: Amplitude selection , Min amp : 001, Max amp : 110.

field.name: OSC_CAP_IN
field.description: Tune capa banks of Crystal 32-MHz input pin

field.name: OSC_CAP_OUT
field.description: Tune capa banks of Crystal 32-MHz output pin

field.name: ACBUF_PASS_ENABLE
field.description: Bypass enable of XO AC buffer enable in pll and top level.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: XO AC buffer bypass is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: XO AC buffer bypass is enabled.

field.name: ENABLE_PLL_USB_OUT
field.description: Enable XO 32 MHz output to USB HS PLL.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: XO 32 MHz output to USB HS PLL is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: XO 32 MHz output to USB HS PLL is enabled.

field.name: ENABLE_SYSTEM_CLK_OUT
field.description: Enable XO 32 MHz output to CPU system.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: XO 32 MHz output to CPU system is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: XO 32 MHz output to CPU system is enabled.

field.name: CAPTESTSTARTSRCSEL
field.description: Source selection for 'xo32k_captest_start' signal.

field.name: CAPTESTSTART
field.description: 1: Start CapTest.

field.name: CAPTESTENABLE
field.description: Enable signal for captest.

field.name: CAPTESTOSCINSEL
field.description: Select the input for test.

field.name: XO_READY
field.description: Indicates XO out frequency statibilty.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_STABLE
enumeratedValue.description: XO output frequency is not yet stable.

register.name: BOD_DCDC_INT_CTRL
register.description: Brown Out Detectors (BoDs) & DCDC interrupts generation control register

field.name: BODVBAT_INT_ENABLE
field.description: BOD VBAT interrupt control.

field.name: BODVBAT_INT_CLEAR
field.description: BOD VBAT interrupt clear.1: Clear the interrupt. Self-cleared bit.

field.name: BODCORE_INT_ENABLE
field.description: BOD CORE interrupt control.

field.name: BODCORE_INT_CLEAR
field.description: BOD CORE interrupt clear.1: Clear the interrupt. Self-cleared bit.

field.name: DCDC_INT_ENABLE
field.description: DCDC interrupt control.

field.name: DCDC_INT_CLEAR
field.description: DCDC interrupt clear.1: Clear the interrupt. Self-cleared bit.

field.name: BODVBAT_STATUS
field.description: BOD VBAT Interrupt status before Interrupt Enable.

field.name: BODVBAT_INT_STATUS
field.description: BOD VBAT Interrupt status after Interrupt Enable.

field.name: BODVBAT_VAL
field.description: Current value of BOD VBAT power status output.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_OK
enumeratedValue.description: VBAT voltage level is below the threshold.

enumeratedValue.name: OK
enumeratedValue.description: VBAT voltage level is above the threshold.

field.name: BODCORE_STATUS
field.description: BOD CORE Interrupt status before Interrupt Enable.

field.name: BODCORE_INT_STATUS
field.description: BOD CORE Interrupt status after Interrupt Enable.

field.name: BODCORE_VAL
field.description: Current value of BOD CORE power status output.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_OK
enumeratedValue.description: CORE voltage level is below the threshold.

enumeratedValue.name: OK
enumeratedValue.description: CORE voltage level is above the threshold.

field.name: DCDC_STATUS
field.description: DCDC Interrupt status before Interrupt Enable.

field.name: DCDC_INT_STATUS
field.description: DCDC Interrupt status after Interrupt Enable.

field.name: DCDC_VAL
field.description: Current value of DCDC power status output.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_OK
enumeratedValue.description: DCDC output Voltage is below the targeted regulation level.

enumeratedValue.name: OK
enumeratedValue.description: DCDC output Voltage is above the targeted regulation level.

register.name: RINGO0_CTRL
register.description: First Ring Oscillator module control register.

field.name: SL
field.description: Select short or long ringo (for all ringos types).

field.name: FS
field.description: Ringo frequency output divider.

enumeratedValue.name: FAST
enumeratedValue.description: High frequency output (frequency lower than 100 MHz).

enumeratedValue.name: SLOW
enumeratedValue.description: Low frequency output (frequency lower than 10 MHz).

field.name: SWN_SWP
field.description: PN-Ringos (P-Transistor and N-Transistor processing) control.

enumeratedValue.name: P_MONITOR
enumeratedValue.description: P-Monitor mode. Measure with weak P transistor.

enumeratedValue.name: N_MONITOR
enumeratedValue.description: P-Monitor mode. Measure with weak N transistor.

field.name: PD
field.description: Ringo module Power control.

field.name: E_ND0
field.description: First NAND2-based ringo control.

field.name: E_ND1
field.description: Second NAND2-based ringo control.

field.name: E_NR0
field.description: First NOR2-based ringo control.

register.name: RESETCTRL
register.description: Reset Control [Reset by: PoR, Pin Reset, Brown Out Detectors Reset, Deep Power Down Reset, Software Reset]

field.name: DPDWAKEUPRESETENABLE
field.description: Wake-up from DEEP POWER DOWN reset event (either from wake up I/O or RTC or OS Event Timer).

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Reset event from DEEP POWER DOWN mode is disable.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Reset event from DEEP POWER DOWN mode is enable.

field.name: BODVBATRESETENABLE
field.description: BOD VBAT reset enable.

field.name: BODCORERESETENABLE
field.description: BOD CORE reset enable.

field.name: SWRRESETENABLE
field.description: Software reset enable.

field.name: POR
field.description: 1 : The last chip reset was caused by a Power On Reset. Write '1' to clear this bit.

field.name: PADRESET
field.description: 1 : The last chip reset was caused by a Pin Reset. Write '1' to clear this bit.

field.name: BODRESET
field.description: 1 : The last chip reset was caused by a Brown Out Detector (BoD), either VBAT BoD or Core Logic BoD. Write '1' to clear this bit.

field.name: SYSTEMRESET
field.description: 1 : The last chip reset was caused by a System Reset requested by the ARM CPU. Write '1' to clear this bit.

field.name: WDTRESET
field.description: 1 : The last chip reset was caused by the Watchdog Timer. Write '1' to clear this bit.

field.name: SWRRESET
field.description: 1 : The last chip reset was caused by a Software. Write '1' to clear this bit.

field.name: DPDRESET_WAKEUPIO
field.description: 1 : The last chip reset was caused by a Wake-up I/O reset event during DEEP POWER DOWN mode. Write '1' to clear this bit.

field.name: DPDRESET_RTC
field.description: 1 : The last chip reset was caused by an RTC (either RTC Alarm or RTC wake up) reset event during DEEP POWER DOWN mode. Write '1' to clear this bit.

field.name: DPDRESET_OSTIMER
field.description: 1 : The last chip reset was caused by a OS Event Timer reset eventduring DEEP POWER DOWN mode. Write '1' to clear this bit.

field.name: USBHS_3V_NOK
field.description: USB_HS: Low voltage detection on 3.3V supply.

field.name: SWRESET
field.description: Software reset control

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_IN_RESET
enumeratedValue.description: Not in reset. The RTC is not held in reset. This bit must be cleared prior to configuring or initiating any operation of the RTC.

enumeratedValue.name: IN_RESET
enumeratedValue.description: In reset. The RTC is held in reset. All register bits within the RTC will be forced to their reset value except the OFD bit. This bit must be cleared before writing to any register in the RTC - including writes to set any of the other bits within this register. Do not attempt to write to any bits of this register at the same time that the reset bit is being cleared.

field.name: ALARM1HZ
field.description: RTC 1 Hz timer alarm flag status.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_MATCH
enumeratedValue.description: No match. No match has occurred on the 1 Hz RTC timer. Writing a 0 has no effect.

enumeratedValue.name: MATCH
enumeratedValue.description: Match. A match condition has occurred on the 1 Hz RTC timer. This flag generates an RTC alarm interrupt request RTC_ALARM which can also wake up the part from any low power mode. Writing a 1 clears this bit.

field.name: WAKE1KHZ
field.description: RTC 1 kHz timer wake-up flag status.

enumeratedValue.name: RUN
enumeratedValue.description: Run. The RTC 1 kHz timer is running. Writing a 0 has no effect.

enumeratedValue.name: TIMEOUT
enumeratedValue.description: Time-out. The 1 kHz high-resolution/wake-up timer has timed out. This flag generates an RTC wake-up interrupt request RTC-WAKE which can also wake up the part from any low power mode. Writing a 1 clears this bit.

field.name: ALARMDPD_EN
field.description: RTC 1 Hz timer alarm enable for Deep power-down.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Disable. A match on the 1 Hz RTC timer will not bring the part out of Deep power-down mode.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Enable. A match on the 1 Hz RTC timer bring the part out of Deep power-down mode.

field.name: WAKEDPD_EN
field.description: RTC 1 kHz timer wake-up enable for Deep power-down.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Disable. A match on the 1 kHz RTC timer will not bring the part out of Deep power-down mode.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Enable. A match on the 1 kHz RTC timer bring the part out of Deep power-down mode.

field.name: RTC1KHZ_EN
field.description: RTC 1 kHz clock enable. This bit can be set to 0 to conserve power if the 1 kHz timer is not used. This bit has no effect when the RTC is disabled (bit 7 of this register is 0).

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Disable. A match on the 1 kHz RTC timer will not bring the part out of Deep power-down mode.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Enable. The 1 kHz RTC timer is enabled.

field.name: RTC_EN
field.description: RTC enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Disable. The RTC 1 Hz and 1 kHz clocks are shut down and the RTC operation is disabled. This bit should be 0 when writing to load a value in the RTC counter register.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Enable. The 1 Hz RTC clock is running and RTC operation is enabled. This bit must be set to initiate operation of the RTC. The first clock to the RTC counter occurs 1 s after this bit is set. To also enable the high-resolution, 1 kHz clock, set bit 6 in this register.

field.name: RTC_OSC_PD
field.description: RTC oscillator power-down control.

field.name: RTC_OSC_BYPASS
field.description: RTC oscillator bypass control.

enumeratedValue.name: USED
enumeratedValue.description: The RTC Oscillator operates normally as a crystal oscillator with the crystal connected between the RTC_XTALIN and RTC_XTALOUT pins.

enumeratedValue.name: BYPASS
enumeratedValue.description: The RTC Oscillator is in bypass mode. In this mode a clock can be directly input into the RTC_XTALIN pin.

field.name: RTC_SUBSEC_ENA
field.description: RTC Sub-second counter control.

enumeratedValue.name: POWER_UP
enumeratedValue.description: The sub-second counter (if implemented) is disabled. This bit is cleared by a system-level POR or BOD reset as well as a by the RTC_ENA bit (bit 7 in this register). On modules not equipped with a sub-second counter, this bit will always read-back as a '0'.

enumeratedValue.name: POWERED_DOWN
enumeratedValue.description: The 32 KHz sub-second counter is enabled (if implemented). Counting commences on the start of the first one-second interval after this bit is set. Note: This bit can only be set after the RTC_ENA bit (bit 7) is set by a previous write operation. Note: The RTC sub-second counter must be re-enabled whenever the chip exits deep power-down mode.

field.name: MATVAL
field.description: Contains the match value against which the 1 Hz RTC timer will be compared to set the alarm flag RTC_ALARM and generate an alarm interrupt/wake-up if enabled.

field.name: VAL
field.description: A read reflects the current value of the main, 1 Hz RTC timer. A write loads a new initial value into the timer. The RTC counter will count up continuously at a 1 Hz rate once the RTC Software Reset is removed (by clearing bit 0 of the CTRL register). Only write to this register when the RTC_EN bit in the RTC CTRL Register is 0. The counter increments one second after the RTC_EN bit is set.

field.name: VAL
field.description: A read reflects the current value of the high-resolution/wake-up timer. A write pre-loads a start count value into the wake-up timer and initializes a count-down sequence. Do not write to this register while counting is in progress.

field.name: SUBSEC
field.description: A read reflects the current value of the 32Khz sub-second counter. This counter will be cleared whenever the SUBSEC_ENA bit in the RTC_CONTROL register is low. Up-counting at a 32 KHz rate commences at the start of the next one-second interval after the SUBSEC_ENA bit is set. This counter must be re-enabled after exiting deep_powerdown mode or after the main RTC module has been disabled and re-enabled. On modules not equipped with a sub-second counter, this register will read-back as all zeroes.

field.name: GPDATA
field.description: Data retained during Deep power-down mode or loss of main power as long as VBAT is supplied.

peripheral.name: OSTIMER
peripheral.description: Synchronous OS/Event timer with Wakeup Timer

field.name: EVTIMER_COUNT_VALUE
field.description: A read reflects the current value of the lower 32 bits of the EVTIMER. Note there is physically only one EVTimer, readable from all domains.

field.name: EVTIMER_COUNT_VALUE
field.description: A read reflects the current value of the upper 32 bits of the EVTIMER. Note there is physically only one EVTimer, readable from all domains.

register.name: CAPTUREn_L
register.description: Local Capture Low Register for CPUn

field.name: CAPTUREn_VALUE
field.description: A read reflects the value of the lower 32 bits of the central EVTIMER at the time the last capture signal was generated by the CPU. A separate pair of CAPTURE registers are implemented for each CPU. Each CPU reads its own capture value at the same pair of addresses.

register.name: CAPTUREn_H
register.description: Local Capture High Register for CPUn

field.name: CAPTUREn_VALUE
field.description: A read reflects the value of the upper 32 bits of the central EVTIMER at the time the last capture signal was generated by the CPU. A separate pair of CAPTURE registers are implemented for each CPU. Each CPU reads its own capture value at the same pair of addresses.

register.name: MATCHn_L
register.description: Local Match Low Register for CPUn

field.name: MATCHn_VALUE
field.description: The value written to the MATCH (L/H) register pair is compared against the central EVTIMER. When a match occurs, an interrupt request is generated if enabled. A separate pair of MATCH registers are implemented for each CPU. Each CPU reads its own local value at the same pair of addresses.

field.name: MATCHn_VALUE
field.description: The value written to the MATCH (L/H) register pair is compared against the central EVTIMER. When a match occurs, an interrupt request is generated if enabled. A separate pair of MATCH registers are implemented for each CPU. Each CPU reads its own local value at the same pair of addresses.

register.name: OSEVENT_CTRL
register.description: OS_EVENT TIMER Control Register for CPUn

field.name: OSTIMER_INTRFLAG
field.description: This bit is set when a match occurs between the central 64-bit EVTIMER and the value programmed in the Match-register pair for the associated CPU This bit is cleared by writing a '1'. Writes to clear this bit are asynchronous. This should be done before a new match value is written into the MATCH_L/H registers

field.name: OSTIMER_INTENA
field.description: When this bit is '1' an interrupt/wakeup request to the Domainn processor will be asserted when the OSTIMER_INTR flag is set. When this bit is '0', interrupt/wakeup requests due to the OSTIMER_INTR flag are blocked.A separate OSEVENT_CTRL register is implemented for each CPU. Each CPU reads its own local value at the same address.

field.name: RST

field.name: WAKEUP
field.description: When bit is set, the controller wakes up from whatever low power or powerdown mode was active.

field.name: ABORT
field.description: When bit is set, a running program/erase command is aborted.

field.name: DESCR1

register.name: STOPA

field.name: STOPA

field.name: FAIL
field.description: When a CLR_ENABLE bit is written to 1, the corresponding INT_ENABLE bit is cleared.

field.name: ERR
field.description: When a CLR_ENABLE bit is written to 1, the corresponding INT_ENABLE bit is cleared.

field.name: DONE
field.description: When a CLR_ENABLE bit is written to 1, the corresponding INT_ENABLE bit is cleared.

field.name: ECC_ERR
field.description: When a CLR_ENABLE bit is written to 1, the corresponding INT_ENABLE bit is cleared.

field.name: FAIL
field.description: When a SET_ENABLE bit is written to 1, the corresponding INT_ENABLE bit is set.

field.name: ERR
field.description: When a SET_ENABLE bit is written to 1, the corresponding INT_ENABLE bit is set.

field.name: DONE
field.description: When a SET_ENABLE bit is written to 1, the corresponding INT_ENABLE bit is set.

field.name: ECC_ERR
field.description: When a SET_ENABLE bit is written to 1, the corresponding INT_ENABLE bit is set.

field.name: FAIL
field.description: This status bit is set if execution of a (legal) command failed.

field.name: ERR
field.description: This status bit is set if execution of an illegal command is detected.

field.name: DONE
field.description: This status bit is set at the end of command execution.

field.name: ECC_ERR
field.description: This status bit is set if, during a memory read operation (either a user-requested read, or a speculative read, or reads performed by a controller command), a correctable or uncorrectable error is detected by ECC decoding logic.

field.name: FAIL
field.description: If an INT_ENABLE bit is set, an interrupt request will be generated if the corresponding INT_STATUS bit is high.

field.name: ERR
field.description: If an INT_ENABLE bit is set, an interrupt request will be generated if the corresponding INT_STATUS bit is high.

field.name: DONE
field.description: If an INT_ENABLE bit is set, an interrupt request will be generated if the corresponding INT_STATUS bit is high.

field.name: ECC_ERR
field.description: If an INT_ENABLE bit is set, an interrupt request will be generated if the corresponding INT_STATUS bit is high.

field.description: When a CLR_STATUS bit is written to 1, the corresponding INT_STATUS bit is cleared.

field.description: When a CLR_STATUS bit is written to 1, the corresponding INT_STATUS bit is cleared.

field.description: When a CLR_STATUS bit is written to 1, the corresponding INT_STATUS bit is cleared.

field.description: When a SET_STATUS bit is written to 1, the corresponding INT_STATUS bit is set.

field.name: ECC_ERR
field.description: When a SET_STATUS bit is written to 1, the corresponding INT_STATUS bit is set.
