register.description: Initial Vector register for region 2, Least Significant Bits

field.name: IVVAL
field.description: Initial Vector value for the 32 Least Significant Bits of the 64-bit Initial Vector.

register.name: IV_MSB2
register.description: Initial Vector register for region 2, Most Significant Bits

field.name: IVVAL
field.description: Initial Vector value for the 32 Most Significant Bits of the 64-bit Initial Vector.

field.name: ADDR_FIXED
field.description: Fixed portion of the base address of region 2.

field.name: ADDR_PRG
field.description: Programmable portion of the base address of region 2.

field.name: EN
field.description: Each bit in this field enables an 8KB subregion for encryption at offset 8KB*bitnum of region 2.

field.name: TXPWDFS
field.description: Note that this bit will be auto cleared if there is USB wakeup event while ENAUTOCLR_PHY_PWD bit of CTRL is enabled

field.name: D_CAL
field.description: Decode to trim the nominal 17

field.name: TXCAL45DM
field.description: Decode to trim the nominal 45ohm series termination resistance to the USB_DM output pin

field.name: TXENCAL45DN
field.description: Enable resistance calibration on DN.

field.name: TXCAL45DP
field.description: Decode to trim the nominal 45ohm series termination resistance to the USB_DP output pin

field.name: TXENCAL45DP
field.description: Enable resistance calibration on DP.

field.name: ENVADJ
field.description: The ENVADJ field adjusts the trip point for the envelope detector

field.name: DISCONADJ
field.description: The DISCONADJ field adjusts the trip point for the disconnect detector.

field.name: RXDBYPASS
field.description: This test mode is intended for lab use only, replace FS differential receiver with DP single ended receiver

enumeratedValue.name: value1
enumeratedValue.description: Use the output of the USB_DP single-ended receiver in place of the full-speed differential receiver

field.name: ENHOSTDISCONDETECT
field.description: For host mode, enables high-speed disconnect detector

field.name: HOSTDISCONDETECT_IRQ
field.description: Indicates that the device has disconnected in High-Speed mode

field.name: ENDEVPLUGINDET
field.description: Enables non-standard resistive plugged-in detection This bit field controls connection of nominal 200kohm resistors to both the USB_DP and USB_DM pins as one method of detecting when a USB cable is attached in device mode

enumeratedValue.name: value0
enumeratedValue.description: Disables 200kohm pullup resistors on USB_DP and USB_DM pins (Default)

enumeratedValue.name: value1
enumeratedValue.description: Enables 200kohm pullup resistors on USB_DP and USB_DM pins

field.name: DEVPLUGIN_IRQ
field.description: Indicates that the device is connected

field.name: DATA_ON_LRADC
field.description: Data on LR ADC: Enables the LRADC to monitor USB_DP and USB_DM

field.name: ENUTMILEVEL2
field.description: Enables UTMI+ Level 2 operation for the USB HS PHY

field.name: ENUTMILEVEL3
field.description: Enables UTMI+ Level 3 operation for the USB HS PHY

field.name: AUTORESUME_EN
field.description: Enable the auto resume feature, when set, HW will use 32KHz clock to send Resume to respond to the device remote wakeup(for host mode only)

field.name: ENAUTOCLR_CLKGATE
field.description: Enables the feature to auto-clear the CLKGATE bit if there is wakeup event while USB is suspended

field.name: ENAUTOCLR_PHY_PWD
field.description: Enables the feature to auto-clear the PWD register bits in PWD if there is wakeup event while USB is suspended

field.name: FSDLL_RST_EN
field.description: Enables the feature to reset the FSDLL lock detection logic at the end of each TX packet.

field.name: OTG_ID_VALUE
field.description: Indicates the results of USB_ID pin while monitoring the cable plugged into the Micro- or Mini-AB receptacle

field.name: HOST_FORCE_LS_SE0
field.description: Forces the next FS packet that is transmitted to have a EOP with low-speed timing

field.name: UTMI_SUSPENDM
field.description: Used by the PHY to indicate a powered-down state

field.name: CLKGATE
field.description: Gate UTMI Clocks

field.name: SFTRST
field.description: Writing a 1 to this bit will soft-reset the PWD, TX, RX, and CTRL registers

field.name: ENHOSTDISCONDETECT
field.description: For host mode, enables high-speed disconnect detector

field.name: HOSTDISCONDETECT_IRQ
field.description: Indicates that the device has disconnected in High-Speed mode

field.name: HOSTDISCONDETECT_STATUS
field.description: Indicates at the local host (downstream) port that the remote device has disconnected while in High-Speed mode

enumeratedValue.name: value0
enumeratedValue.description: USB cable disconnect has not been detected at the local host

enumeratedValue.name: value1
enumeratedValue.description: USB cable disconnect has been detected at the local host

field.name: DEVPLUGIN_STATUS
field.description: Status indicator for non-standard resistive plugged-in detection Indicates that the device has been connected on the USB_DP and USB_DM lines using the nonstandard resistive plugged-in detection method controlled by CTRL[4]

enumeratedValue.name: value0
enumeratedValue.description: No attachment to a USB host is detected

enumeratedValue.name: value1
enumeratedValue.description: Cable attachment to a USB host is detected

field.name: OTGID_STATUS
field.description: Indicates the results of USB_ID pin on the USB cable plugged into the local Micro- or Mini-AB receptacle

field.name: RESUME_STATUS
field.description: Indicates that the host is sending a wake-up after Suspend and has triggered an interrupt.

field.name: OTGIDPIOLOCK
field.description: Once OTG ID from STATUS_OTGID_STATUS is sampled, use this to hold the value

field.name: DEBUG_INTERFACE_HOLD
field.description: Use holding registers to assist in timing for external UTMI interface.

field.name: HSTPULLDOWN
field.description: This bit field selects whether to connect pulldown resistors on the USB_DP/USB_DM pins if the corresponding pulldown overdrive mode is enabled through DEBUG[5:4} Set bit 3 to value 1'b1 to connect the 15ohm pulldown on USB_DP line

field.name: ENHSTPULLDOWN
field.description: This bit field selects host pulldown overdrive mode

field.name: TX2RXCOUNT
field.description: Delay in between the end of transmit to the beginning of receive

field.name: ENTX2RXCOUNT
field.description: Set this bit to allow a countdown to transition in between TX and RX.

field.name: SQUELCHRESETCOUNT
field.description: Delay in between the detection of squelch to the reset of high-speed RX.

field.name: ENSQUELCHRESET
field.description: Set bit to allow squelch to reset high-speed receive.

field.name: SQUELCHRESETLENGTH
field.description: Duration of RESET in terms of the number of 480-MHz cycles.

field.name: HOST_RESUME_DEBUG
field.description: Choose to trigger the host resume SE0 with HOST_FORCE_LS_SE0 = 0 or UTMI_SUSPEND = 1.

field.name: CLKGATE
field.description: Gate Test Clocks

field.description: Once OTG ID from STATUS_OTGID_STATUS is sampled, use this to hold the value

field.description: Delay in between the detection of squelch to the reset of high-speed RX.

field.name: ENSQUELCHRESET
field.description: Set bit to allow squelch to reset high-speed receive.

field.name: SQUELCHRESETLENGTH
field.description: Duration of RESET in terms of the number of 480-MHz cycles.

field.name: HOST_RESUME_DEBUG
field.description: Choose to trigger the host resume SE0 with HOST_FORCE_LS_SE0 = 0 or UTMI_SUSPEND = 1.

field.name: CLKGATE
field.description: Gate Test Clocks

field.name: ENTAILADJVD
field.description: Delay increment of the rise of squelch:

field.name: MISC2_CONTROL0
field.description: Modifies the operation of the pll_sic_power_int signal

field.description: Enables the USB clock from PLL to USB PHY

field.description: Power up the USB PLL

field.name: PLL_ENABLE
field.description: Enables the clock output from the USB PLL

field.name: PLL_BYPASS
field.description: Bypass the USB PLL.

field.name: REFBIAS_PWD_SEL
field.description: Reference bias power down select.

enumeratedValue.name: value0
enumeratedValue.description: Selects PLL_POWER to control the reference bias

enumeratedValue.name: value1
enumeratedValue.description: Selects REFBIAS_PWD to control the reference bias

field.name: REFBIAS_PWD
field.description: Power down the reference bias This bit is only used when REFBIAS_PWD_SEL is set to 1.

register.name: USB1_VBUS_DETECT
register.description: USB PHY VBUS Detect Control Register

field.name: VBUSVALID_THRESH
field.description: Sets the threshold for the VBUSVALID comparator

field.name: VBUS_OVERRIDE_EN
field.description: VBUS detect signal override enable

enumeratedValue.name: value0
enumeratedValue.description: Use the results of the internal VBUS_VALID and Session Valid comparators for VBUS_VALID, AVALID, BVALID, and SESSEND (Default)

enumeratedValue.name: value1
enumeratedValue.description: Use the override values for VBUS_VALID, AVALID, BVALID, and SESSEND

field.name: SESSEND_OVERRIDE
field.description: Override value for SESSEND The bit field provides the value for USB1_VBUS_DET_STAT[0] if USB_VBUS_DETECT[3] is set to value 1'b1

field.name: BVALID_OVERRIDE
field.description: Override value for B-Device Session Valid The bit field provides the value for USB1_VBUS_DET_STAT[1] if USB_VBUS_DETECT[3] is set to value 1'b1

field.name: AVALID_OVERRIDE
field.description: Override value for A-Device Session Valid The bit field provides the value for USB1_VBUS_DET_STAT[2] if USB_VBUS_DETECT[3] is set to value 1'b1

field.name: VBUSVALID_OVERRIDE
field.description: Override value for VBUS_VALID signal sent to USB controller The bit field provides the value for VBUS_VALID reported to the USB controller if the value of USB1_VBUS_DETECT[3] is set to 1'b1

field.name: VBUSVALID_SEL
field.description: Selects the source of the VBUS_VALID signal reported to the USB controller This is one of the bit fields that selects the source of the VBUS_VALID signal reported to the USB controller

enumeratedValue.name: value0
enumeratedValue.description: Use the VBUS_VALID comparator results for signal reported to the USB controller (Default)

enumeratedValue.name: value1
enumeratedValue.description: Use the VBUS_VALID_3V detector results for signal reported to the USB controller

field.name: VBUS_SOURCE_SEL
field.description: Selects the source of the VBUS_VALID signal reported to the USB controller This is one of the bit fields that selects the source of the VBUS_VALID signal reported to the USB controller

enumeratedValue.name: value0
enumeratedValue.description: Use the VBUS_VALID comparator results for signal reported to the USB controller (Default)

enumeratedValue.name: value1
enumeratedValue.description: Use the Session Valid comparator results for signal reported to the USB controller

enumeratedValue.name: value2
enumeratedValue.description: Use the Session Valid comparator results for signal reported to the USB controller

field.name: VBUSVALID_TO_SESSVALID
field.description: Selects the comparator used for VBUS_VALID This bit field controls the comparator used to report the VBUS_VALID results in USB1_VBUS_DETECT[3] between the VBUS_VALID comparator and the Session Valid comparator

enumeratedValue.name: value0
enumeratedValue.description: Use the VBUS_VALID comparator for VBUS_VALID results

enumeratedValue.name: value1
enumeratedValue.description: Use the Session End comparator for VBUS_VALID results. The Session End threshold is >0.8V and <4.0V.

field.name: PWRUP_CMPS
field.description: Enables the VBUS_VALID comparator Powers up the comparator used for the VBUS_VALID detector

field.name: DISCHARGE_VBUS
field.description: Controls VBUS discharge resistor This bit field controls a nominal 22kohm resistor between the USB1_VBUS pin and ground

field.name: EN_CHARGER_RESISTOR
field.description: Enables resistors used for an older method of resistive battery charger detection

enumeratedValue.name: value0
enumeratedValue.description: Disable resistive charger detection resistors on USB_DP and USB_DP

enumeratedValue.name: value1
enumeratedValue.description: Enable resistive charger detection resistors on USB_DP and USB_DP

register.name: USB1_VBUS_DET_STAT
register.description: USB PHY VBUS Detector Status Register

field.name: SESSEND
field.description: Session End indicator Session End status, value inverted from Session Valid comparator

enumeratedValue.name: value0
enumeratedValue.description: The VBUS voltage is above the Session Valid threshold

enumeratedValue.name: value1
enumeratedValue.description: The VBUS voltage is below the Session Valid threshold

field.name: BVALID
field.description: B-Device Session Valid status B-Device Session Valid status, determined by the Session Valid comparator

enumeratedValue.name: value0
enumeratedValue.description: The VBUS voltage is below the Session Valid threshold

enumeratedValue.name: value1
enumeratedValue.description: The VBUS voltage is above the Session Valid threshold

field.name: AVALID
field.description: A-Device Session Valid status A-Device Session Valid status, determined by the Session Valid comparator

enumeratedValue.name: value0
enumeratedValue.description: The VBUS voltage is below the Session Valid threshold

enumeratedValue.name: value1
enumeratedValue.description: The VBUS voltage is above the Session Valid threshold

field.name: VBUS_VALID
field.description: VBUS voltage status This bit field shows the result of VBUS_VALID detection for the USB1_VBUS pin

enumeratedValue.name: value0
enumeratedValue.description: VBUS is below the comparator threshold

enumeratedValue.name: value1
enumeratedValue.description: VBUS is above the comparator threshold

field.name: VBUS_VALID_3V
field.description: VBUS_VALID_3V detector status The VBUS_VALID_3V detector has a lower threshold for the voltage on the USB1_VBUS pin than either the Session Valid or VBUS_VALID comparators

enumeratedValue.name: value0
enumeratedValue.description: VBUS voltage is below VBUS_VALID_3V threshold

enumeratedValue.name: value1
enumeratedValue.description: VBUS voltage is above VBUS_VALID_3V threshold

register.name: USB1_CHRG_DETECT
register.description: USB PHY Charger Detect Control Register

field.name: PULLUP_DP
field.description: This bit is used to pull up DP, for digital charge detect.

field.name: BGR_IBIAS
field.description: USB charge detector bias current reference This bit determines the reference for the bias current of the USB charge detector

enumeratedValue.name: value0
enumeratedValue.description: Bias current is derived from the USB PHY internal current generator.

enumeratedValue.name: value1
enumeratedValue.description: Bias current is derived from the reference generator of the bandgap.

register.name: USB1_CHRG_DETECT_SET
register.description: USB PHY Charger Detect Control Register

field.name: PULLUP_DP
field.description: This bit is used to pull up DP, for digital charge detect.

field.name: BGR_IBIAS
field.description: USB charge detector bias current reference This bit determines the reference for the bias current of the USB charge detector

enumeratedValue.name: value0
enumeratedValue.description: Bias current is derived from the USB PHY internal current generator.

enumeratedValue.name: value1
enumeratedValue.description: Bias current is derived from the reference generator of the bandgap.

register.name: USB1_CHRG_DETECT_CLR
register.description: USB PHY Charger Detect Control Register

field.description: This bit is used to pull up DP, for digital charge detect.

field.name: BGR_IBIAS

enumeratedValue.name: value0
enumeratedValue.description: Bias current is derived from the USB PHY internal current generator.

enumeratedValue.name: value1

register.name: USB1_CHRG_DETECT_TOG

field.name: PULLUP_DP
field.description: This bit is used to pull up DP, for digital charge detect.

field.name: BGR_IBIAS

register.name: USB1_CHRG_DET_STAT
register.description: USB PHY Charger Detect Status Register

field.name: PLUG_CONTACT
field.description: Battery Charging Data Contact Detection phase output During the Data Contact Detection phase per the USB Battery Charging Specification Revision 1

enumeratedValue.name: value0
enumeratedValue.description: No USB cable attachment has been detected

enumeratedValue.name: value1
enumeratedValue.description: A USB cable attachment between the device and host has been detected

field.name: CHRG_DETECTED
field.description: Battery Charging Primary Detection phase output During the USB Battery Charging Primary Detection phase using the USBHSDCD module, this bit field indicates whether a Standard Downstream Port or Charging Port was detected

enumeratedValue.name: value0
enumeratedValue.description: Standard Downstream Port (SDP) has been detected

field.name: DM_STATE
field.description: Single ended receiver output for the USB_DM pin, from charger detection circuits.

field.name: DP_STATE
field.description: Single ended receiver output for the USB_DP pin, from charger detection circuits.

field.name: SECDET_DCP
field.description: Battery Charging Secondary Detection phase output During the USB Battery Charging Secondary Detection phase using the USBHSDCD module, this bit field indicates which kind of Charging Port was detected

enumeratedValue.name: value0
enumeratedValue.description: Charging Downstream Port (CDP) has been detected

enumeratedValue.name: value1
enumeratedValue.description: Downstream Charging Port (DCP) has been detected

field.name: DEV_PULLDOWN
field.description: Setting this field to 1'b1 will enable the 15kohm pulldown resistors on both USB_DP and USB_DM pins

enumeratedValue.name: value0
enumeratedValue.description: The 15kohm nominal pulldowns on the USB_DP and USB_DM pinsare disabled in device mode.

enumeratedValue.name: value1
enumeratedValue.description: The 15kohm nominal pulldowns on the USB_DP and USB_DM pinsare enabled in device mode.

field.name: DEV_PULLDOWN
field.description: Setting this field to 1'b1 will enable the 15kohm pulldown resistors on both USB_DP and USB_DM pins

enumeratedValue.name: value0
enumeratedValue.description: The 15kohm nominal pulldowns on the USB_DP and USB_DM pinsare disabled in device mode.

enumeratedValue.name: value1

register.name: RANDOM_NUMBER
register.description: This register contains a random 32 bit number which is computed on demand, at each time it is read

field.name: RANDOM_NUMBER
field.description: This register contains a random 32 bit number which is computed on demand, at each time it is read.

register.name: ENCRYPTED_NUMBER
register.description: This register contains a random 32 bit number which is pre-computed

field.name: ENCRYPTED_NUMBER
field.description: This register contains a random 32 bit number which is pre-computed.

field.name: CLK_RATIO
field.description: Gives the ratio between the internal clocks frequencies and the register clock frequency for evaluation and certification purposes.

field.name: REFRESH_CNT
field.description: Incremented (till max possible value) each time COUNTER was updated since last reading to any *_NUMBER.

field.name: MODE
field.description: 00: disabled 01: update once.

field.name: CLOCK_SEL
field.description: Selects the internal clock on which to compute statistics.

field.name: SHIFT4X
field.description: To be used to add precision to clock_ratio and determine 'entropy refill'.

field.name: DIS_ENH_ENTR_REFILL
field.description: Disable 'enhanced entropy refill' feature, which is enabled by default when 'mode' > 00.

field.name: FORCE_ENTR_SPREADING
field.description: Forces entropy spreading (interactions between RNGs) even when 'clock_sel'>0.

field.name: ACTIVATE
field.description: 0: disabled 1: activated Update rythm for VAL depends on COUNTER_CFG if data_sel is set to COUNTER.

field.name: DATA_SEL
field.description: Selects source on which to apply online test: 00: LSB of COUNTER: raw data from one or all sources of entropy 01: MSB of COUNTER: raw data from one or all sources of entropy 10: RANDOM_NUMBER 11: ENCRYPTED_NUMBER 'activate' should be set to 'disabled' before changing this field.

field.name: LIVE_CHI_SQUARED
field.description: This value is updated as described in field 'activate'.

field.name: MIN_CHI_SQUARED
field.description: This field is reset when 'activate'==0.

field.name: MAX_CHI_SQUARED
field.description: This field is reset when 'activate'==0.

field.name: AES_RESEED
field.description: If set, ENCRYPTED_NUMBER generation becomes predictable, provided all secrets and current internal state are known: independant from entropy source.

field.name: AES_DT_CFG
field.description: Set this bit to re-seed AES.

register.name: POWERDOWN
register.description: Powerdown mode (standard but certainly useless here)

field.name: SOFT_RESET
field.description: Request softreset that will go low automaticaly after acknowledge from CORE.

field.name: FORCE_SOFT_RESET
field.description: When used with softreset it forces CORE_RESETN to low on acknowledge from CORE.

field.name: POWERDOWN
field.description: When set all accesses to standard registers are blocked.

field.description: Aperture i.

field.name: MIN_REV

field.name: MAJ_REV

field.name: KEY0
field.description: "10:Write access to KEY0MASK, KEYENABLE.KEY0 and KEYRESET.KEY0 is allowed. 00, 01, 11:Write access to KEY0MASK, KEYENABLE.KEY0 and KEYRESET.KEY0 is NOT allowed. Important Note : Once this field is written with a value different from '10', its value can no longer be modified until un Power On Reset occurs."

field.name: KEY1
field.description: "10:Write access to KEY1MASK, KEYENABLE.KEY1 and KEYRESET.KEY1 is allowed. 00, 01, 11:Write access to KEY1MASK, KEYENABLE.KEY1 and KEYRESET.KEY1 is NOT allowed. Important Note : Once this field is written with a value different from '10', its value can no longer be modified until un Power On Reset occurs."

field.name: KEY2
field.description: "10:Write access to KEY2MASK, KEYENABLE.KEY2 and KEYRESET.KEY2 is allowed. 00, 01, 11:Write access to KEY2MASK, KEYENABLE.KEY2 and KEYRESET.KEY2 is NOT allowed. Important Note : Once this field is written with a value different from '10', its value can no longer be modified until un Power On Reset occurs." "10:Write access to KEY3MASK, KEYENABLE.KEY3 and KEYRESET.KEY3 is allowed. 00, 01, 11:Write access to KEY3MASK, KEYENABLE.KEY3 and KEYRESET.KEY3 is NOT allowed. Important Note : Once this field is written with a value different from '10', its value can no longer be modified until un Power On Reset occurs."

field.name: KEY3
field.description: "10:Write access to KEY3MASK, KEYENABLE.KEY3 and KEYRESET.KEY3 is allowed. 00, 01, 11:Write access to KEY3MASK, KEYENABLE.KEY3 and KEYRESET.KEY3 is NOT allowed. Important Note : Once this field is written with a value different from '10', its value can no longer be modified until un Power On Reset occurs."

field.name: KEY0

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: DMA controller master enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The DMA controller is disabled. This clears any triggers that were asserted at the point when disabled, but does not prevent re-triggering when the DMA controller is re-enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The DMA controller is enabled.

field.name: ACTIVEINT
field.description: Summarizes whether any enabled interrupts (other than error interrupts) are pending.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_PENDING
enumeratedValue.description: Not pending. No enabled interrupts are pending.

enumeratedValue.name: PENDING
enumeratedValue.description: Pending. At least one enabled interrupt is pending.

field.name: ACTIVEERRINT
field.description: Summarizes whether any error interrupts are pending.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_PENDING
enumeratedValue.description: Not pending. No error interrupts are pending.

enumeratedValue.name: PENDING
enumeratedValue.description: Pending. At least one error interrupt is pending.

register.name: SRAMBASE
register.description: SRAM address of the channel configuration table.

field.name: OFFSET
field.description: Address bits 31:9 of the beginning of the DMA descriptor table. For 18 channels, the table must begin on a 512 byte boundary.

register.name: ENABLESET0
register.description: Channel Enable read and Set for all DMA channels.

field.name: ENA
field.description: Enable for DMA channels. Bit n enables or disables DMA channel n. The number of bits = number of DMA channels in this device. Other bits are reserved. 0 = disabled. 1 = enabled.

register.name: ENABLECLR0
register.description: Channel Enable Clear for all DMA channels.

field.name: CLR
field.description: Writing ones to this register clears the corresponding bits in ENABLESET0. Bit n clears the channel enable bit n. The number of bits = number of DMA channels in this device. Other bits are reserved.

register.name: ACTIVE0
register.description: Channel Active status for all DMA channels.

field.name: ACT
field.description: Active flag for DMA channel n. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. The number of bits = number of DMA channels in this device. Other bits are reserved. 0 = not active. 1 = active.

register.name: BUSY0
register.description: Channel Busy status for all DMA channels.

field.name: BSY
field.description: Busy flag for DMA channel n. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. The number of bits = number of DMA channels in this device. Other bits are reserved. 0 = not busy. 1 = busy.

register.name: ERRINT0
register.description: Error Interrupt status for all DMA channels.

field.name: ERR
field.description: Error Interrupt flag for DMA channel n. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. The number of bits = number of DMA channels in this device. Other bits are reserved. 0 = error interrupt is not active. 1 = error interrupt is active.

register.name: INTENSET0
register.description: Interrupt Enable read and Set for all DMA channels.

field.name: INTEN
field.description: Interrupt Enable read and set for DMA channel n. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. The number of bits = number of DMA channels in this device. Other bits are reserved. 0 = interrupt for DMA channel is disabled. 1 = interrupt for DMA channel is enabled.

register.name: INTENCLR0
register.description: Interrupt Enable Clear for all DMA channels.

field.name: CLR
field.description: Writing ones to this register clears corresponding bits in the INTENSET0. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. The number of bits = number of DMA channels in this device. Other bits are reserved.

register.name: INTA0
register.description: Interrupt A status for all DMA channels.

field.name: IA
field.description: Interrupt A status for DMA channel n. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. The number of bits = number of DMA channels in this device. Other bits are reserved. 0 = the DMA channel interrupt A is not active. 1 = the DMA channel interrupt A is active.

register.name: INTB0
register.description: Interrupt B status for all DMA channels.

field.name: IB
field.description: Interrupt B status for DMA channel n. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. The number of bits = number of DMA channels in this device. Other bits are reserved. 0 = the DMA channel interrupt B is not active. 1 = the DMA channel interrupt B is active.

register.name: SETVALID0
register.description: Set ValidPending control bits for all DMA channels.

field.name: SV
field.description: SETVALID control for DMA channel n. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. The number of bits = number of DMA channels in this device. Other bits are reserved. 0 = no effect. 1 = sets the VALIDPENDING control bit for DMA channel n

register.name: SETTRIG0
register.description: Set Trigger control bits for all DMA channels.

field.name: TRIG
field.description: Set Trigger control bit for DMA channel 0. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. The number of bits = number of DMA channels in this device. Other bits are reserved. 0 = no effect. 1 = sets the TRIG bit for DMA channel n.

register.name: ABORT0
register.description: Channel Abort control for all DMA channels.

field.name: ABORTCTRL
field.description: Abort control for DMA channel 0. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. 0 = no effect. 1 = aborts DMA operations on channel n.

field.name: PERIPHREQEN
field.description: Peripheral request Enable. If a DMA channel is used to perform a memory-to-memory move, any peripheral DMA request associated with that channel can be disabled to prevent any interaction between the peripheral and the DMA controller.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Peripheral DMA requests are disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. Peripheral DMA requests are enabled.

field.name: HWTRIGEN
field.description: Hardware Triggering Enable for this channel.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Hardware triggering is not used.

field.name: TRIGPOL
field.description: Trigger Polarity. Selects the polarity of a hardware trigger for this channel.

enumeratedValue.name: ACTIVE_LOW_FALLING
enumeratedValue.description: Active low - falling edge. Hardware trigger is active low or falling edge triggered, based on TRIGTYPE.

enumeratedValue.name: ACTIVE_HIGH_RISING
enumeratedValue.description: Active high - rising edge. Hardware trigger is active high or rising edge triggered, based on TRIGTYPE.

field.name: TRIGTYPE
field.description: Trigger Type. Selects hardware trigger as edge triggered or level triggered.

enumeratedValue.name: EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Edge. Hardware trigger is edge triggered. Transfers will be initiated and completed, as specified for a single trigger.

enumeratedValue.name: LEVEL
enumeratedValue.description: Level. Hardware trigger is level triggered. Note that when level triggering without burst (BURSTPOWER = 0) is selected, only hardware triggers should be used on that channel. Transfers continue as long as the trigger level is asserted. Once the trigger is de-asserted, the transfer will be paused until the trigger is, again, asserted. However, the transfer will not be paused until any remaining transfers within the current BURSTPOWER length are completed.

field.name: TRIGBURST
field.description: Trigger Burst. Selects whether hardware triggers cause a single or burst transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: SINGLE
enumeratedValue.description: Single transfer. Hardware trigger causes a single transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: BURST
enumeratedValue.description: Burst transfer. When the trigger for this channel is set to edge triggered, a hardware trigger causes a burst transfer, as defined by BURSTPOWER. When the trigger for this channel is set to level triggered, a hardware trigger causes transfers to continue as long as the trigger is asserted, unless the transfer is complete.

field.name: BURSTPOWER
field.description: Burst Power is used in two ways. It always selects the address wrap size when SRCBURSTWRAP and/or DSTBURSTWRAP modes are selected (see descriptions elsewhere in this register). When the TRIGBURST field elsewhere in this register = 1, Burst Power selects how many transfers are performed for each DMA trigger. This can be used, for example, with peripherals that contain a FIFO that can initiate a DMA operation when the FIFO reaches a certain level. 0000: Burst size = 1 (20). 0001: Burst size = 2 (21). 0010: Burst size = 4 (22). 1010: Burst size = 1024 (210). This corresponds to the maximum supported transfer count. others: not supported. The total transfer length as defined in the XFERCOUNT bits in the XFERCFG register must be an even multiple of the burst size.

field.name: SRCBURSTWRAP
field.description: Source Burst Wrap. When enabled, the source data address for the DMA is 'wrapped', meaning that the source address range for each burst will be the same. As an example, this could be used to read several sequential registers from a peripheral for each DMA burst, reading the same registers again for each burst.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Source burst wrapping is not enabled for this DMA channel.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. Source burst wrapping is enabled for this DMA channel.

field.name: DSTBURSTWRAP
field.description: Destination Burst Wrap. When enabled, the destination data address for the DMA is 'wrapped', meaning that the destination address range for each burst will be the same. As an example, this could be used to write several sequential registers to a peripheral for each DMA burst, writing the same registers again for each burst.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Destination burst wrapping is not enabled for this DMA channel.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. Destination burst wrapping is enabled for this DMA channel.

field.name: CHPRIORITY
field.description: Priority of this channel when multiple DMA requests are pending. Eight priority levels are supported: 0x0 = highest priority. 0x7 = lowest priority.

register.name: CTLSTAT
register.description: Control and status register for DMA channel .

field.name: VALIDPENDING
field.description: Valid pending flag for this channel. This bit is set when a 1 is written to the corresponding bit in the related SETVALID register when CFGVALID = 1 for the same channel.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect. No effect on DMA operation.

field.name: TRIG
field.description: Trigger flag. Indicates that the trigger for this channel is currently set. This bit is cleared at the end of an entire transfer or upon reload when CLRTRIG = 1.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_TRIGGERED
enumeratedValue.description: Not triggered. The trigger for this DMA channel is not set. DMA operations will not be carried out.

enumeratedValue.name: TRIGGERED
enumeratedValue.description: Triggered. The trigger for this DMA channel is set. DMA operations will be carried out.

register.name: XFERCFG
register.description: Transfer configuration register for DMA channel .

field.name: CFGVALID
field.description: Configuration Valid flag. This bit indicates whether the current channel descriptor is valid and can potentially be acted upon, if all other activation criteria are fulfilled.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_VALID
enumeratedValue.description: Not valid. The channel descriptor is not considered valid until validated by an associated SETVALID0 setting.

enumeratedValue.name: VALID
enumeratedValue.description: Valid. The current channel descriptor is considered valid.

field.name: RELOAD
field.description: Indicates whether the channel's control structure will be reloaded when the current descriptor is exhausted. Reloading allows ping-pong and linked transfers.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Do not reload the channels' control structure when the current descriptor is exhausted.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. Reload the channels' control structure when the current descriptor is exhausted.

field.name: SWTRIG
field.description: Software Trigger.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: Not set. When written by software, the trigger for this channel is not set. A new trigger, as defined by the HWTRIGEN, TRIGPOL, and TRIGTYPE will be needed to start the channel.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Set. When written by software, the trigger for this channel is set immediately. This feature should not be used with level triggering when TRIGBURST = 0.

field.name: CLRTRIG
field.description: Clear Trigger.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_CLEARED
enumeratedValue.description: Not cleared. The trigger is not cleared when this descriptor is exhausted. If there is a reload, the next descriptor will be started.

enumeratedValue.name: CLEARED
enumeratedValue.description: Cleared. The trigger is cleared when this descriptor is exhausted

field.name: SETINTA
field.description: Set Interrupt flag A for this channel. There is no hardware distinction between interrupt A and B. They can be used by software to assist with more complex descriptor usage. By convention, interrupt A may be used when only one interrupt flag is needed.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Set. The INTA flag for this channel will be set when the current descriptor is exhausted.

field.name: SETINTB
field.description: Set Interrupt flag B for this channel. There is no hardware distinction between interrupt A and B. They can be used by software to assist with more complex descriptor usage. By convention, interrupt A may be used when only one interrupt flag is needed.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Set. The INTB flag for this channel will be set when the current descriptor is exhausted.

field.name: WIDTH
field.description: Transfer width used for this DMA channel.

enumeratedValue.name: BIT_8
enumeratedValue.description: 8-bit. 8-bit transfers are performed (8-bit source reads and destination writes).

enumeratedValue.name: BIT_16
enumeratedValue.description: 16-bit. 6-bit transfers are performed (16-bit source reads and destination writes).

enumeratedValue.name: BIT_32
enumeratedValue.description: 32-bit. 32-bit transfers are performed (32-bit source reads and destination writes).

field.name: SRCINC
field.description: Determines whether the source address is incremented for each DMA transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_INCREMENT
enumeratedValue.description: No increment. The source address is not incremented for each transfer. This is the usual case when the source is a peripheral device.

enumeratedValue.name: WIDTH_X_1
enumeratedValue.description: 1 x width. The source address is incremented by the amount specified by Width for each transfer. This is the usual case when the source is memory.

enumeratedValue.name: WIDTH_X_2
enumeratedValue.description: 2 x width. The source address is incremented by 2 times the amount specified by Width for each transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: WIDTH_X_4
enumeratedValue.description: 4 x width. The source address is incremented by 4 times the amount specified by Width for each transfer.

field.name: DSTINC
field.description: Determines whether the destination address is incremented for each DMA transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_INCREMENT
enumeratedValue.description: No increment. The destination address is not incremented for each transfer. This is the usual case when the destination is a peripheral device.

enumeratedValue.name: WIDTH_X_1
enumeratedValue.description: 1 x width. The destination address is incremented by the amount specified by Width for each transfer. This is the usual case when the destination is memory.

enumeratedValue.name: WIDTH_X_2
enumeratedValue.description: 2 x width. The destination address is incremented by 2 times the amount specified by Width for each transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: WIDTH_X_4
enumeratedValue.description: 4 x width. The destination address is incremented by 4 times the amount specified by Width for each transfer.

field.name: XFERCOUNT
field.description: Total number of transfers to be performed, minus 1 encoded. The number of bytes transferred is: (XFERCOUNT + 1) x data width (as defined by the WIDTH field). The DMA controller uses this bit field during transfer to count down. Hence, it cannot be used by software to read back the size of the transfer, for instance, in an interrupt handler. 0x0 = a total of 1 transfer will be performed. 0x1 = a total of 2 transfers will be performed. 0x3FF = a total of 1,024 transfers will be performed.

field.name: DEV_ADDR
field.description: USB device address. After bus reset, the address is reset to 0x00. If the enable bit is set, the device will respond on packets for function address DEV_ADDR. When receiving a SetAddress Control Request from the USB host, software must program the new address before completing the status phase of the SetAddress Control Request.

field.name: DEV_EN
field.description: USB device enable. If this bit is set, the HW will start responding on packets for function address DEV_ADDR.

field.name: SETUP
field.description: SETUP token received. If a SETUP token is received and acknowledged by the device, this bit is set. As long as this bit is set all received IN and OUT tokens will be NAKed by HW. SW must clear this bit by writing a one. If this bit is zero, HW will handle the tokens to the CTRL EP0 as indicated by the CTRL EP0 IN and OUT data information programmed by SW.

field.name: FORCE_NEEDCLK
field.description: Forces the NEEDCLK output to always be on:

enumeratedValue.name: ALWAYS_ON
enumeratedValue.description: USB_NEEDCLK always 1. Clock will not be stopped in case of suspend.

field.name: LPM_SUP
field.description: LPM Supported:

field.name: INTONNAK_AO
field.description: Interrupt on NAK for interrupt and bulk OUT EP

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Only acknowledged packets generate an interrupt

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Both acknowledged and NAKed packets generate interrupts.

field.name: INTONNAK_AI
field.description: Interrupt on NAK for interrupt and bulk IN EP

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Only acknowledged packets generate an interrupt

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Both acknowledged and NAKed packets generate interrupts.

field.name: INTONNAK_CO
field.description: Interrupt on NAK for control OUT EP

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Only acknowledged packets generate an interrupt

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Both acknowledged and NAKed packets generate interrupts.

field.name: INTONNAK_CI
field.description: Interrupt on NAK for control IN EP

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Only acknowledged packets generate an interrupt

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Both acknowledged and NAKed packets generate interrupts.

field.name: DCON
field.description: Device status - connect. The connect bit must be set by SW to indicate that the device must signal a connect. The pull-up resistor on USB_DP will be enabled when this bit is set and the VBUSDEBOUNCED bit is one.

field.name: DSUS
field.description: Device status - suspend. The suspend bit indicates the current suspend state. It is set to 1 when the device hasn't seen any activity on its upstream port for more than 3 milliseconds. It is reset to 0 on any activity. When the device is suspended (Suspend bit DSUS = 1) and the software writes a 0 to it, the device will generate a remote wake-up. This will only happen when the device is connected (Connect bit = 1). When the device is not connected or not suspended, a writing a 0 has no effect. Writing a 1 never has an effect.

field.name: LPM_SUS
field.description: Device status - LPM Suspend. This bit represents the current LPM suspend state. It is set to 1 by HW when the device has acknowledged the LPM request from the USB host and the Token Retry Time of 10 ms has elapsed. When the device is in the LPM suspended state (LPM suspend bit = 1) and the software writes a zero to this bit, the device will generate a remote walk-up. Software can only write a zero to this bit when the LPM_REWP bit is set to 1. HW resets this bit when it receives a host initiated resume. HW only updates the LPM_SUS bit when the LPM_SUPP bit is equal to one.

field.name: LPM_REWP
field.description: LPM Remote Wake-up Enabled by USB host. HW sets this bit to one when the bRemoteWake bit in the LPM extended token is set to 1. HW will reset this bit to 0 when it receives the host initiated LPM resume, when a remote wake-up is sent by the device or when a USB bus reset is received. Software can use this bit to check if the remote wake-up feature is enabled by the host for the LPM transaction.

field.name: DCON_C
field.description: Device status - connect change. The Connect Change bit is set when the device's pull-up resistor is disconnected because VBus disappeared. The bit is reset by writing a one to it.

field.name: DSUS_C
field.description: Device status - suspend change. The suspend change bit is set to 1 when the suspend bit toggles. The suspend bit can toggle because: - The device goes in the suspended state - The device is disconnected - The device receives resume signaling on its upstream port. The bit is reset by writing a one to it.

field.name: DRES_C
field.description: Device status - reset change. This bit is set when the device received a bus reset. On a bus reset the device will automatically go to the default state (unconfigured and responding to address 0). The bit is reset by writing a one to it.

field.name: VBUSDEBOUNCED
field.description: This bit indicates if Vbus is detected or not. The bit raises immediately when Vbus becomes high. It drops to zero if Vbus is low for at least 3 ms. If this bit is high and the DCon bit is set, the HW will enable the pull-up resistor to signal a connect.

field.name: FRAME_NR
field.description: Frame number. This contains the frame number of the last successfully received SOF. In case no SOF was received by the device at the beginning of a frame, the frame number returned is that of the last successfully received SOF. In case the SOF frame number contained a CRC error, the frame number returned will be the corrupted frame number as received by the device.

field.name: ERR_CODE
field.description: The error code which last occurred:

field.name: MINREV
field.description: Minor Revision.

field.name: MAJREV
field.description: Major Revision.

register.name: EPLISTSTART
register.description: USB EP Command/Status List start address

field.name: EP_LIST
field.description: Start address of the USB EP Command/Status List.

field.name: DA_BUF
field.description: Start address of the buffer pointer page where all endpoint data buffers are located.

field.name: HIRD_HW
field.description: Host Initiated Resume Duration - HW. This is the HIRD value from the last received LPM token

field.name: HIRD_SW
field.description: Host Initiated Resume Duration - SW. This is the time duration required by the USB device system to come out of LPM initiated suspend after receiving the host initiated LPM resume.

field.name: DATA_PENDING
field.description: As long as this bit is set to one and LPM supported bit is set to one, HW will return a NYET handshake on every LPM token it receives. If LPM supported bit is set to one and this bit is zero, HW will return an ACK handshake on every LPM token it receives. If SW has still data pending and LPM is supported, it must set this bit to 1.

field.name: SKIP
field.description: Endpoint skip: Writing 1 to one of these bits, will indicate to HW that it must deactivate the buffer assigned to this endpoint and return control back to software. When HW has deactivated the endpoint, it will clear this bit, but it will not modify the EPINUSE bit. An interrupt will be generated when the Active bit goes from 1 to 0. Note: In case of double-buffering, HW will only clear the Active bit of the buffer indicated by the EPINUSE bit.

field.name: BUF
field.description: Buffer in use: This register has one bit per physical endpoint. 0: HW is accessing buffer 0. 1: HW is accessing buffer 1.

field.name: BUF_SB
field.description: Buffer usage: This register has one bit per physical endpoint. 0: Single-buffer. 1: Double-buffer. If the bit is set to single-buffer (0), it will not toggle the corresponding EPINUSE bit when it clears the active bit. If the bit is set to double-buffer (1), HW will toggle the EPINUSE bit when it clears the Active bit for the buffer.

field.name: EP0OUT
field.description: Interrupt status register bit for the Control EP0 OUT direction. This bit will be set if NBytes transitions to zero or the skip bit is set by software or a SETUP packet is successfully received for the control EP0. If the IntOnNAK_CO is set, this bit will also be set when a NAK is transmitted for the Control EP0 OUT direction. Software can clear this bit by writing a one to it.

field.name: EP0IN
field.description: Interrupt status register bit for the Control EP0 IN direction. This bit will be set if NBytes transitions to zero or the skip bit is set by software. If the IntOnNAK_CI is set, this bit will also be set when a NAK is transmitted for the Control EP0 IN direction. Software can clear this bit by writing a one to it.

field.name: EP1OUT
field.description: Interrupt status register bit for the EP1 OUT direction. This bit will be set if the corresponding Active bit is cleared by HW. This is done in case the programmed NBytes transitions to zero or the skip bit is set by software. If the IntOnNAK_AO is set, this bit will also be set when a NAK is transmitted for the EP1 OUT direction. Software can clear this bit by writing a one to it.

field.name: EP1IN
field.description: Interrupt status register bit for the EP1 IN direction. This bit will be set if the corresponding Active bit is cleared by HW. This is done in case the programmed NBytes transitions to zero or the skip bit is set by software. If the IntOnNAK_AI is set, this bit will also be set when a NAK is transmitted for the EP1 IN direction. Software can clear this bit by writing a one to it.

field.name: EP2OUT
field.description: Interrupt status register bit for the EP2 OUT direction. This bit will be set if the corresponding Active bit is cleared by HW. This is done in case the programmed NBytes transitions to zero or the skip bit is set by software. If the IntOnNAK_AO is set, this bit will also be set when a NAK is transmitted for the EP2 OUT direction. Software can clear this bit by writing a one to it.

field.name: EP2IN
field.description: Interrupt status register bit for the EP2 IN direction. This bit will be set if the corresponding Active bit is cleared by HW. This is done in case the programmed NBytes transitions to zero or the skip bit is set by software. If the IntOnNAK_AI is set, this bit will also be set when a NAK is transmitted for the EP2 IN direction. Software can clear this bit by writing a one to it.

field.name: EP3OUT
field.description: Interrupt status register bit for the EP3 OUT direction. This bit will be set if the corresponding Active bit is cleared by HW. This is done in case the programmed NBytes transitions to zero or the skip bit is set by software. If the IntOnNAK_AO is set, this bit will also be set when a NAK is transmitted for the EP3 OUT direction. Software can clear this bit by writing a one to it.

field.name: EP3IN
field.description: Interrupt status register bit for the EP3 IN direction. This bit will be set if the corresponding Active bit is cleared by HW. This is done in case the programmed NBytes transitions to zero or the skip bit is set by software. If the IntOnNAK_AI is set, this bit will also be set when a NAK is transmitted for the EP3 IN direction. Software can clear this bit by writing a one to it.

field.name: EP4OUT
field.description: Interrupt status register bit for the EP4 OUT direction. This bit will be set if the corresponding Active bit is cleared by HW. This is done in case the programmed NBytes transitions to zero or the skip bit is set by software. If the IntOnNAK_AO is set, this bit will also be set when a NAK is transmitted for the EP4 OUT direction. Software can clear this bit by writing a one to it.

field.name: EP4IN
field.description: Interrupt status register bit for the EP4 IN direction. This bit will be set if the corresponding Active bit is cleared by HW. This is done in case the programmed NBytes transitions to zero or the skip bit is set by software. If the IntOnNAK_AI is set, this bit will also be set when a NAK is transmitted for the EP4 IN direction. Software can clear this bit by writing a one to it.

field.name: FRAME_INT
field.description: Frame interrupt. This bit is set to one every millisecond when the VbusDebounced bit and the DCON bit are set. This bit can be used by software when handling isochronous endpoints. Software can clear this bit by writing a one to it.

field.name: DEV_INT
field.description: Device status interrupt. This bit is set by HW when one of the bits in the Device Status Change register are set. Software can clear this bit by writing a one to it.

field.name: EP_INT_EN
field.description: If this bit is set and the corresponding USB interrupt status bit is set, a HW interrupt is generated on the interrupt line indicated by the corresponding USB interrupt routing bit.

field.name: FRAME_INT_EN
field.description: If this bit is set and the corresponding USB interrupt status bit is set, a HW interrupt is generated on the interrupt line indicated by the corresponding USB interrupt routing bit.

field.name: DEV_INT_EN
field.description: If this bit is set and the corresponding USB interrupt status bit is set, a HW interrupt is generated on the interrupt line indicated by the corresponding USB interrupt routing bit.

field.name: EP_SET_INT
field.description: If software writes a one to one of these bits, the corresponding USB interrupt status bit is set. When this register is read, the same value as the USB interrupt status register is returned.

field.name: FRAME_SET_INT
field.description: If software writes a one to one of these bits, the corresponding USB interrupt status bit is set. When this register is read, the same value as the USB interrupt status register is returned.

field.name: DEV_SET_INT
field.description: If software writes a one to one of these bits, the corresponding USB interrupt status bit is set. When this register is read, the same value as the USB interrupt status register is returned.

field.name: TOGGLE
field.description: Endpoint data toggle: This field indicates the current value of the data toggle for the corresponding endpoint.

field.name: UNIFY
field.description: SCT operation

enumeratedValue.name: DUAL_COUNTER
enumeratedValue.description: The SCT operates as two 16-bit counters named COUNTER_L and COUNTER_H.

enumeratedValue.name: UNIFIED_COUNTER
enumeratedValue.description: The SCT operates as a unified 32-bit counter.

field.name: CLKMODE
field.description: SCT clock mode

enumeratedValue.name: SYSTEM_CLOCK_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: System Clock Mode. The system clock clocks the entire SCT module including the counter(s) and counter prescalers.

enumeratedValue.name: SAMPLED_SYSTEM_CLOCK_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: Sampled System Clock Mode. The system clock clocks the SCT module, but the counter and prescalers are only enabled to count when the designated edge is detected on the input selected by the CKSEL field. The minimum pulse width on the selected clock-gate input is 1 bus clock period. This mode is the high-performance, sampled-clock mode.

enumeratedValue.name: SCT_INPUT_CLOCK_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: SCT Input Clock Mode. The input/edge selected by the CKSEL field clocks the SCT module, including the counters and prescalers, after first being synchronized to the system clock. The minimum pulse width on the clock input is 1 bus clock period. This mode is the low-power, sampled-clock mode.

enumeratedValue.name: ASYNCHRONOUS_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: Asynchronous Mode. The entire SCT module is clocked directly by the input/edge selected by the CKSEL field. In this mode, the SCT outputs are switched synchronously to the SCT input clock - not the system clock. The input clock rate must be at least half the system clock rate and can be the same or faster than the system clock.

field.name: CKSEL
field.description: SCT clock select. The specific functionality of the designated input/edge is dependent on the CLKMODE bit selection in this register.

field.name: NORELAOD_L
field.description: A 1 in this bit prevents the lower match registers from being reloaded from their respective reload registers. Setting this bit eliminates the need to write to the reload registers MATCHREL if the match values are fixed. Software can write to set or clear this bit at any time. This bit applies to both the higher and lower registers when the UNIFY bit is set.

field.name: NORELOAD_H
field.description: A 1 in this bit prevents the higher match registers from being reloaded from their respective reload registers. Setting this bit eliminates the need to write to the reload registers MATCHREL if the match values are fixed. Software can write to set or clear this bit at any time. This bit is not used when the UNIFY bit is set.

field.name: INSYNC
field.description: Synchronization for input N (bit 9 = input 0, bit 10 = input 1,, bit 12 = input 3); all other bits are reserved. A 1 in one of these bits subjects the corresponding input to synchronization to the SCT clock, before it is used to create an event. If an input is known to already be synchronous to the SCT clock, this bit may be set to 0 for faster input response. (Note: The SCT clock is the system clock for CKMODEs 0-2. It is the selected, asynchronous SCT input clock for CKMODE3). Note that the INSYNC field only affects inputs used for event generation. It does not apply to the clock input specified in the CKSEL field.

field.name: AUTOLIMIT_L
field.description: A one in this bit causes a match on match register 0 to be treated as a de-facto LIMIT condition without the need to define an associated event. As with any LIMIT event, this automatic limit causes the counter to be cleared to zero in unidirectional mode or to change the direction of count in bi-directional mode. Software can write to set or clear this bit at any time. This bit applies to both the higher and lower registers when the UNIFY bit is set.

field.name: AUTOLIMIT_H
field.description: A one in this bit will cause a match on match register 0 to be treated as a de-facto LIMIT condition without the need to define an associated event. As with any LIMIT event, this automatic limit causes the counter to be cleared to zero in unidirectional mode or to change the direction of count in bi-directional mode. Software can write to set or clear this bit at any time. This bit is not used when the UNIFY bit is set.

field.name: DOWN_L
field.description: This bit is 1 when the L or unified counter is counting down. Hardware sets this bit when the counter is counting up, counter limit occurs, and BIDIR = 1.Hardware clears this bit when the counter is counting down and a limit condition occurs or when the counter reaches 0.

field.name: STOP_L
field.description: When this bit is 1 and HALT is 0, the L or unified counter does not run, but I/O events related to the counter can occur. If a designated start event occurs, this bit is cleared and counting resumes.

field.name: HALT_L
field.description: When this bit is 1, the L or unified counter does not run and no events can occur. A reset sets this bit. When the HALT_L bit is one, the STOP_L bit is cleared. It is possible to remove the halt condition while keeping the SCT in the stop condition (not running) with a single write to this register to simultaneously clear the HALT bit and set the STOP bit. Once set, only software can clear this bit to restore counter operation. This bit is set on reset.

field.name: CLRCTR_L
field.description: Writing a 1 to this bit clears the L or unified counter. This bit always reads as 0.

field.name: BIDIR_L
field.description: L or unified counter direction select

enumeratedValue.name: UP
enumeratedValue.description: Up. The counter counts up to a limit condition, then is cleared to zero.

enumeratedValue.name: UP_DOWN
enumeratedValue.description: Up-down. The counter counts up to a limit, then counts down to a limit condition or to 0.

field.name: PRE_L
field.description: Specifies the factor by which the SCT clock is prescaled to produce the L or unified counter clock. The counter clock is clocked at the rate of the SCT clock divided by PRE_L+1. Clear the counter (by writing a 1 to the CLRCTR bit) whenever changing the PRE value.

field.name: DOWN_H
field.description: This bit is 1 when the H counter is counting down. Hardware sets this bit when the counter is counting, a counter limit condition occurs, and BIDIR is 1. Hardware clears this bit when the counter is counting down and a limit condition occurs or when the counter reaches 0.

field.name: STOP_H
field.description: When this bit is 1 and HALT is 0, the H counter does not, run but I/O events related to the counter can occur. If such an event matches the mask in the Start register, this bit is cleared and counting resumes.

field.name: HALT_H
field.description: When this bit is 1, the H counter does not run and no events can occur. A reset sets this bit. When the HALT_H bit is one, the STOP_H bit is cleared. It is possible to remove the halt condition while keeping the SCT in the stop condition (not running) with a single write to this register to simultaneously clear the HALT bit and set the STOP bit. Once set, this bit can only be cleared by software to restore counter operation. This bit is set on reset.

field.name: CLRCTR_H
field.description: Writing a 1 to this bit clears the H counter. This bit always reads as 0.

field.name: BIDIR_H
field.description: Direction select

enumeratedValue.name: UP
enumeratedValue.description: The H counter counts up to its limit condition, then is cleared to zero.

enumeratedValue.name: UP_DOWN
enumeratedValue.description: The H counter counts up to its limit, then counts down to a limit condition or to 0.

field.name: PRE_H
field.description: Specifies the factor by which the SCT clock is prescaled to produce the H counter clock. The counter clock is clocked at the rate of the SCT clock divided by PRELH+1. Clear the counter (by writing a 1 to the CLRCTR bit) whenever changing the PRE value.

field.name: LIMMSK_L
field.description: If bit n is one, event n is used as a counter limit for the L or unified counter (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, etc.). The number of bits = number of events in this SCT.

field.name: LIMMSK_H
field.description: If bit n is one, event n is used as a counter limit for the H counter (event 0 = bit 16, event 1 = bit 17, etc.). The number of bits = number of events in this SCT.

field.name: HALTMSK_L
field.description: If bit n is one, event n sets the HALT_L bit in the CTRL register (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, etc.). The number of bits = number of events in this SCT.

field.name: HALTMSK_H
field.description: If bit n is one, event n sets the HALT_H bit in the CTRL register (event 0 = bit 16, event 1 = bit 17, etc.). The number of bits = number of events in this SCT.

field.name: STOPMSK_L
field.description: If bit n is one, event n sets the STOP_L bit in the CTRL register (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, etc.). The number of bits = number of events in this SCT.

field.name: STOPMSK_H
field.description: If bit n is one, event n sets the STOP_H bit in the CTRL register (event 0 = bit 16, event 1 = bit 17, etc.). The number of bits = number of events in this SCT.

field.name: STARTMSK_L
field.description: If bit n is one, event n clears the STOP_L bit in the CTRL register (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, etc.). The number of bits = number of events in this SCT.

field.name: STARTMSK_H
field.description: If bit n is one, event n clears the STOP_H bit in the CTRL register (event 0 = bit 16, event 1 = bit 17, etc.). The number of bits = number of events in this SCT.

field.name: CTR_L
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read or write the 16-bit L counter value. When UNIFY = 1, read or write the lower 16 bits of the 32-bit unified counter.

field.name: CTR_H
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read or write the 16-bit H counter value. When UNIFY = 1, read or write the upper 16 bits of the 32-bit unified counter.

field.name: STATE_L
field.description: State variable.

field.name: STATE_H
field.description: State variable.

field.name: AIN0
field.description: Input 0 state. Input 0 state on the last SCT clock edge.

field.name: AIN1
field.description: Input 1 state. Input 1 state on the last SCT clock edge.

field.name: AIN2
field.description: Input 2 state. Input 2 state on the last SCT clock edge.

field.name: AIN3
field.description: Input 3 state. Input 3 state on the last SCT clock edge.

field.name: AIN4
field.description: Input 4 state. Input 4 state on the last SCT clock edge.

field.name: AIN5
field.description: Input 5 state. Input 5 state on the last SCT clock edge.

field.name: AIN6
field.description: Input 6 state. Input 6 state on the last SCT clock edge.

field.name: AIN7
field.description: Input 7 state. Input 7 state on the last SCT clock edge.

field.name: AIN8
field.description: Input 8 state. Input 8 state on the last SCT clock edge.

field.name: AIN9
field.description: Input 9 state. Input 9 state on the last SCT clock edge.

field.name: AIN10
field.description: Input 10 state. Input 10 state on the last SCT clock edge.

field.name: AIN11
field.description: Input 11 state. Input 11 state on the last SCT clock edge.

field.name: AIN12
field.description: Input 12 state. Input 12 state on the last SCT clock edge.

field.name: AIN13
field.description: Input 13 state. Input 13 state on the last SCT clock edge.

field.name: AIN14
field.description: Input 14 state. Input 14 state on the last SCT clock edge.

field.name: AIN15
field.description: Input 15 state. Input 15 state on the last SCT clock edge.

field.name: SIN0
field.description: Input 0 state. Input 0 state following the synchronization specified by INSYNC.

field.name: SIN1
field.description: Input 1 state. Input 1 state following the synchronization specified by INSYNC.

field.name: SIN2
field.description: Input 2 state. Input 2 state following the synchronization specified by INSYNC.

field.name: SIN3
field.description: Input 3 state. Input 3 state following the synchronization specified by INSYNC.

field.name: SIN4
field.description: Input 4 state. Input 4 state following the synchronization specified by INSYNC.

field.name: SIN5
field.description: Input 5 state. Input 5 state following the synchronization specified by INSYNC.

field.name: SIN6
field.description: Input 6 state. Input 6 state following the synchronization specified by INSYNC.

field.name: SIN7
field.description: Input 7 state. Input 7 state following the synchronization specified by INSYNC.

field.name: SIN8
field.description: Input 8 state. Input 8 state following the synchronization specified by INSYNC.

field.name: SIN9
field.description: Input 9 state. Input 9 state following the synchronization specified by INSYNC.

field.name: SIN10
field.description: Input 10 state. Input 10 state following the synchronization specified by INSYNC.

field.name: SIN11
field.description: Input 11 state. Input 11 state following the synchronization specified by INSYNC.

field.name: SIN12
field.description: Input 12 state. Input 12 state following the synchronization specified by INSYNC.

field.name: SIN13
field.description: Input 13 state. Input 13 state following the synchronization specified by INSYNC.

field.name: SIN14
field.description: Input 14 state. Input 14 state following the synchronization specified by INSYNC.

field.name: SIN15
field.description: Input 15 state. Input 15 state following the synchronization specified by INSYNC.

field.name: REGMOD_L
field.description: Each bit controls one match/capture register (register 0 = bit 0, register 1 = bit 1, etc.). The number of bits = number of match/captures in this SCT. 0 = register operates as match register. 1 = register operates as capture register.

field.name: REGMOD_H
field.description: Each bit controls one match/capture register (register 0 = bit 16, register 1 = bit 17, etc.). The number of bits = number of match/captures in this SCT. 0 = register operates as match registers. 1 = register operates as capture registers.

field.name: OUT
field.description: Writing a 1 to bit n forces the corresponding output HIGH. Writing a 0 forces the corresponding output LOW (output 0 = bit 0, output 1 = bit 1, etc.). The number of bits = number of outputs in this SCT.

register.name: OUTPUTDIRCTRL
register.description: SCT output counter direction control register

field.name: SETCLR0
field.description: Set/clear operation on output 0. Value 0x3 is reserved. Do not program this value.

enumeratedValue.name: INDEPENDENT
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear do not depend on the direction of any counter.

enumeratedValue.name: L_REVERSED
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear are reversed when counter L or the unified counter is counting down.

enumeratedValue.name: H_REVERSED
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear are reversed when counter H is counting down. Do not use if UNIFY = 1.

enumeratedValue.description: Set output (or clear based on the SETCLR0 field in the OUTPUTDIRCTRL register).

enumeratedValue.name: CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Clear output (or set based on the SETCLR0 field).

field.name: DEV_0
field.description: If bit n is one, event n triggers DMA request 0 (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, etc.). The number of bits = number of events in this SCT.

field.name: DRL0
field.description: A 1 in this bit triggers DMA request 0 when it loads the MATCH_L/Unified registers from the RELOAD_L/Unified registers.

field.name: DRQ0
field.description: This read-only bit indicates the state of DMA Request 0. Note that if the related DMA channel is enabled and properly set up, it is unlikely that software will see this flag, it will be cleared rapidly by the DMA service. The flag remaining set could point to an issue with DMA setup.

field.name: DEV_1
field.description: If bit n is one, event n triggers DMA request 1 (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, etc.). The number of bits = number of events in this SCT.

field.name: DRL1
field.description: A 1 in this bit triggers DMA request 1 when it loads the Match L/Unified registers from the Reload L/Unified registers.

field.name: DRQ1
field.description: This read-only bit indicates the state of DMA Request 1. Note that if the related DMA channel is enabled and properly set up, it is unlikely that software will see this flag, it will be cleared rapidly by the DMA service. The flag remaining set could point to an issue with DMA setup.

field.name: IEN
field.description: The SCT requests an interrupt when bit n of this register and the event flag register are both one (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, etc.). The number of bits = number of events in this SCT.

field.name: FLAG
field.description: Bit n is one if event n has occurred since reset or a 1 was last written to this bit (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, etc.). The number of bits = number of events in this SCT.

field.name: NCEN
field.description: The SCT requests an interrupt when bit n of this register and the SCT conflict flag register are both one (output 0 = bit 0, output 1 = bit 1, etc.). The number of bits = number of outputs in this SCT.

field.name: NCFLAG
field.description: Bit n is one if a no-change conflict event occurred on output n since reset or a 1 was last written to this bit (output 0 = bit 0, output 1 = bit 1, etc.). The number of bits = number of outputs in this SCT.

field.name: BUSERRL
field.description: The most recent bus error from this SCT involved writing CTR L/Unified, STATE L/Unified, MATCH L/Unified, or the Output register when the L/U counter was not halted. A word write to certain L and H registers can be half successful and half unsuccessful.

field.name: BUSERRH
field.description: The most recent bus error from this SCT involved writing CTR H, STATE H, MATCH H, or the Output register when the H counter was not halted.

register.name: SCTCAP0
register.description: SCT capture register of capture channel

field.name: CAPn_L
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read the 16-bit counter value at which this register was last captured. When UNIFY = 1, read the lower 16 bits of the 32-bit value at which this register was last captured.

field.name: CAPn_H
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read the 16-bit counter value at which this register was last captured. When UNIFY = 1, read the upper 16 bits of the 32-bit value at which this register was last captured.

register.name: SCTMATCH0
register.description: SCT match value register of match channels

field.name: MATCHn_L
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read or write the 16-bit value to be compared to the L counter. When UNIFY = 1, read or write the lower 16 bits of the 32-bit value to be compared to the unified counter.

field.name: MATCHn_H
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read or write the 16-bit value to be compared to the H counter. When UNIFY = 1, read or write the upper 16 bits of the 32-bit value to be compared to the unified counter.

field.name: CAPCONn_L
field.description: If bit m is one, event m causes the CAPn_L (UNIFY = 0) or the CAPn (UNIFY = 1) register to be loaded (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, etc.). The number of bits = number of match/captures in this SCT.

field.name: CAPCONn_H
field.description: If bit m is one, event m causes the CAPn_H (UNIFY = 0) register to be loaded (event 0 = bit 16, event 1 = bit 17, etc.). The number of bits = number of match/captures in this SCT.

field.name: RELOADn_L
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, specifies the 16-bit value to be loaded into the MATCHn_L register. When UNIFY = 1, specifies the lower 16 bits of the 32-bit value to be loaded into the MATCHn register.

field.name: RELOADn_H
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, specifies the 16-bit to be loaded into the MATCHn_H register. When UNIFY = 1, specifies the upper 16 bits of the 32-bit value to be loaded into the MATCHn register.

field.name: CAPCONn_L
field.description: If bit m is one, event m causes the CAPn_L (UNIFY = 0) or the CAPn (UNIFY = 1) register to be loaded (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, etc.). The number of bits = number of match/captures in this SCT.

field.name: CAPCONn_H
field.description: If bit m is one, event m causes the CAPn_H (UNIFY = 0) register to be loaded (event 0 = bit 16, event 1 = bit 17, etc.). The number of bits = number of match/captures in this SCT.

field.description: When UNIFY = 0, specifies the 16-bit value to be loaded into the MATCHn_L register. When UNIFY = 1, specifies the lower 16 bits of the 32-bit value to be loaded into the MATCHn register.

field.description: When UNIFY = 0, specifies the 16-bit to be loaded into the MATCHn_H register. When UNIFY = 1, specifies the upper 16 bits of the 32-bit value to be loaded into the MATCHn register.

field.name: CAPCONn_L
field.description: If bit m is one, event m causes the CAPn_L (UNIFY = 0) or the CAPn (UNIFY = 1) register to be loaded (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, etc.). The number of bits = number of match/captures in this SCT.

field.name: CAPCONn_H
field.description: If bit m is one, event m causes the CAPn_H (UNIFY = 0) register to be loaded (event 0 = bit 16, event 1 = bit 17, etc.). The number of bits = number of match/captures in this SCT.

field.name: RELOADn_L
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, specifies the 16-bit value to be loaded into the MATCHn_L register. When UNIFY = 1, specifies the lower 16 bits of the 32-bit value to be loaded into the MATCHn register.

field.name: RELOADn_H
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, specifies the 16-bit to be loaded into the MATCHn_H register. When UNIFY = 1, specifies the upper 16 bits of the 32-bit value to be loaded into the MATCHn register.

field.name: CAPCONn_L
field.description: If bit m is one, event m causes the CAPn_L (UNIFY = 0) or the CAPn (UNIFY = 1) register to be loaded (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, etc.). The number of bits = number of match/captures in this SCT.

field.name: CAPCONn_H
field.description: If bit m is one, event m causes the CAPn_H (UNIFY = 0) register to be loaded (event 0 = bit 16, event 1 = bit 17, etc.). The number of bits = number of match/captures in this SCT.

field.name: RELOADn_L
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, specifies the 16-bit value to be loaded into the MATCHn_L register. When UNIFY = 1, specifies the lower 16 bits of the 32-bit value to be loaded into the MATCHn register.

field.name: RELOADn_H
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, specifies the 16-bit to be loaded into the MATCHn_H register. When UNIFY = 1, specifies the upper 16 bits of the 32-bit value to be loaded into the MATCHn register.

field.name: STATEMSKn
field.description: If bit m is one, event n happens in state m of the counter selected by the HEVENT bit (n = event number, m = state number; state 0 = bit 0, state 1= bit 1, etc.). The number of bits = number of states in this SCT.

field.name: MATCHSEL
field.description: Selects the Match register associated with this event (if any). A match can occur only when the counter selected by the HEVENT bit is running.

field.name: HEVENT
field.description: Select L/H counter. Do not set this bit if UNIFY = 1.

enumeratedValue.name: L_COUNTER
enumeratedValue.description: Selects the L state and the L match register selected by MATCHSEL.

enumeratedValue.name: H_COUNTER
enumeratedValue.description: Selects the H state and the H match register selected by MATCHSEL.

field.name: OUTSEL
field.description: Input/output select

enumeratedValue.name: INPUT
enumeratedValue.description: Selects the inputs selected by IOSEL.

enumeratedValue.name: OUTPUT
enumeratedValue.description: Selects the outputs selected by IOSEL.

field.name: IOSEL
field.description: Selects the input or output signal number associated with this event (if any). Do not select an input in this register if CKMODE is 1x. In this case the clock input is an implicit ingredient of every event.

field.name: IOCOND
field.description: Selects the I/O condition for event n. (The detection of edges on outputs lag the conditions that switch the outputs by one SCT clock). In order to guarantee proper edge/state detection, an input must have a minimum pulse width of at least one SCT clock period .

field.name: COMBMODE
field.description: Selects how the specified match and I/O condition are used and combined.

enumeratedValue.name: OR
enumeratedValue.description: OR. The event occurs when either the specified match or I/O condition occurs.

enumeratedValue.name: MATCH
enumeratedValue.description: MATCH. Uses the specified match only.

enumeratedValue.name: IO
enumeratedValue.description: IO. Uses the specified I/O condition only.

enumeratedValue.name: AND
enumeratedValue.description: AND. The event occurs when the specified match and I/O condition occur simultaneously.

field.name: STATELD
field.description: This bit controls how the STATEV value modifies the state selected by HEVENT when this event is the highest-numbered event occurring for that state.

enumeratedValue.name: ADD
enumeratedValue.description: STATEV value is added into STATE (the carry-out is ignored).

enumeratedValue.name: LOAD
enumeratedValue.description: STATEV value is loaded into STATE.

field.name: STATEV
field.description: This value is loaded into or added to the state selected by HEVENT, depending on STATELD, when this event is the highest-numbered event occurring for that state. If STATELD and STATEV are both zero, there is no change to the STATE value.

field.name: MATCHMEM
field.description: If this bit is one and the COMBMODE field specifies a match component to the triggering of this event, then a match is considered to be active whenever the counter value is GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO the value specified in the match register when counting up, LESS THEN OR EQUAL TO the match value when counting down. If this bit is zero, a match is only be active during the cycle when the counter is equal to the match value.

field.name: DIRECTION
