field.description: Direction qualifier for event generation. This field only applies when the counters are operating in BIDIR mode. If BIDIR = 0, the SCT ignores this field. Value 0x3 is reserved.

enumeratedValue.name: DIRECTION_INDEPENDENT
enumeratedValue.description: Direction independent. This event is triggered regardless of the count direction.

enumeratedValue.name: COUNTING_UP
enumeratedValue.description: Counting up. This event is triggered only during up-counting when BIDIR = 1.

enumeratedValue.name: COUNTING_DOWN
enumeratedValue.description: Counting down. This event is triggered only during down-counting when BIDIR = 1.

field.name: SET
field.description: A 1 in bit m selects event m to set output n (or clear it if SETCLRn = 0x1 or 0x2) output 0 = bit 0, output 1 = bit 1, etc. The number of bits = number of events in this SCT. When the counter is used in bi-directional mode, it is possible to reverse the action specified by the output set and clear registers when counting down, See the OUTPUTCTRL register.

field.name: CLR
field.description: A 1 in bit m selects event m to clear output n (or set it if SETCLRn = 0x1 or 0x2) event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, etc. The number of bits = number of events in this SCT. When the counter is used in bi-directional mode, it is possible to reverse the action specified by the output set and clear registers when counting down, See the OUTPUTCTRL register.

register.name: PSELID
register.description: Peripheral Select and Flexcomm ID register.

field.name: PERSEL
field.description: Peripheral Select. This field is writable by software.

field.name: LOCK
field.description: Lock the peripheral select. This field is writable by software.

enumeratedValue.name: UNLOCKED
enumeratedValue.description: Peripheral select can be changed by software.

enumeratedValue.name: LOCKED
enumeratedValue.description: Peripheral select is locked and cannot be changed until this Flexcomm or the entire device is reset.

field.name: USARTPRESENT
field.description: USART present indicator. This field is Read-only.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_PRESENT
enumeratedValue.description: This Flexcomm does not include the USART function.

enumeratedValue.name: PRESENT
enumeratedValue.description: This Flexcomm includes the USART function.

field.name: SPIPRESENT
field.description: SPI present indicator. This field is Read-only.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_PRESENT
enumeratedValue.description: This Flexcomm does not include the SPI function.

enumeratedValue.name: PRESENT
enumeratedValue.description: This Flexcomm includes the SPI function.

field.name: I2CPRESENT
field.description: I2C present indicator. This field is Read-only.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_PRESENT
enumeratedValue.description: This Flexcomm does not include the I2C function.

enumeratedValue.name: PRESENT
enumeratedValue.description: This Flexcomm includes the I2C function.

field.name: I2SPRESENT
field.description: I 2S present indicator. This field is Read-only.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_PRESENT
enumeratedValue.description: This Flexcomm does not include the I2S function.

enumeratedValue.name: PRESENT
enumeratedValue.description: This Flexcomm includes the I2S function.

field.name: ID
field.description: Flexcomm ID.

field.name: Aperture
field.description: no description available

field.name: Minor_Rev
field.description: Minor revision of module implementation.

field.name: Major_Rev
field.description: Major revision of module implementation.

field.name: ID
field.description: Module identifier for the selected function.

field.name: MSTEN
field.description: Master Enable. When disabled, configurations settings for the Master function are not changed, but the Master function is internally reset.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The I2C Master function is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The I2C Master function is enabled.

field.name: SLVEN
field.description: Slave Enable. When disabled, configurations settings for the Slave function are not changed, but the Slave function is internally reset.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The I2C slave function is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The I2C slave function is enabled.

field.name: MONEN
field.description: Monitor Enable. When disabled, configurations settings for the Monitor function are not changed, but the Monitor function is internally reset.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The I2C Monitor function is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The I2C Monitor function is enabled.

field.name: TIMEOUTEN
field.description: I2C bus Time-out Enable. When disabled, the time-out function is internally reset.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. Time-out function is enabled. Both types of time-out flags will be generated and will cause interrupts if they are enabled. Typically, only one time-out will be used in a system.

field.name: MONCLKSTR
field.description: Monitor function Clock Stretching.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The Monitor function will not perform clock stretching. Software or DMA may not always be able to read data provided by the Monitor function before it is overwritten. This mode may be used when non-invasive monitoring is critical.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The Monitor function will perform clock stretching in order to ensure that software or DMA can read all incoming data supplied by the Monitor function.

field.name: HSCAPABLE
field.description: High-speed mode Capable enable. Since High Speed mode alters the way I2C pins drive and filter, as well as the timing for certain I2C signalling, enabling High-speed mode applies to all functions: Master, Slave, and Monitor.

enumeratedValue.name: FAST_MODE_PLUS
enumeratedValue.description: Fast-mode plus. The I 2C interface will support Standard-mode, Fast-mode, and Fast-mode Plus, to the extent that the pin electronics support these modes. Any changes that need to be made to the pin controls, such as changing the drive strength or filtering, must be made by software via the IOCON register associated with each I2C pin,

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH_SPEED
enumeratedValue.description: High-speed. In addition to Standard-mode, Fast-mode, and Fast-mode Plus, the I 2C interface will support High-speed mode to the extent that the pin electronics support these modes. See Section 25.7.2.2 for more information.

register.name: STAT
register.description: Status register for Master, Slave, and Monitor functions.

field.name: MSTPENDING
field.description: Master Pending. Indicates that the Master is waiting to continue communication on the I2C-bus (pending) or is idle. When the master is pending, the MSTSTATE bits indicate what type of software service if any the master expects. This flag will cause an interrupt when set if, enabled via the INTENSET register. The MSTPENDING flag is not set when the DMA is handling an event (if the MSTDMA bit in the MSTCTL register is set). If the master is in the idle state, and no communication is needed, mask this interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: IN_PROGRESS
enumeratedValue.description: In progress. Communication is in progress and the Master function is busy and cannot currently accept a command.

enumeratedValue.name: PENDING
enumeratedValue.description: Pending. The Master function needs software service or is in the idle state. If the master is not in the idle state, it is waiting to receive or transmit data or the NACK bit.

field.name: MSTSTATE
field.description: Master State code. The master state code reflects the master state when the MSTPENDING bit is set, that is the master is pending or in the idle state. Each value of this field indicates a specific required service for the Master function. All other values are reserved. See Table 400 for details of state values and appropriate responses.

enumeratedValue.name: IDLE
enumeratedValue.description: Idle. The Master function is available to be used for a new transaction.

enumeratedValue.name: RECEIVE_READY
enumeratedValue.description: Receive ready. Received data available (Master Receiver mode). Address plus Read was previously sent and Acknowledged by slave.

enumeratedValue.name: TRANSMIT_READY
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit ready. Data can be transmitted (Master Transmitter mode). Address plus Write was previously sent and Acknowledged by slave.

enumeratedValue.name: NACK_DATA
enumeratedValue.description: NACK Data. Slave NACKed transmitted data.

field.name: MSTARBLOSS
field.description: Master Arbitration Loss flag. This flag can be cleared by software writing a 1 to this bit. It is also cleared automatically a 1 is written to MSTCONTINUE.

enumeratedValue.name: ARBITRATION_LOSS
enumeratedValue.description: Arbitration loss. The Master function has experienced an Arbitration Loss. At this point, the Master function has already stopped driving the bus and gone to an idle state. Software can respond by doing nothing, or by sending a Start in order to attempt to gain control of the bus when it next becomes idle.

field.name: MSTSTSTPERR
field.description: Master Start/Stop Error flag. This flag can be cleared by software writing a 1 to this bit. It is also cleared automatically a 1 is written to MSTCONTINUE.

enumeratedValue.name: ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: The Master function has experienced a Start/Stop Error. A Start or Stop was detected at a time when it is not allowed by the I2C specification. The Master interface has stopped driving the bus and gone to an idle state, no action is required. A request for a Start could be made, or software could attempt to insure that the bus has not stalled.

field.name: SLVPENDING
field.description: Slave Pending. Indicates that the Slave function is waiting to continue communication on the I2C-bus and needs software service. This flag will cause an interrupt when set if enabled via INTENSET. The SLVPENDING flag is not set when the DMA is handling an event (if the SLVDMA bit in the SLVCTL register is set). The SLVPENDING flag is read-only and is automatically cleared when a 1 is written to the SLVCONTINUE bit in the SLVCTL register. The point in time when SlvPending is set depends on whether the I2C interface is in HSCAPABLE mode. See Section 25.7.2.2.2. When the I2C interface is configured to be HSCAPABLE, HS master codes are detected automatically. Due to the requirements of the HS I2C specification, slave addresses must also be detected automatically, since the address must be acknowledged before the clock can be stretched.

enumeratedValue.name: IN_PROGRESS
enumeratedValue.description: In progress. The Slave function does not currently need service.

enumeratedValue.name: PENDING
enumeratedValue.description: Pending. The Slave function needs service. Information on what is needed can be found in the adjacent SLVSTATE field.

field.name: SLVSTATE
field.description: Slave State code. Each value of this field indicates a specific required service for the Slave function. All other values are reserved. See Table 401 for state values and actions. note that the occurrence of some states and how they are handled are affected by DMA mode and Automatic Operation modes.

enumeratedValue.name: SLAVE_ADDRESS
enumeratedValue.description: Slave address. Address plus R/W received. At least one of the four slave addresses has been matched by hardware.

enumeratedValue.name: SLAVE_RECEIVE
enumeratedValue.description: Slave receive. Received data is available (Slave Receiver mode).

enumeratedValue.name: SLAVE_TRANSMIT
enumeratedValue.description: Slave transmit. Data can be transmitted (Slave Transmitter mode).

field.name: SLVNOTSTR
field.description: Slave Not Stretching. Indicates when the slave function is stretching the I2C clock. This is needed in order to gracefully invoke Deep Sleep or Power-down modes during slave operation. This read-only flag reflects the slave function status in real time.

enumeratedValue.name: STRETCHING
enumeratedValue.description: Stretching. The slave function is currently stretching the I2C bus clock. Deep-Sleep or Power-down mode cannot be entered at this time.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_STRETCHING
enumeratedValue.description: Not stretching. The slave function is not currently stretching the I 2C bus clock. Deep-sleep or Power-down mode could be entered at this time.

field.name: SLVIDX
field.description: Slave address match Index. This field is valid when the I2C slave function has been selected by receiving an address that matches one of the slave addresses defined by any enabled slave address registers, and provides an identification of the address that was matched. It is possible that more than one address could be matched, but only one match can be reported here.

field.name: SLVSEL
field.description: Slave selected flag. SLVSEL is set after an address match when software tells the Slave function to acknowledge the address, or when the address has been automatically acknowledged. It is cleared when another address cycle presents an address that does not match an enabled address on the Slave function, when slave software decides to NACK a matched address, when there is a Stop detected on the bus, when the master NACKs slave data, and in some combinations of Automatic Operation. SLVSEL is not cleared if software NACKs data.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SELECTED
enumeratedValue.description: Not selected. The Slave function is not currently selected.

enumeratedValue.name: SELECTED
enumeratedValue.description: Selected. The Slave function is currently selected.

field.name: SLVDESEL
field.description: Slave Deselected flag. This flag will cause an interrupt when set if enabled via INTENSET. This flag can be cleared by writing a 1 to this bit.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_DESELECTED
enumeratedValue.description: Not deselected. The Slave function has not become deselected. This does not mean that it is currently selected. That information can be found in the SLVSEL flag.

enumeratedValue.name: DESELECTED
enumeratedValue.description: Deselected. The Slave function has become deselected. This is specifically caused by the SLVSEL flag changing from 1 to 0. See the description of SLVSEL for details on when that event occurs.

field.name: MONRDY
field.description: Monitor Ready. This flag is cleared when the MONRXDAT register is read.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_DATA
enumeratedValue.description: No data. The Monitor function does not currently have data available.

enumeratedValue.name: DATA_WAITING
enumeratedValue.description: Data waiting. The Monitor function has data waiting to be read.

field.name: MONOV
field.description: Monitor Overflow flag.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_OVERRUN
enumeratedValue.description: No overrun. Monitor data has not overrun.

enumeratedValue.name: OVERRUN
enumeratedValue.description: Overrun. A Monitor data overrun has occurred. This can only happen when Monitor clock stretching not enabled via the MONCLKSTR bit in the CFG register. Writing 1 to this bit clears the flag.

field.name: MONACTIVE
field.description: Monitor Active flag. Indicates when the Monitor function considers the I 2C bus to be active. Active is defined here as when some Master is on the bus: a bus Start has occurred more recently than a bus Stop.

enumeratedValue.name: INACTIVE
enumeratedValue.description: Inactive. The Monitor function considers the I2C bus to be inactive.

enumeratedValue.name: ACTIVE
enumeratedValue.description: Active. The Monitor function considers the I2C bus to be active.

field.name: MONIDLE
field.description: Monitor Idle flag. This flag is set when the Monitor function sees the I2C bus change from active to inactive. This can be used by software to decide when to process data accumulated by the Monitor function. This flag will cause an interrupt when set if enabled via the INTENSET register. The flag can be cleared by writing a 1 to this bit.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_IDLE
enumeratedValue.description: Not idle. The I2C bus is not idle, or this flag has been cleared by software.

enumeratedValue.name: IDLE
enumeratedValue.description: Idle. The I2C bus has gone idle at least once since the last time this flag was cleared by software.

field.name: EVENTTIMEOUT
field.description: Event Time-out Interrupt flag. Indicates when the time between events has been longer than the time specified by the TIMEOUT register. Events include Start, Stop, and clock edges. The flag is cleared by writing a 1 to this bit. No time-out is created when the I2C-bus is idle.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_TIMEOUT
enumeratedValue.description: No time-out. I2C bus events have not caused a time-out.

enumeratedValue.name: EVEN_TIMEOUT
enumeratedValue.description: Event time-out. The time between I2C bus events has been longer than the time specified by the TIMEOUT register.

field.name: SCLTIMEOUT
field.description: SCL Time-out Interrupt flag. Indicates when SCL has remained low longer than the time specific by the TIMEOUT register. The flag is cleared by writing a 1 to this bit.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_TIMEOUT
enumeratedValue.description: No time-out. SCL low time has not caused a time-out.

enumeratedValue.name: TIMEOUT
enumeratedValue.description: Time-out. SCL low time has caused a time-out.

register.name: INTENSET
register.description: Interrupt Enable Set and read register.

field.name: MSTPENDINGEN
field.description: Master Pending interrupt Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The MstPending interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The MstPending interrupt is enabled.

field.name: MSTARBLOSSEN
field.description: Master Arbitration Loss interrupt Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The MstArbLoss interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The MstArbLoss interrupt is enabled.

field.name: MSTSTSTPERREN
field.description: Master Start/Stop Error interrupt Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The MstStStpErr interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The MstStStpErr interrupt is enabled.

field.name: SLVPENDINGEN
field.description: Slave Pending interrupt Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The SlvPending interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The SlvPending interrupt is enabled.

field.name: SLVNOTSTREN
field.description: Slave Not Stretching interrupt Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The SlvNotStr interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The SlvNotStr interrupt is enabled.

field.name: SLVDESELEN
field.description: Slave Deselect interrupt Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The SlvDeSel interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The SlvDeSel interrupt is enabled.

field.name: MONRDYEN
field.description: Monitor data Ready interrupt Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The MonRdy interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The MonRdy interrupt is enabled.

field.name: MONOVEN
field.description: Monitor Overrun interrupt Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The MonOv interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The MonOv interrupt is enabled.

field.name: MONIDLEEN
field.description: Monitor Idle interrupt Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The MonIdle interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The MonIdle interrupt is enabled.

field.name: EVENTTIMEOUTEN
field.description: Event time-out interrupt Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The Event time-out interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The Event time-out interrupt is enabled.

field.name: SCLTIMEOUTEN
field.description: SCL time-out interrupt Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The SCL time-out interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The SCL time-out interrupt is enabled.

field.name: MSTPENDINGCLR
field.description: Master Pending interrupt clear. Writing 1 to this bit clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register if implemented.

field.name: MSTARBLOSSCLR
field.description: Master Arbitration Loss interrupt clear.

field.name: MSTSTSTPERRCLR
field.description: Master Start/Stop Error interrupt clear.

field.name: SLVPENDINGCLR
field.description: Slave Pending interrupt clear.

field.name: SLVNOTSTRCLR
field.description: Slave Not Stretching interrupt clear.

field.name: SLVDESELCLR
field.description: Slave Deselect interrupt clear.

field.name: MONRDYCLR
field.description: Monitor data Ready interrupt clear.

field.name: MONOVCLR
field.description: Monitor Overrun interrupt clear.

field.name: MONIDLECLR
field.description: Monitor Idle interrupt clear.

field.name: EVENTTIMEOUTCLR
field.description: Event time-out interrupt clear.

field.name: SCLTIMEOUTCLR
field.description: SCL time-out interrupt clear.

field.name: TOMIN
field.description: Time-out time value, bottom four bits. These are hard-wired to 0xF. This gives a minimum time-out of 16 I2C function clocks and also a time-out resolution of 16 I2C function clocks.

field.name: TO
field.description: Time-out time value. Specifies the time-out interval value in increments of 16 I 2C function clocks, as defined by the CLKDIV register. To change this value while I2C is in operation, disable all time-outs, write a new value to TIMEOUT, then re-enable time-outs. 0x000 = A time-out will occur after 16 counts of the I2C function clock. 0x001 = A time-out will occur after 32 counts of the I2C function clock. 0xFFF = A time-out will occur after 65,536 counts of the I2C function clock.

register.name: CLKDIV
register.description: Clock pre-divider for the entire I2C interface. This determines what time increments are used for the MSTTIME register, and controls some timing of the Slave function.

field.name: DIVVAL
field.description: This field controls how the Flexcomm clock (FCLK) is used by the I2C functions that need an internal clock in order to operate. 0x0000 = FCLK is used directly by the I2C. 0x0001 = FCLK is divided by 2 before use. 0x0002 = FCLK is divided by 3 before use. 0xFFFF = FCLK is divided by 65,536 before use.

register.name: INTSTAT
register.description: Interrupt Status register for Master, Slave, and Monitor functions.

field.name: MSTPENDING
field.description: Master Pending.

field.name: MSTARBLOSS
field.description: Master Arbitration Loss flag.

field.name: MSTSTSTPERR
field.description: Master Start/Stop Error flag.

field.name: SLVPENDING
field.description: Slave Pending.

field.name: SLVNOTSTR
field.description: Slave Not Stretching status.

field.name: SLVDESEL
field.description: Slave Deselected flag.

field.name: MONRDY
field.description: Monitor Ready.

field.name: MONOV
field.description: Monitor Overflow flag.

field.name: MONIDLE
field.description: Monitor Idle flag.

field.name: EVENTTIMEOUT
field.description: Event time-out Interrupt flag.

field.name: SCLTIMEOUT
field.description: SCL time-out Interrupt flag.

field.name: MSTCONTINUE
field.description: Master Continue. This bit is write-only.

enumeratedValue.name: CONTINUE
enumeratedValue.description: Continue. Informs the Master function to continue to the next operation. This must done after writing transmit data, reading received data, or any other housekeeping related to the next bus operation.

field.name: MSTSTART
field.description: Master Start control. This bit is write-only.

enumeratedValue.name: START
enumeratedValue.description: Start. A Start will be generated on the I2C bus at the next allowed time.

field.name: MSTSTOP
field.description: Master Stop control. This bit is write-only.

enumeratedValue.name: STOP
enumeratedValue.description: Stop. A Stop will be generated on the I2C bus at the next allowed time, preceded by a NACK to the slave if the master is receiving data from the slave (Master Receiver mode).

field.name: MSTDMA
field.description: Master DMA enable. Data operations of the I2C can be performed with DMA. Protocol type operations such as Start, address, Stop, and address match must always be done with software, typically via an interrupt. Address acknowledgement must also be done by software except when the I2C is configured to be HSCAPABLE (and address acknowledgement is handled entirely by hardware) or when Automatic Operation is enabled. When a DMA data transfer is complete, MSTDMA must be cleared prior to beginning the next operation, typically a Start or Stop.This bit is read/write.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disable. No DMA requests are generated for master operation.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enable. A DMA request is generated for I2C master data operations. When this I2C master is generating Acknowledge bits in Master Receiver mode, the acknowledge is generated automatically.

field.name: MSTSCLLOW
field.description: Master SCL Low time. Specifies the minimum low time that will be asserted by this master on SCL. Other devices on the bus (masters or slaves) could lengthen this time. This corresponds to the parameter t LOW in the I2C bus specification. I2C bus specification parameters tBUF and tSU;STA have the same values and are also controlled by MSTSCLLOW.

enumeratedValue.name: CLOCKS_2
enumeratedValue.description: 2 clocks. Minimum SCL low time is 2 clocks of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: CLOCKS_3
enumeratedValue.description: 3 clocks. Minimum SCL low time is 3 clocks of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: CLOCKS_4
enumeratedValue.description: 4 clocks. Minimum SCL low time is 4 clocks of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: CLOCKS_5
enumeratedValue.description: 5 clocks. Minimum SCL low time is 5 clocks of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: CLOCKS_6
enumeratedValue.description: 6 clocks. Minimum SCL low time is 6 clocks of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: CLOCKS_7
enumeratedValue.description: 7 clocks. Minimum SCL low time is 7 clocks of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: CLOCKS_8
enumeratedValue.description: 8 clocks. Minimum SCL low time is 8 clocks of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: CLOCKS_9
enumeratedValue.description: 9 clocks. Minimum SCL low time is 9 clocks of the I2C clock pre-divider.

field.name: MSTSCLHIGH
field.description: Master SCL High time. Specifies the minimum high time that will be asserted by this master on SCL. Other masters in a multi-master system could shorten this time. This corresponds to the parameter tHIGH in the I2C bus specification. I2C bus specification parameters tSU;STO and tHD;STA have the same values and are also controlled by MSTSCLHIGH.

enumeratedValue.name: CLOCKS_2
enumeratedValue.description: 2 clocks. Minimum SCL high time is 2 clock of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: CLOCKS_3
enumeratedValue.description: 3 clocks. Minimum SCL high time is 3 clocks of the I2C clock pre-divider .

enumeratedValue.name: CLOCKS_4
enumeratedValue.description: 4 clocks. Minimum SCL high time is 4 clock of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: CLOCKS_5
enumeratedValue.description: 5 clocks. Minimum SCL high time is 5 clock of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: CLOCKS_6
enumeratedValue.description: 6 clocks. Minimum SCL high time is 6 clock of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: CLOCKS_7
enumeratedValue.description: 7 clocks. Minimum SCL high time is 7 clock of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: CLOCKS_8
enumeratedValue.description: 8 clocks. Minimum SCL high time is 8 clock of the I2C clock pre-divider.

enumeratedValue.name: CLOCKS_9
enumeratedValue.description: 9 clocks. Minimum SCL high time is 9 clocks of the I2C clock pre-divider.

register.name: MSTDAT
register.description: Combined Master receiver and transmitter data register.

field.name: DATA
field.description: Master function data register. Read: read the most recently received data for the Master function. Write: transmit data using the Master function.

field.name: SLVCONTINUE
field.description: Slave Continue.

enumeratedValue.name: CONTINUE
enumeratedValue.description: Continue. Informs the Slave function to continue to the next operation, by clearing the SLVPENDING flag in the STAT register. This must be done after writing transmit data, reading received data, or any other housekeeping related to the next bus operation. Automatic Operation has different requirements. SLVCONTINUE should not be set unless SLVPENDING = 1.

field.name: SLVNACK
field.description: Slave NACK.

enumeratedValue.name: NACK
enumeratedValue.description: NACK. Causes the Slave function to NACK the master when the slave is receiving data from the master (Slave Receiver mode).

field.name: SLVDMA
field.description: Slave DMA enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. No DMA requests are issued for Slave mode operation.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. DMA requests are issued for I2C slave data transmission and reception.

field.name: AUTOACK
field.description: Automatic Acknowledge.When this bit is set, it will cause an I2C header which matches SLVADR0 and the direction set by AUTOMATCHREAD to be ACKed immediately; this is used with DMA to allow processing of the data without intervention. If this bit is clear and a header matches SLVADR0, the behavior is controlled by AUTONACK in the SLVADR0 register: allowing NACK or interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: NORMAL
enumeratedValue.description: Normal, non-automatic operation. If AUTONACK = 0, an SlvPending interrupt is generated when a matching address is received. If AUTONACK = 1, received addresses are NACKed (ignored).

enumeratedValue.name: AUTOMATIC_ACK
enumeratedValue.description: A header with matching SLVADR0 and matching direction as set by AUTOMATCHREAD will be ACKed immediately, allowing the master to move on to the data bytes. If the address matches SLVADR0, but the direction does not match AUTOMATCHREAD, the behavior will depend on the AUTONACK bit in the SLVADR0 register: if AUTONACK is set, then it will be Nacked; else if AUTONACK is clear, then a SlvPending interrupt is generated.

field.name: AUTOMATCHREAD
field.description: When AUTOACK is set, this bit controls whether it matches a read or write request on the next header with an address matching SLVADR0. Since DMA needs to be configured to match the transfer direction, the direction needs to be specified. This bit allows a direction to be chosen for the next operation.

enumeratedValue.name: I2C_WRITE
enumeratedValue.description: The expected next operation in Automatic Mode is an I2C write.

enumeratedValue.name: I2C_READ
enumeratedValue.description: The expected next operation in Automatic Mode is an I2C read.

register.name: SLVDAT
register.description: Combined Slave receiver and transmitter data register.

field.name: DATA
field.description: Slave function data register. Read: read the most recently received data for the Slave function. Write: transmit data using the Slave function.

field.name: SADISABLE
field.description: Slave Address n Disable.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. Slave Address n is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Ignored Slave Address n is ignored.

field.name: SLVADR
field.description: Slave Address. Seven bit slave address that is compared to received addresses if enabled.

field.name: AUTONACK
field.description: Automatic NACK operation. Used in conjunction with AUTOACK and AUTOMATCHREAD, allows software to ignore I2C traffic while handling previous I2C data or other operations.

enumeratedValue.name: NORMAL
enumeratedValue.description: Normal operation, matching I2C addresses are not ignored.

enumeratedValue.name: AUTOMATIC
enumeratedValue.description: Automatic-only mode. All incoming addresses are ignored (NACKed), unless AUTOACK is set, it matches SLVADRn, and AUTOMATCHREAD matches the direction.

field.name: QUALMODE0
field.description: Qualify mode for slave address 0.

enumeratedValue.name: MASK
enumeratedValue.description: Mask. The SLVQUAL0 field is used as a logical mask for matching address 0.

enumeratedValue.name: EXTEND
enumeratedValue.description: Extend. The SLVQUAL0 field is used to extend address 0 matching in a range of addresses.

field.name: SLVQUAL0
field.description: Slave address Qualifier for address 0. A value of 0 causes the address in SLVADR0 to be used as-is, assuming that it is enabled. If QUALMODE0 = 0, any bit in this field which is set to 1 will cause an automatic match of the corresponding bit of the received address when it is compared to the SLVADR0 register. If QUALMODE0 = 1, an address range is matched for address 0. This range extends from the value defined by SLVADR0 to the address defined by SLVQUAL0 (address matches when SLVADR0[7:1] <= received address <= SLVQUAL0[7:1]).

field.name: MONRXDAT
field.description: Monitor function Receiver Data. This reflects every data byte that passes on the I2C pins.

field.name: MONSTART
field.description: Monitor Received Start.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_START_DETECTED
enumeratedValue.description: No start detected. The Monitor function has not detected a Start event on the I2C bus.

enumeratedValue.name: START_DETECTED
enumeratedValue.description: Start detected. The Monitor function has detected a Start event on the I2C bus.

field.name: MONRESTART
field.description: Monitor Received Repeated Start.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_DETECTED
enumeratedValue.description: No repeated start detected. The Monitor function has not detected a Repeated Start event on the I2C bus.

enumeratedValue.name: DETECTED
enumeratedValue.description: Repeated start detected. The Monitor function has detected a Repeated Start event on the I2C bus.

field.name: MONNACK
field.description: Monitor Received NACK.

enumeratedValue.name: ACKNOWLEDGED
enumeratedValue.description: Acknowledged. The data currently being provided by the Monitor function was acknowledged by at least one master or slave receiver.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_ACKNOWLEDGED
enumeratedValue.description: Not acknowledged. The data currently being provided by the Monitor function was not acknowledged by any receiver.

field.name: APERTURE
field.description: Aperture: encoded as (aperture size/4K) -1, so 0x00 means a 4K aperture.

field.name: MINOR_REV
field.description: Minor revision of module implementation.

field.name: MAJOR_REV
field.description: Major revision of module implementation.

field.name: ID
field.description: Module identifier for the selected function.

field.name: PAIRENABLE
field.description: Enable for this channel pair..

field.name: ONECHANNEL
field.description: Single channel mode.

field.name: POSITION
field.description: Data Position.

field.name: BUSY
field.description: Busy status for this channel pair.

field.name: SLVFRMERR
field.description: Save Frame Error flag.

field.name: LR
field.description: Left/Right indication.

field.name: DATAPAUSED
field.description: Data Paused status flag.

register.name: CFG1
register.description: Configuration register 1 for the primary channel pair.

field.name: MAINENABLE
field.description: Main enable for I 2S function in this Flexcomm

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: All I 2S channel pairs in this Flexcomm are disabled and the internal state machines, counters, and flags are reset. No other channel pairs can be enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: This I 2S channel pair is enabled. Other channel pairs in this Flexcomm may be enabled in their individual PAIRENABLE bits.

field.name: DATAPAUSE
field.description: Data flow Pause. Allows pausing data flow between the I2S serializer/deserializer and the FIFO. This could be done in order to change streams, or while restarting after a data underflow or overflow. When paused, FIFO operations can be done without corrupting data that is in the process of being sent or received. Once a data pause has been requested, the interface may need to complete sending data that was in progress before interrupting the flow of data. Software must check that the pause is actually in effect before taking action. This is done by monitoring the DATAPAUSED flag in the STAT register. When DATAPAUSE is cleared, data transfer will resume at the beginning of the next frame.

enumeratedValue.name: NORMAL
enumeratedValue.description: Normal operation, or resuming normal operation at the next frame if the I2S has already been paused.

enumeratedValue.name: PAUSE
enumeratedValue.description: A pause in the data flow is being requested. It is in effect when DATAPAUSED in STAT = 1.

field.name: PAIRCOUNT
field.description: Provides the number of I2S channel pairs in this Flexcomm This is a read-only field whose value may be different in other Flexcomms. 00 = there is 1 I2S channel pair in this Flexcomm. 01 = there are 2 I2S channel pairs in this Flexcomm. 10 = there are 3 I2S channel pairs in this Flexcomm. 11 = there are 4 I2S channel pairs in this Flexcomm.

enumeratedValue.name: PAIRS_1
enumeratedValue.description: 1 I2S channel pairs in this flexcomm

enumeratedValue.name: PAIRS_2
enumeratedValue.description: 2 I2S channel pairs in this flexcomm

enumeratedValue.name: PAIRS_3
enumeratedValue.description: 3 I2S channel pairs in this flexcomm

enumeratedValue.name: PAIRS_4
enumeratedValue.description: 4 I2S channel pairs in this flexcomm

field.name: MSTSLVCFG
field.description: Master / slave configuration selection, determining how SCK and WS are used by all channel pairs in this Flexcomm.

enumeratedValue.name: NORMAL_SLAVE_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: Normal slave mode, the default mode. SCK and WS are received from a master and used to transmit or receive data.

enumeratedValue.name: WS_SYNC_MASTER
enumeratedValue.description: WS synchronized master. WS is received from another master and used to synchronize the generation of SCK, when divided from the Flexcomm function clock.

enumeratedValue.name: MASTER_USING_SCK
enumeratedValue.description: Master using an existing SCK. SCK is received and used directly to generate WS, as well as transmitting or receiving data.

enumeratedValue.name: NORMAL_MASTER
enumeratedValue.description: Normal master mode. SCK and WS are generated so they can be sent to one or more slave devices.

field.name: MODE
field.description: Selects the basic I2S operating mode. Other configurations modify this to obtain all supported cases. See Formats and modes for examples.

enumeratedValue.name: CLASSIC_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: I2S mode a.k.a. 'classic' mode. WS has a 50% duty cycle, with (for each enabled channel pair) one piece of left channel data occurring during the first phase, and one pieces of right channel data occurring during the second phase. In this mode, the data region begins one clock after the leading WS edge for the frame. For a 50% WS duty cycle, FRAMELEN must define an even number of I2S clocks for the frame. If FRAMELEN defines an odd number of clocks per frame, the extra clock will occur on the right.

enumeratedValue.name: DSP_MODE_WS_50_DUTYCYCLE
enumeratedValue.description: DSP mode where WS has a 50% duty cycle. See remark for mode 0.

enumeratedValue.name: DSP_MODE_WS_1_CLOCK
enumeratedValue.description: DSP mode where WS has a one clock long pulse at the beginning of each data frame.

enumeratedValue.name: DSP_MODE_WS_1_DATA
enumeratedValue.description: DSP mode where WS has a one data slot long pulse at the beginning of each data frame.

field.name: RIGHTLOW
field.description: Right channel data is in the Low portion of FIFO data. Essentially, this swaps left and right channel data as it is transferred to or from the FIFO. This bit is not used if the data width is greater than 24 bits or if PDMDATA = 1. Note that if the ONECHANNEL field (bit 10 of this register) = 1, the one channel to be used is the nominally the left channel. POSITION can still place that data in the frame where right channel data is normally located. if all enabled channel pairs have ONECHANNEL = 1, then RIGHTLOW = 1 is not allowed.

enumeratedValue.name: RIGHT_HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: The right channel is taken from the high part of the FIFO data. For example, when data is 16 bits, FIFO bits 31:16 are used for the right channel.

enumeratedValue.name: RIGHT_LOW
enumeratedValue.description: The right channel is taken from the low part of the FIFO data. For example, when data is 16 bits, FIFO bits 15:0 are used for the right channel.

field.name: LEFTJUST
field.description: Left Justify data.

enumeratedValue.name: RIGHT_JUSTIFIED
enumeratedValue.description: Data is transferred between the FIFO and the I2S serializer/deserializer right justified, i.e. starting from bit 0 and continuing to the position defined by DATALEN. This would correspond to right justified data in the stream on the data bus.

enumeratedValue.name: LEFT_JUSTIFIED
enumeratedValue.description: Data is transferred between the FIFO and the I2S serializer/deserializer left justified, i.e. starting from the MSB of the FIFO entry and continuing for the number of bits defined by DATALEN. This would correspond to left justified data in the stream on the data bus.

field.name: ONECHANNEL
field.description: Single channel mode. Applies to both transmit and receive. This configuration bit applies only to the first I2S channel pair. Other channel pairs may select this mode independently in their separate CFG1 registers.

enumeratedValue.name: DUAL_CHANNEL
enumeratedValue.description: I2S data for this channel pair is treated as left and right channels.

enumeratedValue.name: SINGLE_CHANNEL
enumeratedValue.description: I2S data for this channel pair is treated as a single channel, functionally the left channel for this pair. In mode 0 only, the right side of the frame begins at POSITION = 0x100. This is because mode 0 makes a clear distinction between the left and right sides of the frame. When ONECHANNEL = 1, the single channel of data may be placed on the right by setting POSITION to 0x100 + the data position within the right side (e.g. 0x108 would place data starting at the 8th clock after the middle of the frame). In other modes, data for the single channel of data is placed at the clock defined by POSITION.

field.name: PDMDATA
field.description: PDM Data selection. This bit controls the data source for I2S transmit, and cannot be set in Rx mode. This bit only has an effect if the device the Flexcomm resides in includes a D-Mic subsystem. For the LPC55xx, this bit applies only to Flexcomm 6,7.

enumeratedValue.name: NORMAL
enumeratedValue.description: Normal operation, data is transferred to or from the Flexcomm FIFO.

enumeratedValue.name: DMIC_SUBSYSTEM
enumeratedValue.description: The data source is the D-Mic subsystem. When PDMDATA = 1, only the primary channel pair can be used in this Flexcomm. If ONECHANNEL = 1, only the PDM left data is used. the WS rate must match the Fs (sample rate) of the D-Mic decimator. A rate mismatch will at some point cause the I2S to overrun or underrun.

field.name: SCK_POL
field.description: SCK polarity.

enumeratedValue.name: FALLING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Data is launched on SCK falling edges and sampled on SCK rising edges (standard for I2S).

enumeratedValue.name: RISING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Data is launched on SCK rising edges and sampled on SCK falling edges.

field.name: WS_POL
field.description: WS polarity.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_INVERTED
enumeratedValue.description: Data frames begin at a falling edge of WS (standard for classic I2S).

enumeratedValue.name: INVERTED
enumeratedValue.description: WS is inverted, resulting in a data frame beginning at a rising edge of WS (standard for most 'non-classic' variations of I2S).

field.name: DATALEN
field.description: Data Length, minus 1 encoded, defines the number of data bits to be transmitted or received for all I2S channel pairs in this Flexcomm. Note that data is only driven to or received from SDA for the number of bits defined by DATALEN. DATALEN is also used in these ways by the I2S: Determines the size of data transfers between the FIFO and the I2S serializer/deserializer. See FIFO buffer configurations and usage In mode 1, 2, and 3, determines the location of right data following left data in the frame. In mode 3 (where WS has a one data slot long pulse at the beginning of each data frame) determines the duration of the WS pulse. Values: 0x00 to 0x02 = not supported 0x03 = data is 4 bits in length 0x04 = data is 5 bits in length 0x1F = data is 32 bits in length

register.name: CFG2
register.description: Configuration register 2 for the primary channel pair.

field.name: FRAMELEN
field.description: Frame Length, minus 1 encoded, defines the number of clocks and data bits in the frames that this channel pair participates in. See Frame format. 0x000 to 0x002 = not supported 0x003 = frame is 4 bits in total length 0x004 = frame is 5 bits in total length 0x1FF = frame is 512 bits in total length if FRAMELEN is an defines an odd length frame (e.g. 33 clocks) in mode 0 or 1, the extra clock appears in the right half. When MODE = 3, FRAMELEN must be larger than DATALEN in order for the WS pulse to be generated correctly.

field.name: POSITION
field.description: Data Position. Defines the location within the frame of the data for this channel pair. POSITION + DATALEN must be less than FRAMELEN. See Frame format. When MODE = 0, POSITION defines the location of data in both the left phase and right phase, starting one clock after the WS edge. In other modes, POSITION defines the location of data within the entire frame. ONECHANNEL = 1 while MODE = 0 is a special case, see the description of ONECHANNEL. The combination of DATALEN and the POSITION fields of all channel pairs must be made such that the channels do not overlap within the frame. 0x000 = data begins at bit position 0 (the first bit position) within the frame or WS phase. 0x001 = data begins at bit position 1 within the frame or WS phase. 0x002 = data begins at bit position 2 within the frame or WS phase.

register.name: STAT
register.description: Status register for the primary channel pair.

field.name: BUSY
field.description: Busy status for the primary channel pair. Other BUSY flags may be found in the STAT register for each channel pair.

enumeratedValue.name: IDLE
enumeratedValue.description: The transmitter/receiver for channel pair is currently idle.

enumeratedValue.name: BUSY
enumeratedValue.description: The transmitter/receiver for channel pair is currently processing data.

field.name: SLVFRMERR
field.description: Slave Frame Error flag. This applies when at least one channel pair is operating as a slave. An error indicates that the incoming WS signal did not transition as expected due to a mismatch between FRAMELEN and the actual incoming I2S stream.

enumeratedValue.name: ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: An error has been recorded for some channel pair that is operating in slave mode. ERROR is cleared by writing a 1 to this bit position.

field.name: LR
field.description: Left/Right indication. This flag is considered to be a debugging aid and is not expected to be used by an I2S driver. Valid when one channel pair is busy. Indicates left or right data being processed for the currently busy channel pair.

field.name: DATAPAUSED
field.description: Data Paused status flag. Applies to all I2S channels

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_PAUSED
enumeratedValue.description: Data is not currently paused. A data pause may have been requested but is not yet in force, waiting for an allowed pause point. Refer to the description of the DATAPAUSE control bit in the CFG1 register.

enumeratedValue.name: PAUSED
enumeratedValue.description: A data pause has been requested and is now in force.

register.name: DIV
register.description: Clock divider, used by all channel pairs.

field.name: DIV
field.description: This field controls how this I2S block uses the Flexcomm function clock. 0x000 = The Flexcomm function clock is used directly. 0x001 = The Flexcomm function clock is divided by 2. 0x002 = The Flexcomm function clock is divided by 3. 0xFFF = The Flexcomm function clock is divided by 4,096.

field.name: ENABLETX
field.description: Enable the transmit FIFO.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The transmit FIFO is not enabled.

field.name: ENABLERX
field.description: Enable the receive FIFO.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The receive FIFO is not enabled.

field.name: TXI2SE0
field.description: Transmit I2S empty 0. Determines the value sent by the I2S in transmit mode if the TX FIFO becomes empty. This value is sent repeatedly until the I2S is paused, the error is cleared, new data is provided, and the I2S is un-paused.

enumeratedValue.name: LAST_VALUE
enumeratedValue.description: If the TX FIFO becomes empty, the last value is sent. This setting may be used when the data length is 24 bits or less, or when MONO = 1 for this channel pair.

enumeratedValue.name: ZERO
enumeratedValue.description: If the TX FIFO becomes empty, 0 is sent. Use if the data length is greater than 24 bits or if zero fill is preferred.

field.name: PACK48
field.description: Packing format for 48-bit data. This relates to how data is entered into or taken from the FIFO by software or DMA.

enumeratedValue.name: BIT_24
enumeratedValue.description: 48-bit I2S FIFO entries are handled as all 24-bit values.

enumeratedValue.name: BIT_32_16
enumeratedValue.description: 48-bit I2S FIFO entries are handled as alternating 32-bit and 16-bit values.

field.name: SIZE
field.description: FIFO size configuration. This is a read-only field. 0x0 = FIFO is configured as 16 entries of 8 bits. 0x1, 0x2, 0x3 = not applicable to USART.

field.name: DMATX
field.description: DMA configuration for transmit.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: DMA is not used for the transmit function.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Trigger DMA for the transmit function if the FIFO is not full. Generally, data interrupts would be disabled if DMA is enabled.

field.name: DMARX
field.description: DMA configuration for receive.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: DMA is not used for the receive function.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Trigger DMA for the receive function if the FIFO is not empty. Generally, data interrupts would be disabled if DMA is enabled.

field.name: WAKETX
field.description: Wake-up for transmit FIFO level. This allows the device to be woken from reduced power modes (up to power-down, as long as the peripheral function works in that power mode) without enabling the TXLVL interrupt. Only DMA wakes up, processes data, and goes back to sleep. The CPU will remain stopped until woken by another cause, such as DMA completion. See Hardware Wake-up control register.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Only enabled interrupts will wake up the device form reduced power modes.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: A device wake-up for DMA will occur if the transmit FIFO level reaches the value specified by TXLVL in FIFOTRIG, even when the TXLVL interrupt is not enabled.

field.name: WAKERX
field.description: Wake-up for receive FIFO level. This allows the device to be woken from reduced power modes (up to power-down, as long as the peripheral function works in that power mode) without enabling the TXLVL interrupt. Only DMA wakes up, processes data, and goes back to sleep. The CPU will remain stopped until woken by another cause, such as DMA completion. See Hardware Wake-up control register.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Only enabled interrupts will wake up the device form reduced power modes.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: A device wake-up for DMA will occur if the receive FIFO level reaches the value specified by RXLVL in FIFOTRIG, even when the RXLVL interrupt is not enabled.

field.name: EMPTYTX
field.description: Empty command for the transmit FIFO. When a 1 is written to this bit, the TX FIFO is emptied.

field.name: EMPTYRX
field.description: Empty command for the receive FIFO. When a 1 is written to this bit, the RX FIFO is emptied.

field.name: POPDBG
field.description: Pop FIFO for debug reads.

enumeratedValue.name: DO_NOT_POP
enumeratedValue.description: Debug reads of the FIFO do not pop the FIFO.

enumeratedValue.name: POP
enumeratedValue.description: A debug read will cause the FIFO to pop.

field.name: TXERR
field.description: TX FIFO error. Will be set if a transmit FIFO error occurs. This could be an overflow caused by pushing data into a full FIFO, or by an underflow if the FIFO is empty when data is needed. Cleared by writing a 1 to this bit.

field.name: RXERR
field.description: RX FIFO error. Will be set if a receive FIFO overflow occurs, caused by software or DMA not emptying the FIFO fast enough. Cleared by writing a 1 to this bit.

field.name: PERINT
field.description: Peripheral interrupt. When 1, this indicates that the peripheral function has asserted an interrupt. The details can be found by reading the peripheral's STAT register.

field.name: TXEMPTY
field.description: Transmit FIFO empty. When 1, the transmit FIFO is empty. The peripheral may still be processing the last piece of data.

field.name: TXNOTFULL
field.description: Transmit FIFO not full. When 1, the transmit FIFO is not full, so more data can be written. When 0, the transmit FIFO is full and another write would cause it to overflow.

field.name: RXNOTEMPTY
field.description: Receive FIFO not empty. When 1, the receive FIFO is not empty, so data can be read. When 0, the receive FIFO is empty.

field.name: RXFULL
field.description: Receive FIFO full. When 1, the receive FIFO is full. Data needs to be read out to prevent the peripheral from causing an overflow.

field.name: TXLVL
field.description: Transmit FIFO current level. A 0 means the TX FIFO is currently empty, and the TXEMPTY and TXNOTFULL flags will be 1. Other values tell how much data is actually in the TX FIFO at the point where the read occurs. If the TX FIFO is full, the TXEMPTY and TXNOTFULL flags will be 0.

field.name: RXLVL
field.description: Receive FIFO current level. A 0 means the RX FIFO is currently empty, and the RXFULL and RXNOTEMPTY flags will be 0. Other values tell how much data is actually in the RX FIFO at the point where the read occurs. If the RX FIFO is full, the RXFULL and RXNOTEMPTY flags will be 1.

register.name: FIFOTRIG
register.description: FIFO trigger settings for interrupt and DMA request.

field.name: TXLVLENA
field.description: Transmit FIFO level trigger enable. This trigger will become an interrupt if enabled in FIFOINTENSET, or a DMA trigger if DMATX in FIFOCFG is set.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit FIFO level does not generate a FIFO level trigger.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: An trigger will be generated if the transmit FIFO level reaches the value specified by the TXLVL field in this register.

field.name: RXLVLENA
field.description: Receive FIFO level trigger enable. This trigger will become an interrupt if enabled in FIFOINTENSET, or a DMA trigger if DMARX in FIFOCFG is set.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Receive FIFO level does not generate a FIFO level trigger.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: An trigger will be generated if the receive FIFO level reaches the value specified by the RXLVL field in this register.

field.name: TXLVL
field.description: Transmit FIFO level trigger point. This field is used only when TXLVLENA = 1. If enabled to do so, the FIFO level can wake up the device just enough to perform DMA, then return to the reduced power mode. See Hardware Wake-up control register. 0 = trigger when the TX FIFO becomes empty. 1 = trigger when the TX FIFO level decreases to one entry. 15 = trigger when the TX FIFO level decreases to 15 entries (is no longer full).

field.name: RXLVL
field.description: Receive FIFO level trigger point. The RX FIFO level is checked when a new piece of data is received. This field is used only when RXLVLENA = 1. If enabled to do so, the FIFO level can wake up the device just enough to perform DMA, then return to the reduced power mode. See Hardware Wake-up control register. 0 = trigger when the RX FIFO has received one entry (is no longer empty). 1 = trigger when the RX FIFO has received two entries. 15 = trigger when the RX FIFO has received 16 entries (has become full).

register.name: FIFOINTENSET
register.description: FIFO interrupt enable set (enable) and read register.

field.name: TXERR
field.description: Determines whether an interrupt occurs when a transmit error occurs, based on the TXERR flag in the FIFOSTAT register.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt will be generated for a transmit error.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: An interrupt will be generated when a transmit error occurs.

field.name: RXERR
field.description: Determines whether an interrupt occurs when a receive error occurs, based on the RXERR flag in the FIFOSTAT register.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt will be generated for a receive error.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: An interrupt will be generated when a receive error occurs.

field.name: TXLVL
field.description: Determines whether an interrupt occurs when a the transmit FIFO reaches the level specified by the TXLVL field in the FIFOTRIG register.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt will be generated based on the TX FIFO level.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: If TXLVLENA in the FIFOTRIG register = 1, an interrupt will be generated when the TX FIFO level decreases to the level specified by TXLVL in the FIFOTRIG register.

field.name: RXLVL
field.description: Determines whether an interrupt occurs when a the receive FIFO reaches the level specified by the TXLVL field in the FIFOTRIG register.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt will be generated based on the RX FIFO level.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: If RXLVLENA in the FIFOTRIG register = 1, an interrupt will be generated when the when the RX FIFO level increases to the level specified by RXLVL in the FIFOTRIG register.

register.name: FIFOINTENCLR
register.description: FIFO interrupt enable clear (disable) and read register.

field.name: TXERR
field.description: Writing one clears the corresponding bits in the FIFOINTENSET register.

field.name: RXERR
field.description: Writing one clears the corresponding bits in the FIFOINTENSET register.

field.name: TXLVL
field.description: Writing one clears the corresponding bits in the FIFOINTENSET register.

field.name: RXLVL
field.description: Writing one clears the corresponding bits in the FIFOINTENSET register.

field.name: TXERR
field.description: TX FIFO error.

field.name: RXERR
field.description: RX FIFO error.

field.name: TXLVL
field.description: Transmit FIFO level interrupt.

field.name: RXLVL
field.description: Receive FIFO level interrupt.

field.name: PERINT
field.description: Peripheral interrupt.

field.name: TXDATA
field.description: Transmit data to the FIFO. The number of bits used depends on configuration details.

register.name: FIFOWR48H
register.description: FIFO write data for upper data bits. May only be used if the I2S is configured for 2x 24-bit data and not using DMA.

field.name: TXDATA
field.description: Transmit data to the FIFO. Whether this register is used and the number of bits used depends on configuration details.

field.name: RXDATA
field.description: Received data from the FIFO. The number of bits used depends on configuration details.

register.name: FIFORD48H
register.description: FIFO read data for upper data bits. May only be used if the I2S is configured for 2x 24-bit data and not using DMA.

field.name: RXDATA
field.description: Received data from the FIFO. Whether this register is used and the number of bits used depends on configuration details.

register.name: FIFORDNOPOP
register.description: FIFO data read with no FIFO pop.

field.name: RXDATA
field.description: Received data from the FIFO.

register.name: FIFORD48HNOPOP
register.description: FIFO data read for upper data bits with no FIFO pop. May only be used if the I2S is configured for 2x 24-bit data and not using DMA.

field.name: RXDATA
field.description: Received data from the FIFO. Whether this register is used and the number of bits used depends on configuration details.

field.name: Aperture
field.description: Aperture: encoded as (aperture size/4K) -1, so 0x00 means a 4K aperture.

field.name: Minor_Rev
field.description: Minor revision of module implementation, starting at 0.

field.name: Major_Rev
field.description: Major revision of module implementation, starting at 0.

field.name: ID
field.description: Unique module identifier for this IP block.

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: SPI enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The SPI is disabled and the internal state machine and counters are reset.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The SPI is enabled for operation.

field.name: MASTER
field.description: Master mode select.

enumeratedValue.name: SLAVE_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: Slave mode. The SPI will operate in slave mode. SCK, MOSI, and the SSEL signals are inputs, MISO is an output.

enumeratedValue.name: MASTER_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: Master mode. The SPI will operate in master mode. SCK, MOSI, and the SSEL signals are outputs, MISO is an input.

field.name: LSBF
field.description: LSB First mode enable.

enumeratedValue.name: STANDARD
enumeratedValue.description: Standard. Data is transmitted and received in standard MSB first order.

enumeratedValue.name: REVERSE
enumeratedValue.description: Reverse. Data is transmitted and received in reverse order (LSB first).

field.name: CPHA
field.description: Clock Phase select.

enumeratedValue.name: CHANGE
enumeratedValue.description: Change. The SPI captures serial data on the first clock transition of the transfer (when the clock changes away from the rest state). Data is changed on the following edge.

enumeratedValue.name: CAPTURE
enumeratedValue.description: Capture. The SPI changes serial data on the first clock transition of the transfer (when the clock changes away from the rest state). Data is captured on the following edge.

field.name: CPOL
field.description: Clock Polarity select.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: Low. The rest state of the clock (between transfers) is low.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: High. The rest state of the clock (between transfers) is high.

field.name: LOOP
field.description: Loopback mode enable. Loopback mode applies only to Master mode, and connects transmit and receive data connected together to allow simple software testing.

field.name: SPOL0
field.description: SSEL0 Polarity select.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: Low. The SSEL0 pin is active low.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: High. The SSEL0 pin is active high.

field.name: SPOL1
field.description: SSEL1 Polarity select.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: Low. The SSEL1 pin is active low.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: High. The SSEL1 pin is active high.

field.name: SPOL2
field.description: SSEL2 Polarity select.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: Low. The SSEL2 pin is active low.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: High. The SSEL2 pin is active high.

field.name: SPOL3
field.description: SSEL3 Polarity select.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: Low. The SSEL3 pin is active low.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: High. The SSEL3 pin is active high.

field.name: PRE_DELAY
field.description: Controls the amount of time between SSEL assertion and the beginning of a data transfer. There is always one SPI clock time between SSEL assertion and the first clock edge. This is not considered part of the pre-delay. 0x0 = No additional time is inserted. 0x1 = 1 SPI clock time is inserted. 0x2 = 2 SPI clock times are inserted. 0xF = 15 SPI clock times are inserted.

field.name: POST_DELAY
field.description: Controls the amount of time between the end of a data transfer and SSEL deassertion. 0x0 = No additional time is inserted. 0x1 = 1 SPI clock time is inserted. 0x2 = 2 SPI clock times are inserted. 0xF = 15 SPI clock times are inserted.

field.name: FRAME_DELAY
field.description: If the EOF flag is set, controls the minimum amount of time between the current frame and the next frame (or SSEL deassertion if EOT). 0x0 = No additional time is inserted. 0x1 = 1 SPI clock time is inserted. 0x2 = 2 SPI clock times are inserted. 0xF = 15 SPI clock times are inserted.

field.name: TRANSFER_DELAY
field.description: Controls the minimum amount of time that the SSEL is deasserted between transfers. 0x0 = The minimum time that SSEL is deasserted is 1 SPI clock time. (Zero added time.) 0x1 = The minimum time that SSEL is deasserted is 2 SPI clock times. 0x2 = The minimum time that SSEL is deasserted is 3 SPI clock times. 0xF = The minimum time that SSEL is deasserted is 16 SPI clock times.

register.name: STAT
register.description: SPI Status. Some status flags can be cleared by writing a 1 to that bit position.

field.name: SSA
field.description: Slave Select Assert. This flag is set whenever any slave select transitions from deasserted to asserted, in both master and slave modes. This allows determining when the SPI transmit/receive functions become busy, and allows waking up the device from reduced power modes when a slave mode access begins. This flag is cleared by software.

field.name: SSD
field.description: Slave Select Deassert. This flag is set whenever any asserted slave selects transition to deasserted, in both master and slave modes. This allows determining when the SPI transmit/receive functions become idle. This flag is cleared by software.

field.name: STALLED
field.description: Stalled status flag. This indicates whether the SPI is currently in a stall condition.

field.name: ENDTRANSFER
field.description: End Transfer control bit. Software can set this bit to force an end to the current transfer when the transmitter finishes any activity already in progress, as if the EOT flag had been set prior to the last transmission. This capability is included to support cases where it is not known when transmit data is written that it will be the end of a transfer. The bit is cleared when the transmitter becomes idle as the transfer comes to an end. Forcing an end of transfer in this manner causes any specified FRAME_DELAY and TRANSFER_DELAY to be inserted.

field.name: MSTIDLE
field.description: Master idle status flag. This bit is 1 whenever the SPI master function is fully idle. This means that the transmit holding register is empty and the transmitter is not in the process of sending data.

register.name: INTENSET
register.description: SPI Interrupt Enable read and Set. A complete value may be read from this register. Writing a 1 to any implemented bit position causes that bit to be set.

field.name: SSAEN
field.description: Slave select assert interrupt enable. Determines whether an interrupt occurs when the Slave Select is asserted.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. No interrupt will be generated when any Slave Select transitions from deasserted to asserted.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. An interrupt will be generated when any Slave Select transitions from deasserted to asserted.

field.name: SSDEN
field.description: Slave select deassert interrupt enable. Determines whether an interrupt occurs when the Slave Select is deasserted.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. No interrupt will be generated when all asserted Slave Selects transition to deasserted.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. An interrupt will be generated when all asserted Slave Selects transition to deasserted.

field.name: MSTIDLEEN
field.description: Master idle interrupt enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt will be generated when the SPI master function is idle.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: An interrupt will be generated when the SPI master function is fully idle.

register.name: INTENCLR
register.description: SPI Interrupt Enable Clear. Writing a 1 to any implemented bit position causes the corresponding bit in INTENSET to be cleared.

field.name: SSAEN
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: SSDEN
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: MSTIDLE
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: DIVVAL
field.description: Rate divider value. Specifies how the Flexcomm clock (FCLK) is divided to produce the SPI clock rate in master mode. DIVVAL is -1 encoded such that the value 0 results in FCLK/1, the value 1 results in FCLK/2, up to the maximum possible divide value of 0xFFFF, which results in FCLK/65536.

field.name: SSA
field.description: Slave Select Assert.

field.name: SSD
field.description: Slave Select Deassert.

field.name: MSTIDLE
field.description: Master Idle status flag.

field.name: ENABLETX
field.description: Enable the transmit FIFO.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The transmit FIFO is not enabled.

field.name: ENABLERX
field.description: Enable the receive FIFO.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The receive FIFO is not enabled.

field.name: SIZE
field.description: FIFO size configuration. This is a read-only field. 0x0 = FIFO is configured as 16 entries of 8 bits. 0x1, 0x2, 0x3 = not applicable to USART.

field.name: DMATX
field.description: DMA configuration for transmit.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: DMA is not used for the transmit function.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Trigger DMA for the transmit function if the FIFO is not full. Generally, data interrupts would be disabled if DMA is enabled.

field.name: DMARX
field.description: DMA configuration for receive.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: DMA is not used for the receive function.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Trigger DMA for the receive function if the FIFO is not empty. Generally, data interrupts would be disabled if DMA is enabled.

field.name: WAKETX
field.description: Wake-up for transmit FIFO level. This allows the device to be woken from reduced power modes (up to power-down, as long as the peripheral function works in that power mode) without enabling the TXLVL interrupt. Only DMA wakes up, processes data, and goes back to sleep. The CPU will remain stopped until woken by another cause, such as DMA completion. See Hardware Wake-up control register.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Only enabled interrupts will wake up the device form reduced power modes.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: A device wake-up for DMA will occur if the transmit FIFO level reaches the value specified by TXLVL in FIFOTRIG, even when the TXLVL interrupt is not enabled.

field.name: WAKERX
field.description: Wake-up for receive FIFO level. This allows the device to be woken from reduced power modes (up to power-down, as long as the peripheral function works in that power mode) without enabling the TXLVL interrupt. Only DMA wakes up, processes data, and goes back to sleep. The CPU will remain stopped until woken by another cause, such as DMA completion. See Hardware Wake-up control register.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Only enabled interrupts will wake up the device form reduced power modes.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: A device wake-up for DMA will occur if the receive FIFO level reaches the value specified by RXLVL in FIFOTRIG, even when the RXLVL interrupt is not enabled.

field.name: EMPTYTX
field.description: Empty command for the transmit FIFO. When a 1 is written to this bit, the TX FIFO is emptied.

field.name: EMPTYRX
field.description: Empty command for the receive FIFO. When a 1 is written to this bit, the RX FIFO is emptied.

field.name: POPDBG
field.description: Pop FIFO for debug reads.

enumeratedValue.name: DO_NOT_POP
enumeratedValue.description: Debug reads of the FIFO do not pop the FIFO.

enumeratedValue.name: POP
enumeratedValue.description: A debug read will cause the FIFO to pop.

field.name: TXERR
field.description: TX FIFO error. Will be set if a transmit FIFO error occurs. This could be an overflow caused by pushing data into a full FIFO, or by an underflow if the FIFO is empty when data is needed. Cleared by writing a 1 to this bit.

field.name: RXERR
field.description: RX FIFO error. Will be set if a receive FIFO overflow occurs, caused by software or DMA not emptying the FIFO fast enough. Cleared by writing a 1 to this bit.

field.name: PERINT
field.description: Peripheral interrupt. When 1, this indicates that the peripheral function has asserted an interrupt. The details can be found by reading the peripheral's STAT register.

field.name: TXEMPTY
field.description: Transmit FIFO empty. When 1, the transmit FIFO is empty. The peripheral may still be processing the last piece of data.

field.name: TXNOTFULL
field.description: Transmit FIFO not full. When 1, the transmit FIFO is not full, so more data can be written. When 0, the transmit FIFO is full and another write would cause it to overflow.

field.name: RXNOTEMPTY
field.description: Receive FIFO not empty. When 1, the receive FIFO is not empty, so data can be read. When 0, the receive FIFO is empty.

field.name: RXFULL
field.description: Receive FIFO full. When 1, the receive FIFO is full. Data needs to be read out to prevent the peripheral from causing an overflow.

field.name: TXLVL
field.description: Transmit FIFO current level. A 0 means the TX FIFO is currently empty, and the TXEMPTY and TXNOTFULL flags will be 1. Other values tell how much data is actually in the TX FIFO at the point where the read occurs. If the TX FIFO is full, the TXEMPTY and TXNOTFULL flags will be 0.

field.name: RXLVL
field.description: Receive FIFO current level. A 0 means the RX FIFO is currently empty, and the RXFULL and RXNOTEMPTY flags will be 0. Other values tell how much data is actually in the RX FIFO at the point where the read occurs. If the RX FIFO is full, the RXFULL and RXNOTEMPTY flags will be 1.

register.name: FIFOTRIG
register.description: FIFO trigger settings for interrupt and DMA request.

field.name: TXLVLENA
field.description: Transmit FIFO level trigger enable. This trigger will become an interrupt if enabled in FIFOINTENSET, or a DMA trigger if DMATX in FIFOCFG is set.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit FIFO level does not generate a FIFO level trigger.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: An trigger will be generated if the transmit FIFO level reaches the value specified by the TXLVL field in this register.

field.name: RXLVLENA
field.description: Receive FIFO level trigger enable. This trigger will become an interrupt if enabled in FIFOINTENSET, or a DMA trigger if DMARX in FIFOCFG is set.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Receive FIFO level does not generate a FIFO level trigger.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: An trigger will be generated if the receive FIFO level reaches the value specified by the RXLVL field in this register.

field.name: TXLVL
field.description: Transmit FIFO level trigger point. This field is used only when TXLVLENA = 1. If enabled to do so, the FIFO level can wake up the device just enough to perform DMA, then return to the reduced power mode. See Hardware Wake-up control register. 0 = trigger when the TX FIFO becomes empty. 1 = trigger when the TX FIFO level decreases to one entry. 15 = trigger when the TX FIFO level decreases to 15 entries (is no longer full).

field.name: RXLVL
field.description: Receive FIFO level trigger point. The RX FIFO level is checked when a new piece of data is received. This field is used only when RXLVLENA = 1. If enabled to do so, the FIFO level can wake up the device just enough to perform DMA, then return to the reduced power mode. See Hardware Wake-up control register. 0 = trigger when the RX FIFO has received one entry (is no longer empty). 1 = trigger when the RX FIFO has received two entries. 15 = trigger when the RX FIFO has received 16 entries (has become full).

register.name: FIFOINTENSET
register.description: FIFO interrupt enable set (enable) and read register.

field.name: TXERR
field.description: Determines whether an interrupt occurs when a transmit error occurs, based on the TXERR flag in the FIFOSTAT register.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt will be generated for a transmit error.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: An interrupt will be generated when a transmit error occurs.

field.name: RXERR
field.description: Determines whether an interrupt occurs when a receive error occurs, based on the RXERR flag in the FIFOSTAT register.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt will be generated for a receive error.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: An interrupt will be generated when a receive error occurs.

field.name: TXLVL
field.description: Determines whether an interrupt occurs when a the transmit FIFO reaches the level specified by the TXLVL field in the FIFOTRIG register.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt will be generated based on the TX FIFO level.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: If TXLVLENA in the FIFOTRIG register = 1, an interrupt will be generated when the TX FIFO level decreases to the level specified by TXLVL in the FIFOTRIG register.

field.name: RXLVL
