field.description: Determines whether an interrupt occurs when a the receive FIFO reaches the level specified by the TXLVL field in the FIFOTRIG register.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt will be generated based on the RX FIFO level.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: If RXLVLENA in the FIFOTRIG register = 1, an interrupt will be generated when the when the RX FIFO level increases to the level specified by RXLVL in the FIFOTRIG register.

register.name: FIFOINTENCLR
register.description: FIFO interrupt enable clear (disable) and read register.

field.name: TXERR
field.description: Writing one clears the corresponding bits in the FIFOINTENSET register.

field.name: RXERR
field.description: Writing one clears the corresponding bits in the FIFOINTENSET register.

field.name: TXLVL
field.description: Writing one clears the corresponding bits in the FIFOINTENSET register.

field.name: RXLVL
field.description: Writing one clears the corresponding bits in the FIFOINTENSET register.

field.name: TXERR
field.description: TX FIFO error.

field.name: RXERR
field.description: RX FIFO error.

field.name: TXLVL
field.description: Transmit FIFO level interrupt.

field.name: RXLVL
field.description: Receive FIFO level interrupt.

field.name: PERINT
field.description: Peripheral interrupt.

field.name: TXDATA
field.description: Transmit data to the FIFO.

field.name: TXSSEL0_N
field.description: Transmit slave select. This field asserts SSEL0 in master mode. The output on the pin is active LOW by default.

field.name: TXSSEL1_N
field.description: Transmit slave select. This field asserts SSEL1 in master mode. The output on the pin is active LOW by default.

field.name: TXSSEL2_N
field.description: Transmit slave select. This field asserts SSEL2 in master mode. The output on the pin is active LOW by default.

field.name: TXSSEL3_N
field.description: Transmit slave select. This field asserts SSEL3 in master mode. The output on the pin is active LOW by default.

field.name: EOT
field.description: End of transfer. The asserted SSEL will be deasserted at the end of a transfer and remain so far at least the time specified by the Transfer_delay value in the DLY register.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_DEASSERTED
enumeratedValue.description: SSEL not deasserted. This piece of data is not treated as the end of a transfer. SSEL will not be deasserted at the end of this data.

enumeratedValue.name: DEASSERTED
enumeratedValue.description: SSEL deasserted. This piece of data is treated as the end of a transfer. SSEL will be deasserted at the end of this piece of data.

field.name: EOF
field.description: End of frame. Between frames, a delay may be inserted, as defined by the Frame_delay value in the DLY register. The end of a frame may not be particularly meaningful if the Frame_delay value = 0. This control can be used as part of the support for frame lengths greater than 16 bits.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_EOF
enumeratedValue.description: Data not EOF. This piece of data transmitted is not treated as the end of a frame.

enumeratedValue.name: EOF
enumeratedValue.description: Data EOF. This piece of data is treated as the end of a frame, causing the Frame_delay time to be inserted before subsequent data is transmitted.

field.name: RXIGNORE
field.description: Receive Ignore. This allows data to be transmitted using the SPI without the need to read unneeded data from the receiver. Setting this bit simplifies the transmit process and can be used with the DMA.

enumeratedValue.name: READ
enumeratedValue.description: Read received data. Received data must be read in order to allow transmission to progress. SPI transmit will halt when the receive data FIFO is full. In slave mode, an overrun error will occur if received data is not read before new data is received.

enumeratedValue.name: IGNORE
enumeratedValue.description: Ignore received data. Received data is ignored, allowing transmission without reading unneeded received data. No receiver flags are generated.

field.name: LEN
field.description: Data Length. Specifies the data length from 4 to 16 bits. Note that transfer lengths greater than 16 bits are supported by implementing multiple sequential transmits. 0x0-2 = Reserved. 0x3 = Data transfer is 4 bits in length. 0x4 = Data transfer is 5 bits in length. 0xF = Data transfer is 16 bits in length.

field.name: RXDATA
field.description: Received data from the FIFO.

field.name: RXSSEL0_N
field.description: Slave Select for receive. This field allows the state of the SSEL0 pin to be saved along with received data. The value will reflect the SSEL0 pin for both master and slave operation. A zero indicates that a slave select is active. The actual polarity of each slave select pin is configured by the related SPOL bit in CFG.

field.name: RXSSEL1_N
field.description: Slave Select for receive. This field allows the state of the SSEL1 pin to be saved along with received data. The value will reflect the SSEL1 pin for both master and slave operation. A zero indicates that a slave select is active. The actual polarity of each slave select pin is configured by the related SPOL bit in CFG.

field.name: RXSSEL2_N
field.description: Slave Select for receive. This field allows the state of the SSEL2 pin to be saved along with received data. The value will reflect the SSEL2 pin for both master and slave operation. A zero indicates that a slave select is active. The actual polarity of each slave select pin is configured by the related SPOL bit in CFG.

field.name: RXSSEL3_N
field.description: Slave Select for receive. This field allows the state of the SSEL3 pin to be saved along with received data. The value will reflect the SSEL3 pin for both master and slave operation. A zero indicates that a slave select is active. The actual polarity of each slave select pin is configured by the related SPOL bit in CFG.

field.name: SOT
field.description: Start of Transfer flag. This flag will be 1 if this is the first data after the SSELs went from deasserted to asserted (i.e., any previous transfer has ended). This information can be used to identify the first piece of data in cases where the transfer length is greater than 16 bits.

register.name: FIFORDNOPOP
register.description: FIFO data read with no FIFO pop.

field.name: RXDATA
field.description: Received data from the FIFO.

field.name: RXSSEL0_N
field.description: Slave Select for receive.

field.name: RXSSEL1_N
field.description: Slave Select for receive.

field.name: RXSSEL2_N
field.description: Slave Select for receive.

field.name: RXSSEL3_N
field.description: Slave Select for receive.

field.name: SOT
field.description: Start of transfer flag.

field.name: APERTURE
field.description: Aperture: encoded as (aperture size/4K) -1, so 0x00 means a 4K aperture.

field.name: MINOR_REV
field.description: Minor revision of module implementation.

field.name: MAJOR_REV
field.description: Major revision of module implementation.

field.name: ID
field.description: Module identifier for the selected function.

register.name: CFG
register.description: USART Configuration register. Basic USART configuration settings that typically are not changed during operation.

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: USART Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The USART is disabled and the internal state machine and counters are reset. While Enable = 0, all USART interrupts and DMA transfers are disabled. When Enable is set again, CFG and most other control bits remain unchanged. When re-enabled, the USART will immediately be ready to transmit because the transmitter has been reset and is therefore available.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The USART is enabled for operation.

field.name: DATALEN
field.description: Selects the data size for the USART.

enumeratedValue.name: BIT_9
enumeratedValue.description: 9 bit data length. The 9th bit is commonly used for addressing in multidrop mode. See the ADDRDET bit in the CTL register.

field.name: PARITYSEL
field.description: Selects what type of parity is used by the USART.

enumeratedValue.name: EVEN_PARITY
enumeratedValue.description: Even parity. Adds a bit to each character such that the number of 1s in a transmitted character is even, and the number of 1s in a received character is expected to be even.

enumeratedValue.name: ODD_PARITY
enumeratedValue.description: Odd parity. Adds a bit to each character such that the number of 1s in a transmitted character is odd, and the number of 1s in a received character is expected to be odd.

field.name: STOPLEN
field.description: Number of stop bits appended to transmitted data. Only a single stop bit is required for received data.

enumeratedValue.name: BITS_2
enumeratedValue.description: 2 stop bits. This setting should only be used for asynchronous communication.

field.name: MODE32K
field.description: Selects standard or 32 kHz clocking mode.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. USART uses the 32 kHz clock from the RTC oscillator as the clock source to the BRG, and uses a special bit clocking scheme.

field.name: LINMODE
field.description: LIN break mode enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Break detect and generate is configured for normal operation.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. Break detect and generate is configured for LIN bus operation.

field.name: CTSEN
field.description: CTS Enable. Determines whether CTS is used for flow control. CTS can be from the input pin, or from the USART's own RTS if loopback mode is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: No flow control. The transmitter does not receive any automatic flow control signal.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Flow control enabled. The transmitter uses the CTS input (or RTS output in loopback mode) for flow control purposes.

field.name: SYNCEN
field.description: Selects synchronous or asynchronous operation.

field.name: CLKPOL
field.description: Selects the clock polarity and sampling edge of received data in synchronous mode.

enumeratedValue.name: FALLING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Falling edge. Un_RXD is sampled on the falling edge of SCLK.

enumeratedValue.name: RISING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Rising edge. Un_RXD is sampled on the rising edge of SCLK.

field.name: SYNCMST
field.description: Synchronous mode Master select.

enumeratedValue.name: SLAVE
enumeratedValue.description: Slave. When synchronous mode is enabled, the USART is a slave.

enumeratedValue.name: MASTER
enumeratedValue.description: Master. When synchronous mode is enabled, the USART is a master.

field.name: LOOP
field.description: Selects data loopback mode.

enumeratedValue.name: LOOPBACK
enumeratedValue.description: Loopback mode. This provides a mechanism to perform diagnostic loopback testing for USART data. Serial data from the transmitter (Un_TXD) is connected internally to serial input of the receive (Un_RXD). Un_TXD and Un_RTS activity will also appear on external pins if these functions are configured to appear on device pins. The receiver RTS signal is also looped back to CTS and performs flow control if enabled by CTSEN.

field.name: OETA
field.description: Output Enable Turnaround time enable for RS-485 operation.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. If selected by OESEL, the Output Enable signal deasserted at the end of the last stop bit of a transmission.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. If selected by OESEL, the Output Enable signal remains asserted for one character time after the end of the last stop bit of a transmission. OE will also remain asserted if another transmit begins before it is deasserted.

field.name: AUTOADDR
field.description: Automatic Address matching enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. When addressing is enabled by ADDRDET, address matching is done by software. This provides the possibility of versatile addressing (e.g. respond to more than one address).

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. When addressing is enabled by ADDRDET, address matching is done by hardware, using the value in the ADDR register as the address to match.

field.name: OESEL
field.description: Output Enable Select.

enumeratedValue.name: STANDARD
enumeratedValue.description: Standard. The RTS signal is used as the standard flow control function.

enumeratedValue.name: RS_485
enumeratedValue.description: RS-485. The RTS signal configured to provide an output enable signal to control an RS-485 transceiver.

field.name: OEPOL
field.description: Output Enable Polarity.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: Low. If selected by OESEL, the output enable is active low.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: High. If selected by OESEL, the output enable is active high.

field.name: RXPOL
field.description: Receive data polarity.

enumeratedValue.name: STANDARD
enumeratedValue.description: Standard. The RX signal is used as it arrives from the pin. This means that the RX rest value is 1, start bit is 0, data is not inverted, and the stop bit is 1.

enumeratedValue.name: INVERTED
enumeratedValue.description: Inverted. The RX signal is inverted before being used by the USART. This means that the RX rest value is 0, start bit is 1, data is inverted, and the stop bit is 0.

field.name: TXPOL
field.description: Transmit data polarity.

enumeratedValue.name: STANDARD
enumeratedValue.description: Standard. The TX signal is sent out without change. This means that the TX rest value is 1, start bit is 0, data is not inverted, and the stop bit is 1.

enumeratedValue.name: INVERTED
enumeratedValue.description: Inverted. The TX signal is inverted by the USART before being sent out. This means that the TX rest value is 0, start bit is 1, data is inverted, and the stop bit is 0.

register.name: CTL
register.description: USART Control register. USART control settings that are more likely to change during operation.

field.name: TXBRKEN
field.description: Break Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: CONTINOUS
enumeratedValue.description: Continuous break. Continuous break is sent immediately when this bit is set, and remains until this bit is cleared. A break may be sent without danger of corrupting any currently transmitting character if the transmitter is first disabled (TXDIS in CTL is set) and then waiting for the transmitter to be disabled (TXDISINT in STAT = 1) before writing 1 to TXBRKEN.

field.name: ADDRDET
field.description: Enable address detect mode.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The USART presents all incoming data.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The USART receiver ignores incoming data that does not have the most significant bit of the data (typically the 9th bit) = 1. When the data MSB bit = 1, the receiver treats the incoming data normally, generating a received data interrupt. Software can then check the data to see if this is an address that should be handled. If it is, the ADDRDET bit is cleared by software and further incoming data is handled normally.

field.name: TXDIS
field.description: Transmit Disable.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Not disabled. USART transmitter is not disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. USART transmitter is disabled after any character currently being transmitted is complete. This feature can be used to facilitate software flow control.

field.name: CC
field.description: Continuous Clock generation. By default, SCLK is only output while data is being transmitted in synchronous mode.

enumeratedValue.name: CLOCK_ON_CHARACTER
enumeratedValue.description: Clock on character. In synchronous mode, SCLK cycles only when characters are being sent on Un_TXD or to complete a character that is being received.

enumeratedValue.name: CONTINOUS_CLOCK
enumeratedValue.description: Continuous clock. SCLK runs continuously in synchronous mode, allowing characters to be received on Un_RxD independently from transmission on Un_TXD).

field.name: CLRCCONRX
field.description: Clear Continuous Clock.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect. No effect on the CC bit.

enumeratedValue.name: AUTO_CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Auto-clear. The CC bit is automatically cleared when a complete character has been received. This bit is cleared at the same time.

field.name: AUTOBAUD
field.description: Autobaud enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. USART is in normal operating mode.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. USART is in autobaud mode. This bit should only be set when the USART receiver is idle. The first start bit of RX is measured and used the update the BRG register to match the received data rate. AUTOBAUD is cleared once this process is complete, or if there is an AERR.

register.name: STAT
register.description: USART Status register. The complete status value can be read here. Writing ones clears some bits in the register. Some bits can be cleared by writing a 1 to them.

field.name: RXIDLE
field.description: Receiver Idle. When 0, indicates that the receiver is currently in the process of receiving data. When 1, indicates that the receiver is not currently in the process of receiving data.

field.name: TXIDLE
field.description: Transmitter Idle. When 0, indicates that the transmitter is currently in the process of sending data.When 1, indicate that the transmitter is not currently in the process of sending data.

field.name: CTS
field.description: This bit reflects the current state of the CTS signal, regardless of the setting of the CTSEN bit in the CFG register. This will be the value of the CTS input pin unless loopback mode is enabled.

field.name: DELTACTS
field.description: This bit is set when a change in the state is detected for the CTS flag above. This bit is cleared by software.

field.name: TXDISSTAT
field.description: Transmitter Disabled Status flag. When 1, this bit indicates that the USART transmitter is fully idle after being disabled via the TXDIS bit in the CFG register (TXDIS = 1).

field.name: RXBRK
field.description: Received Break. This bit reflects the current state of the receiver break detection logic. It is set when the Un_RXD pin remains low for 16 bit times. Note that FRAMERRINT will also be set when this condition occurs because the stop bit(s) for the character would be missing. RXBRK is cleared when the Un_RXD pin goes high.

field.name: DELTARXBRK
field.description: This bit is set when a change in the state of receiver break detection occurs. Cleared by software.

field.name: START
field.description: This bit is set when a start is detected on the receiver input. Its purpose is primarily to allow wake-up from Deep-sleep or Power-down mode immediately when a start is detected. Cleared by software.

field.name: FRAMERRINT
field.description: Framing Error interrupt flag. This flag is set when a character is received with a missing stop bit at the expected location. This could be an indication of a baud rate or configuration mismatch with the transmitting source.

field.name: PARITYERRINT
field.description: Parity Error interrupt flag. This flag is set when a parity error is detected in a received character.

field.name: RXNOISEINT
field.description: Received Noise interrupt flag. Three samples of received data are taken in order to determine the value of each received data bit, except in synchronous mode. This acts as a noise filter if one sample disagrees. This flag is set when a received data bit contains one disagreeing sample. This could indicate line noise, a baud rate or character format mismatch, or loss of synchronization during data reception.

field.name: ABERR
field.description: Auto baud Error. An auto baud error can occur if the BRG counts to its limit before the end of the start bit that is being measured, essentially an auto baud time-out.

register.name: INTENSET
register.description: Interrupt Enable read and Set register for USART (not FIFO) status. Contains individual interrupt enable bits for each potential USART interrupt. A complete value may be read from this register. Writing a 1 to any implemented bit position causes that bit to be set.

field.name: TXIDLEEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when the transmitter becomes idle (TXIDLE = 1).

field.name: DELTACTSEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when there is a change in the state of the CTS input.

field.name: TXDISEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when the transmitter is fully disabled as indicated by the TXDISINT flag in STAT. See description of the TXDISINT bit for details.

field.name: DELTARXBRKEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when a change of state has occurred in the detection of a received break condition (break condition asserted or deasserted).

field.name: STARTEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when a received start bit has been detected.

field.name: FRAMERREN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when a framing error has been detected.

field.name: PARITYERREN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when a parity error has been detected.

field.name: RXNOISEEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when noise is detected. See description of the RXNOISEINT bit in Table 354.

field.name: ABERREN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when an auto baud error occurs.

register.name: INTENCLR
register.description: Interrupt Enable Clear register. Allows clearing any combination of bits in the INTENSET register. Writing a 1 to any implemented bit position causes the corresponding bit to be cleared.

field.name: TXIDLECLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: DELTACTSCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: TXDISCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: DELTARXBRKCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: STARTCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: FRAMERRCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: PARITYERRCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: RXNOISECLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: ABERRCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

register.name: BRG
register.description: Baud Rate Generator register. 16-bit integer baud rate divisor value.

field.name: BRGVAL
field.description: This value is used to divide the USART input clock to determine the baud rate, based on the input clock from the FRG. 0 = FCLK is used directly by the USART function. 1 = FCLK is divided by 2 before use by the USART function. 2 = FCLK is divided by 3 before use by the USART function. 0xFFFF = FCLK is divided by 65,536 before use by the USART function.

register.name: INTSTAT
register.description: Interrupt status register. Reflects interrupts that are currently enabled.

field.name: TXIDLE
field.description: Transmitter Idle status.

field.name: DELTACTS
field.description: This bit is set when a change in the state of the CTS input is detected.

field.name: TXDISINT
field.description: Transmitter Disabled Interrupt flag.

field.name: DELTARXBRK
field.description: This bit is set when a change in the state of receiver break detection occurs.

field.name: START
field.description: This bit is set when a start is detected on the receiver input.

field.name: FRAMERRINT
field.description: Framing Error interrupt flag.

field.name: PARITYERRINT
field.description: Parity Error interrupt flag.

field.name: RXNOISEINT
field.description: Received Noise interrupt flag.

field.name: ABERRINT
field.description: Auto baud Error Interrupt flag.

register.name: OSR
register.description: Oversample selection register for asynchronous communication.

field.name: OSRVAL
field.description: Oversample Selection Value. 0 to 3 = not supported 0x4 = 5 function clocks are used to transmit and receive each data bit. 0x5 = 6 function clocks are used to transmit and receive each data bit. 0xF= 16 function clocks are used to transmit and receive each data bit.

register.name: ADDR
register.description: Address register for automatic address matching.

field.name: ADDRESS
field.description: 8-bit address used with automatic address matching. Used when address detection is enabled (ADDRDET in CTL = 1) and automatic address matching is enabled (AUTOADDR in CFG = 1).

field.name: ENABLETX
field.description: Enable the transmit FIFO.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The transmit FIFO is not enabled.

field.name: ENABLERX
field.description: Enable the receive FIFO.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The receive FIFO is not enabled.

field.name: SIZE
field.description: FIFO size configuration. This is a read-only field. 0x0 = FIFO is configured as 16 entries of 8 bits. 0x1, 0x2, 0x3 = not applicable to USART.

field.name: DMATX
field.description: DMA configuration for transmit.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: DMA is not used for the transmit function.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Trigger DMA for the transmit function if the FIFO is not full. Generally, data interrupts would be disabled if DMA is enabled.

field.name: DMARX
field.description: DMA configuration for receive.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: DMA is not used for the receive function.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Trigger DMA for the receive function if the FIFO is not empty. Generally, data interrupts would be disabled if DMA is enabled.

field.name: WAKETX
field.description: Wake-up for transmit FIFO level. This allows the device to be woken from reduced power modes (up to power-down, as long as the peripheral function works in that power mode) without enabling the TXLVL interrupt. Only DMA wakes up, processes data, and goes back to sleep. The CPU will remain stopped until woken by another cause, such as DMA completion. See Hardware Wake-up control register.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Only enabled interrupts will wake up the device form reduced power modes.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: A device wake-up for DMA will occur if the transmit FIFO level reaches the value specified by TXLVL in FIFOTRIG, even when the TXLVL interrupt is not enabled.

field.name: WAKERX
field.description: Wake-up for receive FIFO level. This allows the device to be woken from reduced power modes (up to power-down, as long as the peripheral function works in that power mode) without enabling the TXLVL interrupt. Only DMA wakes up, processes data, and goes back to sleep. The CPU will remain stopped until woken by another cause, such as DMA completion. See Hardware Wake-up control register.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Only enabled interrupts will wake up the device form reduced power modes.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: A device wake-up for DMA will occur if the receive FIFO level reaches the value specified by RXLVL in FIFOTRIG, even when the RXLVL interrupt is not enabled.

field.name: EMPTYTX
field.description: Empty command for the transmit FIFO. When a 1 is written to this bit, the TX FIFO is emptied.

field.name: EMPTYRX
field.description: Empty command for the receive FIFO. When a 1 is written to this bit, the RX FIFO is emptied.

field.name: POPDBG
field.description: Pop FIFO for debug reads.

enumeratedValue.name: DO_NOT_POP
enumeratedValue.description: Debug reads of the FIFO do not pop the FIFO.

enumeratedValue.name: POP
enumeratedValue.description: A debug read will cause the FIFO to pop.

field.name: TXERR
field.description: TX FIFO error. Will be set if a transmit FIFO error occurs. This could be an overflow caused by pushing data into a full FIFO, or by an underflow if the FIFO is empty when data is needed. Cleared by writing a 1 to this bit.

field.name: RXERR
field.description: RX FIFO error. Will be set if a receive FIFO overflow occurs, caused by software or DMA not emptying the FIFO fast enough. Cleared by writing a 1 to this bit.

field.name: PERINT
field.description: Peripheral interrupt. When 1, this indicates that the peripheral function has asserted an interrupt. The details can be found by reading the peripheral's STAT register.

field.name: TXEMPTY
field.description: Transmit FIFO empty. When 1, the transmit FIFO is empty. The peripheral may still be processing the last piece of data.

field.name: TXNOTFULL
field.description: Transmit FIFO not full. When 1, the transmit FIFO is not full, so more data can be written. When 0, the transmit FIFO is full and another write would cause it to overflow.

field.name: RXNOTEMPTY
field.description: Receive FIFO not empty. When 1, the receive FIFO is not empty, so data can be read. When 0, the receive FIFO is empty.

field.name: RXFULL
field.description: Receive FIFO full. When 1, the receive FIFO is full. Data needs to be read out to prevent the peripheral from causing an overflow.

field.name: TXLVL
field.description: Transmit FIFO current level. A 0 means the TX FIFO is currently empty, and the TXEMPTY and TXNOTFULL flags will be 1. Other values tell how much data is actually in the TX FIFO at the point where the read occurs. If the TX FIFO is full, the TXEMPTY and TXNOTFULL flags will be 0.

field.name: RXLVL
field.description: Receive FIFO current level. A 0 means the RX FIFO is currently empty, and the RXFULL and RXNOTEMPTY flags will be 0. Other values tell how much data is actually in the RX FIFO at the point where the read occurs. If the RX FIFO is full, the RXFULL and RXNOTEMPTY flags will be 1.

register.name: FIFOTRIG
register.description: FIFO trigger settings for interrupt and DMA request.

field.name: TXLVLENA
field.description: Transmit FIFO level trigger enable. This trigger will become an interrupt if enabled in FIFOINTENSET, or a DMA trigger if DMATX in FIFOCFG is set.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit FIFO level does not generate a FIFO level trigger.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: An trigger will be generated if the transmit FIFO level reaches the value specified by the TXLVL field in this register.

field.name: RXLVLENA
field.description: Receive FIFO level trigger enable. This trigger will become an interrupt if enabled in FIFOINTENSET, or a DMA trigger if DMARX in FIFOCFG is set.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Receive FIFO level does not generate a FIFO level trigger.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: An trigger will be generated if the receive FIFO level reaches the value specified by the RXLVL field in this register.

field.name: TXLVL
field.description: Transmit FIFO level trigger point. This field is used only when TXLVLENA = 1. If enabled to do so, the FIFO level can wake up the device just enough to perform DMA, then return to the reduced power mode. See Hardware Wake-up control register. 0 = trigger when the TX FIFO becomes empty. 1 = trigger when the TX FIFO level decreases to one entry. 15 = trigger when the TX FIFO level decreases to 15 entries (is no longer full).

field.name: RXLVL
field.description: Receive FIFO level trigger point. The RX FIFO level is checked when a new piece of data is received. This field is used only when RXLVLENA = 1. If enabled to do so, the FIFO level can wake up the device just enough to perform DMA, then return to the reduced power mode. See Hardware Wake-up control register. 0 = trigger when the RX FIFO has received one entry (is no longer empty). 1 = trigger when the RX FIFO has received two entries. 15 = trigger when the RX FIFO has received 16 entries (has become full).

register.name: FIFOINTENSET
register.description: FIFO interrupt enable set (enable) and read register.

field.name: TXERR
field.description: Determines whether an interrupt occurs when a transmit error occurs, based on the TXERR flag in the FIFOSTAT register.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt will be generated for a transmit error.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: An interrupt will be generated when a transmit error occurs.

field.name: RXERR
field.description: Determines whether an interrupt occurs when a receive error occurs, based on the RXERR flag in the FIFOSTAT register.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt will be generated for a receive error.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: An interrupt will be generated when a receive error occurs.

field.name: TXLVL
field.description: Determines whether an interrupt occurs when a the transmit FIFO reaches the level specified by the TXLVL field in the FIFOTRIG register.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt will be generated based on the TX FIFO level.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: If TXLVLENA in the FIFOTRIG register = 1, an interrupt will be generated when the TX FIFO level decreases to the level specified by TXLVL in the FIFOTRIG register.

field.name: RXLVL
field.description: Determines whether an interrupt occurs when a the receive FIFO reaches the level specified by the TXLVL field in the FIFOTRIG register.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt will be generated based on the RX FIFO level.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: If RXLVLENA in the FIFOTRIG register = 1, an interrupt will be generated when the when the RX FIFO level increases to the level specified by RXLVL in the FIFOTRIG register.

register.name: FIFOINTENCLR
register.description: FIFO interrupt enable clear (disable) and read register.

field.name: TXERR
field.description: Writing one clears the corresponding bits in the FIFOINTENSET register.

field.name: RXERR
field.description: Writing one clears the corresponding bits in the FIFOINTENSET register.

field.name: TXLVL
field.description: Writing one clears the corresponding bits in the FIFOINTENSET register.

field.name: RXLVL
field.description: Writing one clears the corresponding bits in the FIFOINTENSET register.

field.name: TXERR
field.description: TX FIFO error.

field.name: RXERR
field.description: RX FIFO error.

field.name: TXLVL
field.description: Transmit FIFO level interrupt.

field.name: RXLVL
field.description: Receive FIFO level interrupt.

field.name: PERINT
field.description: Peripheral interrupt.

field.name: TXDATA
field.description: Transmit data to the FIFO.

field.name: RXDATA
field.description: Received data from the FIFO. The number of bits used depends on the DATALEN and PARITYSEL settings.

field.name: FRAMERR
field.description: Framing Error status flag. This bit reflects the status for the data it is read along with from the FIFO, and indicates that the character was received with a missing stop bit at the expected location. This could be an indication of a baud rate or configuration mismatch with the transmitting source.

field.name: PARITYERR
field.description: Parity Error status flag. This bit reflects the status for the data it is read along with from the FIFO. This bit will be set when a parity error is detected in a received character.

field.name: RXNOISE
field.description: Received Noise flag. See description of the RxNoiseInt bit in Table 354.

register.name: FIFORDNOPOP
register.description: FIFO data read with no FIFO pop.

field.name: RXDATA
field.description: Received data from the FIFO. The number of bits used depends on the DATALEN and PARITYSEL settings.

field.name: FRAMERR
field.description: Framing Error status flag. This bit reflects the status for the data it is read along with from the FIFO, and indicates that the character was received with a missing stop bit at the expected location. This could be an indication of a baud rate or configuration mismatch with the transmitting source.

field.name: PARITYERR
field.description: Parity Error status flag. This bit reflects the status for the data it is read along with from the FIFO. This bit will be set when a parity error is detected in a received character.

field.name: RXNOISE
field.description: Received Noise flag. See description of the RxNoiseInt bit in Table 354.

field.name: APERTURE
field.description: Aperture: encoded as (aperture size/4K) -1, so 0x00 means a 4K aperture.

field.name: MINOR_REV
field.description: Minor revision of module implementation.

field.name: MAJOR_REV
field.description: Major revision of module implementation.

field.name: ID
field.description: Module identifier for the selected function.

register.name: IRQ
register.description: Interrupt request register for the Cortex-M0+ CPU.

field.name: INTREQ
field.description: If any bit is set, an interrupt request is sent to the Cortex-M0+ interrupt controller.

field.name: INTREQSET
field.description: Writing 1 sets the corresponding bit in the IRQ0 register.

field.name: INTREQCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the IRQ0 register.

field.name: EX
field.description: Cleared when read, set when written. See usage description above.

register.name: B_[%s]
register.description: Byte pin registers for all port GPIO pins

field.name: PBYTE
field.description: Read: state of the pin PIOm_n, regardless of direction, masking, or alternate function, except that pins configured as analog I/O always read as 0. One register for each port pin. Supported pins depends on the specific device and package. Write: loads the pin's output bit. One register for each port pin. Supported pins depends on the specific device and package.

register.name: W_[%s]
register.description: Word pin registers for all port GPIO pins

field.name: PWORD
field.description: Read 0: pin PIOm_n is LOW. Write 0: clear output bit. Read 0xFFFF FFFF: pin PIOm_n is HIGH. Write any value 0x0000 0001 to 0xFFFF FFFF: set output bit. Only 0 or 0xFFFF FFFF can be read. Writing any value other than 0 will set the output bit. One register for each port pin. Supported pins depends on the specific device and package.

register.name: DIR[%s]
register.description: Direction registers for all port GPIO pins

field.name: DIRP
field.description: Selects pin direction for pin PIOm_n (bit 0 = PIOn_0, bit 1 = PIOn_1, etc.). Supported pins depends on the specific device and package. 0 = input. 1 = output.

register.name: MASK[%s]
register.description: Mask register for all port GPIO pins

field.name: MASKP
field.description: Controls which bits corresponding to PIOm_n are active in the MPORT register (bit 0 = PIOn_0, bit 1 = PIOn_1, etc.). Supported pins depends on the specific device and package.0 = Read MPORT: pin state; write MPORT: load output bit. 1 = Read MPORT: 0; write MPORT: output bit not affected.

register.name: PIN[%s]
register.description: Port pin register for all port GPIO pins

field.name: PORT
field.description: Reads pin states or loads output bits (bit 0 = PIOn_0, bit 1 = PIOn_1, etc.). Supported pins depends on the specific device and package. 0 = Read: pin is low; write: clear output bit. 1 = Read: pin is high; write: set output bit.

register.name: MPIN[%s]
register.description: Masked port register for all port GPIO pins

field.name: MPORTP
field.description: Masked port register (bit 0 = PIOn_0, bit 1 = PIOn_1, etc.). Supported pins depends on the specific device and package. 0 = Read: pin is LOW and/or the corresponding bit in the MASK register is 1; write: clear output bit if the corresponding bit in the MASK register is 0. 1 = Read: pin is HIGH and the corresponding bit in the MASK register is 0; write: set output bit if the corresponding bit in the MASK register is 0.

register.name: SET[%s]
register.description: Write: Set register for port. Read: output bits for port

field.name: SETP
field.description: Read or set output bits (bit 0 = PIOn_0, bit 1 = PIOn_1, etc.). Supported pins depends on the specific device and package. 0 = Read: output bit: write: no operation. 1 = Read: output bit; write: set output bit.

register.name: CLR[%s]
register.description: Clear port for all port GPIO pins

field.name: CLRP
field.description: Clear output bits (bit 0 = PIOn_0, bit 1 = PIOn_1, etc.). Supported pins depends on the specific device and package. 0 = No operation. 1 = Clear output bit.

register.name: NOT[%s]
register.description: Toggle port for all port GPIO pins

field.name: NOTP
field.description: Toggle output bits (bit 0 = PIOn_0, bit 1 = PIOn_1, etc.). Supported pins depends on the specific device and package. 0 = no operation. 1 = Toggle output bit.

register.name: DIRSET[%s]
register.description: Set pin direction bits for port

field.name: DIRSETP
field.description: Set direction bits (bit 0 = PIOn_0, bit 1 = PIOn_1, etc.). Supported pins depends on the specific device and package. 0 = No operation. 1 = Set direction bit.

register.name: DIRCLR[%s]
register.description: Clear pin direction bits for port

field.name: DIRCLRP
field.description: Clear direction bits (bit 0 = PIOn_0, bit 1 = PIOn_1, etc.). Supported pins depends on the specific device and package. 0 = No operation. 1 = Clear direction bit.

register.name: DIRNOT[%s]
register.description: Toggle pin direction bits for port

field.name: DIRNOTP
field.description: Toggle direction bits (bit 0 = PIOn_0, bit 1 = PIOn_1, etc.). Supported pins depends on the specific device and package. 0 = no operation. 1 = Toggle direction bit.

field.name: DEV_ADDR
field.description: USB device address.

field.name: DEV_EN
field.description: USB device enable.

field.name: SETUP
field.description: SETUP token received.

field.name: FORCE_NEEDCLK
field.description: Forces the NEEDCLK output to always be on:.

field.name: FORCE_VBUS
field.description: If this bit is set to 1, the VBUS voltage indicators from the PHY are overruled.

field.name: LPM_SUP
field.description: LPM Supported:.

field.name: INTONNAK_AO
field.description: Interrupt on NAK for interrupt and bulk OUT EP:.

field.name: INTONNAK_AI
field.description: Interrupt on NAK for interrupt and bulk IN EP:.

field.name: INTONNAK_CO
field.description: Interrupt on NAK for control OUT EP:.

field.name: INTONNAK_CI
field.description: Interrupt on NAK for control IN EP:.

field.name: DCON
field.description: Device status - connect.

field.name: DSUS
field.description: Device status - suspend.

field.name: LPM_SUS
field.description: Device status - LPM Suspend.

field.name: LPM_REWP
field.description: LPM Remote Wake-up Enabled by USB host.

field.name: Speed
field.description: This field indicates the speed at which the device operates: 00b: reserved 01b: full-speed 10b: high-speed 11b: super-speed (reserved for future use).

field.name: DCON_C
field.description: Device status - connect change.

field.name: DSUS_C
field.description: Device status - suspend change.

field.name: DRES_C
field.description: Device status - reset change.

field.name: VBUS_DEBOUNCED
field.description: This bit indicates if VBUS is detected or not.

field.name: PHY_TEST_MODE
field.description: This field is written by firmware to put the PHY into a test mode as defined by the USB2.

field.name: FRAME_NR
field.description: Frame number.

field.name: ERR_CODE
field.description: The error code which last occurred:.

field.name: Minrev
field.description: Minor revision.

field.name: Majrev
field.description: Major revision.

register.name: EPLISTSTART
register.description: USB EP Command/Status List start address

field.name: EP_LIST_PRG
field.description: Programmable portion of the USB EP Command/Status List address.

field.name: EP_LIST_FIXED
field.description: Fixed portion of USB EP Command/Status List address.

field.name: DA_BUF
field.description: Start address of the memory page where all endpoint data buffers are located.

field.name: HIRD_HW
field.description: Host Initiated Resume Duration - HW.

field.name: HIRD_SW
field.description: Host Initiated Resume Duration - SW.

field.name: DATA_PENDING
field.description: As long as this bit is set to one and LPM supported bit is set to one, HW will return a NYET handshake on every LPM token it receives.

field.name: SKIP
field.description: Endpoint skip: Writing 1 to one of these bits, will indicate to HW that it must deactivate the buffer assigned to this endpoint and return control back to software.

field.name: BUF
field.description: Buffer in use: This register has one bit per physical endpoint.

field.name: BUF_SB
field.description: Buffer usage: This register has one bit per physical endpoint.

field.name: EP0OUT
field.description: Interrupt status register bit for the Control EP0 OUT direction.

field.name: EP0IN
field.description: Interrupt status register bit for the Control EP0 IN direction.

field.name: EP1OUT
field.description: Interrupt status register bit for the EP1 OUT direction.

field.name: EP1IN
field.description: Interrupt status register bit for the EP1 IN direction.

field.name: EP2OUT
field.description: Interrupt status register bit for the EP2 OUT direction.

field.name: EP2IN
field.description: Interrupt status register bit for the EP2 IN direction.

field.name: EP3OUT
field.description: Interrupt status register bit for the EP3 OUT direction.

field.name: EP3IN
field.description: Interrupt status register bit for the EP3 IN direction.

field.name: EP4OUT
field.description: Interrupt status register bit for the EP4 OUT direction.

field.name: EP4IN
field.description: Interrupt status register bit for the EP4 IN direction.

field.name: EP5OUT
field.description: Interrupt status register bit for the EP5 OUT direction.

field.name: EP5IN
field.description: Interrupt status register bit for the EP5 IN direction.

field.name: FRAME_INT
field.description: Frame interrupt.

field.name: DEV_INT
field.description: Device status interrupt.

field.name: EP_INT_EN
field.description: If this bit is set and the corresponding USB interrupt status bit is set, a HW interrupt is generated on the interrupt line.

field.name: FRAME_INT_EN
field.description: If this bit is set and the corresponding USB interrupt status bit is set, a HW interrupt is generated on the interrupt line.

field.name: DEV_INT_EN
field.description: If this bit is set and the corresponding USB interrupt status bit is set, a HW interrupt is generated on the interrupt line.

field.name: EP_SET_INT
field.description: If software writes a one to one of these bits, the corresponding USB interrupt status bit is set.

field.name: FRAME_SET_INT
field.description: If software writes a one to one of these bits, the corresponding USB interrupt status bit is set.

field.name: DEV_SET_INT
field.description: If software writes a one to one of these bits, the corresponding USB interrupt status bit is set.

field.name: TOGGLE
field.description: Endpoint data toggle: This field indicates the current value of the data toggle for the corresponding endpoint.

field.name: PHY_ADDR
field.description: ULPI mode: Bits 7:0 are used as the address when doing a register access over the ULPI interface.

field.name: PHY_WDATA
field.description: UTMI+ mode: Reserved.

field.name: PHY_RDATA
field.description: UTMI+ mode: Bits 7:0 contains the value returned by the VStatus signal on Vendor Interface of UTMI+.

field.name: PHY_RW
field.description: UTMI+ mode: Reserved.

field.name: PHY_ACCESS
field.description: Software writes this bit to one to start a read or write operation.

field.name: PHY_MODE
field.description: This bit indicates if the interface between the controller is UTMI+ or ULPI.

field.name: CRC_POLY
field.description: CRC polynomial: 1X = CRC-32 polynomial 01 = CRC-16 polynomial 00 = CRC-CCITT polynomial

field.name: BIT_RVS_WR
field.description: Data bit order: 1 = Bit order reverse for CRC_WR_DATA (per byte) 0 = No bit order reverse for CRC_WR_DATA (per byte)

field.name: CMPL_WR
field.description: Data complement: 1 = 1's complement for CRC_WR_DATA 0 = No 1's complement for CRC_WR_DATA

field.name: BIT_RVS_SUM
field.description: CRC sum bit order: 1 = Bit order reverse for CRC_SUM 0 = No bit order reverse for CRC_SUM

field.name: CMPL_SUM
field.description: CRC sum complement: 1 = 1's complement for CRC_SUM 0 = No 1's complement for CRC_SUM

field.name: CRC_SEED
field.description: A write access to this register will load CRC seed value to CRC_SUM register with selected bit order and 1's complement pre-processes. A write access to this register will overrule the CRC calculation in progresses.

field.name: CRC_SUM
field.description: The most recent CRC sum can be read through this register with selected bit order and 1's complement post-processes.

field.name: CRC_WR_DATA
field.description: Data written to this register will be taken to perform CRC calculation with selected bit order and 1's complement pre-process. Any write size 8, 16 or 32-bit are allowed and accept back-to-back transactions.

field.name: CONTROLLER_RESET
field.description: Controller reset.

field.name: FIFO_RESET
field.description: Fifo reset.

field.name: DMA_RESET
field.description: DMA reset.

field.name: INT_ENABLE
field.description: Global interrupt enable/disable bit.

field.name: READ_WAIT
field.description: Read/wait.

field.name: SEND_IRQ_RESPONSE
field.description: Send irq response.

field.name: ABORT_READ_DATA
field.description: Abort read data.

field.name: SEND_CCSD
field.description: Send ccsd.

field.name: SEND_AUTO_STOP_CCSD
field.description: Send auto stop ccsd.

field.name: CEATA_DEVICE_INTERRUPT_STATUS
field.description: CEATA device interrupt status.

field.name: CARD_VOLTAGE_A0
field.description: Controls the state of the SD_VOLT0 pin.

field.name: CARD_VOLTAGE_A1
field.description: Controls the state of the SD_VOLT1 pin.

field.name: CARD_VOLTAGE_A2
field.description: Controls the state of the SD_VOLT2 pin.

field.name: USE_INTERNAL_DMAC
field.description: SD/MMC DMA use.

field.name: POWER_ENABLE0
field.description: Power on/off switch for card 0; once power is turned on, software should wait for regulator/switch ramp-up time before trying to initialize card 0.

field.name: POWER_ENABLE1
field.description: Power on/off switch for card 1; once power is turned on, software should wait for regulator/switch ramp-up time before trying to initialize card 1.

field.name: CLK_DIVIDER0
field.description: Clock divider-0 value.

field.name: CCLK0_ENABLE
field.description: Clock-enable control for SD card 0 clock.

field.name: CCLK1_ENABLE
field.description: Clock-enable control for SD card 1 clock.

field.name: CCLK0_LOW_POWER
field.description: Low-power control for SD card 0 clock.

field.name: CCLK1_LOW_POWER
field.description: Low-power control for SD card 1 clock.

field.name: RESPONSE_TIMEOUT
field.description: Response time-out value.

field.name: DATA_TIMEOUT
field.description: Value for card Data Read time-out; same value also used for Data Starvation by Host time-out.

field.name: CARD0_WIDTH0
field.description: Indicates if card 0 is 1-bit or 4-bit: 0 - 1-bit mode 1 - 4-bit mode 1 and 4-bit modes only work when 8-bit mode in CARD0_WIDTH1 is not enabled (bit 16 in this register is set to 0).

field.name: CARD1_WIDTH0
field.description: Indicates if card 1 is 1-bit or 4-bit: 0 - 1-bit mode 1 - 4-bit mode 1 and 4-bit modes only work when 8-bit mode in CARD1_WIDTH1 is not enabled (bit 16 in this register is set to 0).

field.name: CARD0_WIDTH1
field.description: Indicates if card 0 is 8-bit: 0 - Non 8-bit mode 1 - 8-bit mode.

field.name: CARD1_WIDTH1
field.description: Indicates if card 1 is 8-bit: 0 - Non 8-bit mode 1 - 8-bit mode.

field.name: BLOCK_SIZE
field.description: Block size.

field.name: BYTE_COUNT
field.description: Number of bytes to be transferred; should be integer multiple of Block Size for block transfers.

field.name: CDET
field.description: Card detect.

field.name: RE
field.description: Response error.

field.name: CDONE
field.description: Command done.

field.name: DTO
field.description: Data transfer over.

field.name: TXDR
field.description: Transmit FIFO data request.

field.name: RXDR
field.description: Receive FIFO data request.

field.name: RCRC
field.description: Response CRC error.

field.name: DCRC
field.description: Data CRC error.

field.name: RTO
field.description: Response time-out.

field.name: DRTO
field.description: Data read time-out.

field.name: HTO
field.description: Data starvation-by-host time-out (HTO).

field.name: CMDFSMSTATES
field.description: Command FSM states: 0 - Idle 1 - Send init sequence 2 - Tx cmd start bit 3 - Tx cmd tx bit 4 - Tx cmd index + arg 5 - Tx cmd crc7 6 - Tx cmd end bit 7 - Rx resp start bit 8 - Rx resp IRQ response 9 - Rx resp tx bit 10 - Rx resp cmd idx 11 - Rx resp data 12 - Rx resp crc7 13 - Rx resp end bit 14 - Cmd path wait NCC 15 - Wait; CMD-to-response turnaround NOTE: The command FSM state is represented using 19 bits.

field.name: SOFT_RESET
field.description: Soft Reset for DM (write-only from AHB, not readable and selfclearing). A write to this bit will cause a soft reset for DM.

field.name: CHIP_RESET_REQ
field.description: Write only bit. Once written will cause the chip to reset (note that the DM is not reset by this reset as it is only resettable by a SOFT reset or a POR/BOD event)

field.name: FWMDE0
field.description: FIFO 0 Watermark DMA Enable

field.name: FWMDE1
field.description: FIFO1 Watermark DMA Enable

field.name: TPRICTRL
field.description: ADC trigger priority control

enumeratedValue.name: TPRICTRL_0
enumeratedValue.description: If a higher priority trigger is detected during command processing, the current conversion is aborted and the new command specified by the trigger is started.

enumeratedValue.name: TPRICTRL_1
enumeratedValue.description: If a higher priority trigger is received during command processing, the current command is stopped after after completing the current conversion. If averaging is enabled, the averaging loop will be completed. However, CMDHa[LOOP] will be ignored and the higher priority trigger will be serviced.

enumeratedValue.name: TPRICTRL_2
enumeratedValue.description: If a higher priority trigger is received during command processing, the current command will be completed (averaging, looping, compare) before servicing the higher priority trigger.

field.name: PWRSEL
field.description: Power Configuration Select

field.name: REFSEL
field.description: Voltage Reference Selection

field.name: TRES
field.description: Trigger Resume Enable

enumeratedValue.name: TRES_0
enumeratedValue.description: Trigger sequences interrupted by a high priority trigger exception will not be automatically resumed or restarted.

enumeratedValue.name: TRES_1
enumeratedValue.description: Trigger sequences interrupted by a high priority trigger exception will be automatically resumed or restarted.

field.name: TCMDRES
field.description: Trigger Command Resume

enumeratedValue.name: TCMDRES_0
enumeratedValue.description: Trigger sequences interrupted by a high priority trigger exception will be automatically restarted.

enumeratedValue.name: TCMDRES_1
enumeratedValue.description: Trigger sequences interrupted by a high priority trigger exception will be resumed from the command executing before the exception.

field.name: HPT_EXDI
field.description: High Priority Trigger Exception Disable

enumeratedValue.name: HPT_EXDI_0
enumeratedValue.description: High priority trigger exceptions are enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: HPT_EXDI_1
enumeratedValue.description: High priority trigger exceptions are disabled.

field.name: PUDLY
field.description: Power Up Delay

field.name: PWREN
field.description: ADC Analog Pre-Enable

enumeratedValue.name: PWREN_0
enumeratedValue.description: ADC analog circuits are only enabled while conversions are active. Performance is affected due to analog startup delays.

enumeratedValue.name: PWREN_1
enumeratedValue.description: ADC analog circuits are pre-enabled and ready to execute conversions without startup delays (at the cost of higher DC current consumption). A single power up delay (CFG[PUDLY]) is executed immediately once PWREN is set, and any detected trigger does not begin ADC operation until the power up delay time has passed. After this initial delay expires the analog will remain pre-enabled, and no additional delays will be executed.

enumeratedValue.name: TEXC_NUM_9

enumeratedValue.name: TEXC_NUM_65535
