register.name: HCREVISION
register.description: BCD representation of the version of the HCI specification that is implemented by the Host Controller (HC)

field.name: REV
field.description: Revision.

register.name: HCCONTROL
register.description: Defines the operating modes of the HC

field.name: CBSR
field.description: ControlBulkServiceRatio.

field.name: PLE
field.description: PeriodicListEnable.

field.name: IE
field.description: IsochronousEnable.

field.name: CLE
field.description: ControlListEnable.

field.name: BLE
field.description: BulkListEnable This bit is set to enable the processing of the Bulk list in the next Frame.

field.name: HCFS
field.description: HostControllerFunctionalState for USB 00b: USBRESET 01b: USBRESUME 10b: USBOPERATIONAL 11b: USBSUSPEND A transition to USBOPERATIONAL from another state causes SOFgeneration to begin 1 ms later.

field.name: IR
field.description: InterruptRouting This bit determines the routing of interrupts generated by events registered in HcInterruptStatus.

field.name: RWC
field.description: RemoteWakeupConnected This bit indicates whether HC supports remote wake-up signaling.

field.name: RWE
field.description: RemoteWakeupEnable This bit is used by HCD to enable or disable the remote wake-up feature upon the detection of upstream resume signaling.

register.name: HCCOMMANDSTATUS
register.description: This register is used to receive the commands from the Host Controller Driver (HCD)

field.name: HCR
field.description: HostControllerReset This bit is set by HCD to initiate a software reset of HC.

field.name: CLF
field.description: ControlListFilled This bit is used to indicate whether there are any TDs on the Control list.

field.name: BLF
field.description: BulkListFilled This bit is used to indicate whether there are any TDs on the Bulk list.

field.name: OCR
field.description: OwnershipChangeRequest This bit is set by an OS HCD to request a change of control of the HC.

field.name: SOC
field.description: SchedulingOverrunCount These bits are incremented on each scheduling overrun error.

register.name: HCINTERRUPTSTATUS
register.description: Indicates the status on various events that cause hardware interrupts by setting the appropriate bits

field.name: SO
field.description: SchedulingOverrun This bit is set when the USB schedule for the current Frame overruns and after the update of HccaFrameNumber.

field.name: WDH
field.description: WritebackDoneHead This bit is set immediately after HC has written HcDoneHead to HccaDoneHead.

field.name: SF
field.description: StartofFrame This bit is set by HC at each start of a frame and after the update of HccaFrameNumber.

field.name: RD
field.description: ResumeDetected This bit is set when HC detects that a device on the USB is asserting resume signaling.

field.name: UE
field.description: UnrecoverableError This bit is set when HC detects a system error not related to USB.

field.name: FNO
field.description: FrameNumberOverflow This bit is set when the MSb of HcFmNumber (bit 15) changes value, from 0 to 1 or from 1 to 0, and after HccaFrameNumber has been updated.

field.name: RHSC
field.description: RootHubStatusChange This bit is set when the content of HcRhStatus or the content of any of HcRhPortStatus[NumberofDownstreamPort] has changed.

field.name: OC
field.description: OwnershipChange This bit is set by HC when HCD sets the OwnershipChangeRequest field in HcCommandStatus.

register.name: HCINTERRUPTENABLE
register.description: Controls the bits in the HcInterruptStatus register and indicates which events will generate a hardware interrupt

field.name: SO
field.description: Scheduling Overrun interrupt.

field.name: WDH
field.description: HcDoneHead Writeback interrupt.

field.name: SF
field.description: Start of Frame interrupt.

field.name: RD
field.description: Resume Detect interrupt.

field.name: UE
field.description: Unrecoverable Error interrupt.

field.name: FNO
field.description: Frame Number Overflow interrupt.

field.name: RHSC
field.description: Root Hub Status Change interrupt.

field.name: OC
field.description: Ownership Change interrupt.

field.name: MIE
field.description: Master Interrupt Enable.

register.name: HCINTERRUPTDISABLE
register.description: The bits in this register are used to disable corresponding bits in the HCInterruptStatus register and in turn disable that event leading to hardware interrupt

field.name: SO
field.description: Scheduling Overrun interrupt.

field.name: WDH
field.description: HcDoneHead Writeback interrupt.

field.name: SF
field.description: Start of Frame interrupt.

field.name: RD
field.description: Resume Detect interrupt.

field.name: UE
field.description: Unrecoverable Error interrupt.

field.name: FNO
field.description: Frame Number Overflow interrupt.

field.name: RHSC
field.description: Root Hub Status Change interrupt.

field.name: OC
field.description: Ownership Change interrupt.

field.name: MIE
field.description: A 0 written to this field is ignored by HC.

register.name: HCHCCA
register.description: Contains the physical address of the host controller communication area

field.name: HCCA
field.description: Base address of the Host Controller Communication Area.

register.name: HCPERIODCURRENTED
register.description: Contains the physical address of the current isochronous or interrupt endpoint descriptor

field.name: PCED
field.description: The content of this register is updated by HC after a periodic ED is processed.

register.name: HCCONTROLHEADED
register.description: Contains the physical address of the first endpoint descriptor of the control list

field.name: CHED
field.description: HC traverses the Control list starting with the HcControlHeadED pointer.

register.name: HCCONTROLCURRENTED
register.description: Contains the physical address of the current endpoint descriptor of the control list

field.name: CCED
field.description: ControlCurrentED.

register.name: HCBULKHEADED
register.description: Contains the physical address of the first endpoint descriptor of the bulk list

field.name: BHED
field.description: BulkHeadED HC traverses the bulk list starting with the HcBulkHeadED pointer.

register.name: HCBULKCURRENTED
register.description: Contains the physical address of the current endpoint descriptor of the bulk list

field.name: BCED
field.description: BulkCurrentED This is advanced to the next ED after the HC has served the current one.

register.name: HCDONEHEAD
register.description: Contains the physical address of the last transfer descriptor added to the 'Done' queue

field.name: DH
field.description: DoneHead When a TD is completed, HC writes the content of HcDoneHead to the NextTD field of the TD.

register.name: HCFMINTERVAL
register.description: Defines the bit time interval in a frame and the full speed maximum packet size which would not cause an overrun

field.name: FI
field.description: FrameInterval This specifies the interval between two consecutive SOFs in bit times.

field.name: FSMPS
field.description: FSLargestDataPacket This field specifies a value which is loaded into the Largest Data Packet Counter at the beginning of each frame.

field.name: FIT
field.description: FrameIntervalToggle HCD toggles this bit whenever it loads a new value to FrameInterval.

register.name: HCFMREMAINING
register.description: A 14-bit counter showing the bit time remaining in the current frame

field.name: FR
field.description: FrameRemaining This counter is decremented at each bit time.

field.name: FRT
field.description: FrameRemainingToggle This bit is loaded from the FrameIntervalToggle field of HcFmInterval whenever FrameRemaining reaches 0.

register.name: HCFMNUMBER
register.description: Contains a 16-bit counter and provides the timing reference among events happening in the HC and the HCD

field.name: FN
field.description: FrameNumber This is incremented when HcFmRemaining is re-loaded.

register.name: HCPERIODICSTART
register.description: Contains a programmable 14-bit value which determines the earliest time HC should start processing a periodic list

field.name: PS
field.description: PeriodicStart After a hardware reset, this field is cleared and then set by HCD during the HC initialization.

register.name: HCLSTHRESHOLD
register.description: Contains 11-bit value which is used by the HC to determine whether to commit to transfer a maximum of 8-byte LS packet before EOF

field.name: LST
field.description: LSThreshold This field contains a value which is compared to the FrameRemaining field prior to initiating a Low Speed transaction.

register.name: HCRHDESCRIPTORA
register.description: First of the two registers which describes the characteristics of the root hub

field.name: NDP
field.description: NumberDownstreamPorts These bits specify the number of downstream ports supported by the root hub.

field.name: PSM
field.description: PowerSwitchingMode This bit is used to specify how the power switching of the root hub ports is controlled.

field.name: NPS
field.description: NoPowerSwitching These bits are used to specify whether power switching is supported or port are always powered.

field.name: DT
field.description: DeviceType This bit specifies that the root hub is not a compound device.

field.name: OCPM
field.description: OverCurrentProtectionMode This bit describes how the overcurrent status for the root hub ports are reported.

field.name: NOCP
field.description: NoOverCurrentProtection This bit describes how the overcurrent status for the root hub ports are reported.

field.name: POTPGT
field.description: PowerOnToPowerGoodTime This byte specifies the duration the HCD has to wait before accessing a powered-on port of the root hub.

register.name: HCRHDESCRIPTORB
register.description: Second of the two registers which describes the characteristics of the Root Hub

field.name: DR
field.description: DeviceRemovable Each bit is dedicated to a port of the Root Hub.

field.name: PPCM
field.description: PortPowerControlMask Each bit indicates if a port is affected by a global power control command when PowerSwitchingMode is set.

register.name: HCRHSTATUS
register.description: This register is divided into two parts

field.name: LPS
field.description: (read) LocalPowerStatus The Root Hub does not support the local power status feature; thus, this bit is always read as 0.

field.name: OCI
field.description: OverCurrentIndicator This bit reports overcurrent conditions when the global reporting is implemented.

field.name: DRWE
field.description: (read) DeviceRemoteWakeupEnable This bit enables a ConnectStatusChange bit as a resume event, causing a USBSUSPEND to USBRESUME state transition and setting the ResumeDetected interrupt.

field.name: LPSC
field.description: (read) LocalPowerStatusChange The root hub does not support the local power status feature.

field.name: OCIC
field.description: OverCurrentIndicatorChange This bit is set by hardware when a change has occurred to the OCI field of this register.

field.name: CRWE
field.description: (write) ClearRemoteWakeupEnable Writing a 1 clears DeviceRemoveWakeupEnable.

register.name: HCRHPORTSTATUS
register.description: Controls and reports the port events on a per-port basis

field.name: CCS
field.description: (read) CurrentConnectStatus This bit reflects the current state of the downstream port.

field.name: PES
field.description: (read) PortEnableStatus This bit indicates whether the port is enabled or disabled.

field.name: PSS
field.description: (read) PortSuspendStatus This bit indicates the port is suspended or in the resume sequence.

field.name: POCI
field.description: (read) PortOverCurrentIndicator This bit is only valid when the Root Hub is configured in such a way that overcurrent conditions are reported on a per-port basis.

field.name: PRS
field.description: (read) PortResetStatus When this bit is set by a write to SetPortReset, port reset signaling is asserted.

field.name: PPS
field.description: (read) PortPowerStatus This bit reflects the porta's power status, regardless of the type of power switching implemented.

field.name: LSDA
field.description: (read) LowSpeedDeviceAttached This bit indicates the speed of the device attached to this port.

field.name: CSC
field.description: ConnectStatusChange This bit is set whenever a connect or disconnect event occurs.

field.name: PESC
field.description: PortEnableStatusChange This bit is set when hardware events cause the PortEnableStatus bit to be cleared.

field.name: PSSC
field.description: PortSuspendStatusChange This bit is set when the full resume sequence is completed.

field.name: OCIC
field.description: PortOverCurrentIndicatorChange This bit is valid only if overcurrent conditions are reported on a per-port basis.

field.name: PRSC
field.description: PortResetStatusChange This bit is set at the end of the 10 ms port reset signal.

register.name: PORTMODE
register.description: Controls the port if it is attached to the host block or the device block

field.name: ID
field.description: Port ID pin value.

field.name: ID_EN
field.description: Port ID pin pull-up enable.

field.name: DEV_ENABLE
field.description: 1: device 0: host.

register.name: CAPLENGTH_CHIPID
register.description: This register contains the offset value towards the start of the operational register space and the version number of the IP block

field.name: CAPLENGTH
field.description: Capability Length: This is used as an offset.

field.name: CHIPID
field.description: Chip identification: indicates major and minor revision of the IP: [31:24] = Major revision [23:16] = Minor revision Major revisions used: 0x01: USB2.

field.name: N_PORTS
field.description: This register specifies the number of physical downstream ports implemented on this host controller.

field.name: PPC
field.description: This field indicates whether the host controller implementation includes port power control.

field.name: P_INDICATOR
field.description: This bit indicates whether the ports support port indicator control.

field.name: LPMC
field.description: Link Power Management Capability.

field.name: FLADJ
field.description: Frame Length Timing Value.

field.name: FRINDEX
field.description: Frame Index: Bits 29 to16 in this register are used for the frame number field in the SOF packet.

register.name: ATL_PTD_BASE_ADDR
register.description: Memory base address where ATL PTD0 is stored

field.name: ATL_CUR
field.description: This indicates the current PTD that is used by the hardware when it is processing the ATL list.

field.name: ATL_BASE
field.description: Base address to be used by the hardware to find the start of the ATL list.

register.name: ISO_PTD_BASE_ADDR
register.description: Memory base address where ISO PTD0 is stored

field.name: ISO_FIRST
field.description: This indicates the first PTD that is used by the hardware when it is processing the ISO list.

field.name: ISO_BASE
field.description: Base address to be used by the hardware to find the start of the ISO list.

register.name: INT_PTD_BASE_ADDR
register.description: Memory base address where INT PTD0 is stored

field.name: INT_FIRST
field.description: This indicates the first PTD that is used by the hardware when it is processing the INT list.

field.name: INT_BASE
field.description: Base address to be used by the hardware to find the start of the INT list.

register.name: DATA_PAYLOAD_BASE_ADDR
register.description: Memory base address that indicates the start of the data payload buffers

field.name: DAT_BASE
field.description: Base address to be used by the hardware to find the start of the data payload section.

field.name: RS
field.description: Run/Stop: 1b = Run.

field.name: HCRESET
field.description: Host Controller Reset: This control bit is used by the software to reset the host controller.

field.name: FLS
field.description: Frame List Size: This field specifies the size of the frame list.

field.name: LHCR
field.description: Light Host Controller Reset: This bit allows the driver software to reset the host controller without affecting the state of the ports.

field.name: ATL_EN
field.description: ATL List enabled.

field.name: ISO_EN
field.description: ISO List enabled.

field.name: INT_EN
field.description: INT List enabled.

field.name: HIRD
field.description: Host-Initiated Resume Duration.

field.name: LPM_RWU
field.description: bRemoteWake field.

field.name: PCD
field.description: Port Change Detect: The host controller sets this bit to logic 1 when any port has a change bit transition from a 0 to a one or a Force Port Resume bit transition from a 0 to a 1 as a result of a J-K transition detected on a suspended port.

field.name: FLR
field.description: Frame List Rollover: The host controller sets this bit to logic 1 when the frame list index rolls over its maximum value to 0.

field.name: ATL_IRQ
field.description: ATL IRQ: Indicates that an ATL PTD (with I-bit set) was completed.

field.name: ISO_IRQ
field.description: ISO IRQ: Indicates that an ISO PTD (with I-bit set) was completed.

field.name: INT_IRQ
field.description: INT IRQ: Indicates that an INT PTD (with I-bit set) was completed.

field.name: SOF_IRQ
field.description: SOF interrupt: Every time when the host sends a Start of Frame token on the USB bus, this bit is set.

field.name: PCDE
field.description: Port Change Detect Interrupt Enable: 1: enable 0: disable.

field.name: FLRE
field.description: Frame List Rollover Interrupt Enable: 1: enable 0: disable.

field.name: ATL_IRQ_E
field.description: ATL IRQ Enable bit: 1: enable 0: disable.

field.name: ISO_IRQ_E
field.description: ISO IRQ Enable bit: 1: enable 0: disable.

field.name: INT_IRQ_E
field.description: INT IRQ Enable bit: 1: enable 0: disable.

field.name: SOF_E
field.description: SOF Interrupt Enable bit: 1: enable 0: disable.

field.name: CCS
field.description: Current Connect Status: Logic 1 indicates a device is present on the port.

field.name: CSC
field.description: Connect Status Change: Logic 1 means that the value of CCS has changed.

field.name: PED
field.description: Port Enabled/Disabled.

field.name: PEDC
field.description: Port Enabled/Disabled Change: Logic 1 means that the value of PED has changed.

field.name: OCA
field.description: Over-current active: Logic 1 means that this port has an over-current condition.

field.name: OCC
field.description: Over-current change: Logic 1 means that the value of OCA has changed.

field.name: FPR
field.description: Force Port Resume: Logic 1 means resume (K-state) detected or driven on the port.

field.name: SUSP
field.description: Suspend: Logic 1 means port is in the suspend state.

field.name: PR
field.description: Port Reset: Logic 1 means the port is in the reset state.

field.name: SUS_L1
field.description: Suspend using L1 0b = Suspend using L2 1b = Suspend using L1 When this bit is set to a 1 and a non-zero value is specified in the Device Address field, the host controller will generate an LPM Token to enter the L1 state whenever software writes a one to the Suspend bit, as well as L1 exit timing during any device or host-initiated resume.

field.name: LS
field.description: Line Status: This field reflects the current logical levels of the DP (bit 11) and DM (bit 10) signal lines.

field.name: PP
field.description: Port Power: The function of this bit depends on the value of the Port Power Control (PPC) bit in the HCSPARAMS register.

field.name: PIC
field.description: Port Indicator Control : Writing to this field has no effect if the P_INDICATOR bit in the HCSPARAMS register is logic 0.

field.name: PTC
field.description: Port Test Control: A non-zero value indicates that the port is operating in the test mode as indicated by the value.

field.name: PSPD
field.description: Port Speed: 00b: Low-speed 01b: Full-speed 10b: High-speed 11b: Reserved.

field.name: WOO
field.description: Wake on overcurrent enable: Writing this bit to a one enables the port to be sensitive to overcurrent conditions as wake-up events.

field.name: SUS_STAT
field.description: These two bits are used by software to determine whether the most recent L1 suspend request was successful: 00b: Success-state transition was successful (ACK) 01b: Not Yet - Device was unable to enter the L1 state at this time (NYET) 10b: Not supported - Device does not support the L1 state (STALL) 11b: Timeout/Error - Device failed to respond or an error occurred.

field.name: DEV_ADD
field.description: Device Address for LPM tokens.

register.name: ATL_PTD_DONE_MAP
register.description: Done map for each ATL PTD

field.name: ATL_DONE
field.description: The bit corresponding to a certain PTD will be set to logic 1 as soon as that PTD execution is completed.

register.name: ATL_PTD_SKIP_MAP
register.description: Skip map for each ATL PTD

field.name: ATL_SKIP
field.description: When a bit in the PTD Skip Map is set to logic 1, the corresponding PTD will be skipped, independent of the V bit setting.

register.name: ISO_PTD_DONE_MAP
register.description: Done map for each ISO PTD

field.name: ISO_DONE
field.description: The bit corresponding to a certain PTD will be set to logic 1 as soon as that PTD execution is completed.

register.name: ISO_PTD_SKIP_MAP
register.description: Skip map for each ISO PTD

field.name: ISO_SKIP
field.description: The bit corresponding to a certain PTD will be set to logic 1 as soon as that PTD execution is completed.

register.name: INT_PTD_DONE_MAP
register.description: Done map for each INT PTD

field.name: INT_DONE
field.description: The bit corresponding to a certain PTD will be set to logic 1 as soon as that PTD execution is completed.

register.name: INT_PTD_SKIP_MAP
register.description: Skip map for each INT PTD

field.name: INT_SKIP
field.description: When a bit in the PTD Skip Map is set to logic 1, the corresponding PTD will be skipped, independent of the V bit setting.

register.name: LAST_PTD_INUSE
register.description: Marks the last PTD in the list for ISO, INT and ATL

field.name: ATL_LAST
field.description: If hardware has reached this PTD and the J bit is not set, it will go to PTD0 as the next PTD to be processed.

field.name: ISO_LAST
field.description: This indicates the last PTD in the ISO list.

field.name: INT_LAST
field.description: This indicates the last PTD in the INT list.

register.name: UTMIPLUS_ULPI_DEBUG
register.description: Register to read/write registers in the attached USB PHY

field.name: PHY_ADDR
field.description: UTMI+ mode: Bits 3:0 are used to control VControl signal on Vendor Interface of UTMI+ ULPI mode: Bits 7:0 are used as the address when doing a register access over the ULPI interface.

field.name: PHY_WDATA
field.description: UTMI+ mode: Reserved.

field.name: PHY_RDATA
field.description: UTMI+ mode: Bits 7:0 contains the value returned by the VStatus signal on Vendor Interface of UTMI+ ULPI mode: Bits 7:0 are used for the read data when reading a value to a ULPI PHY register.

field.name: PHY_RW
field.description: UTMI+ mode: Reserved.

field.name: PHY_ACCESS
field.description: Software writes this bit to one to start a read or write operation.

field.name: PHY_MODE
field.description: This bit indicates if the interface between the controller is UTMI+ or ULPI 0b: UTMI+ 1b: ULPI If the hardware supports both modes, this bit is RW by SW.

register.name: PORTMODE
register.description: Controls the port if it is attached to the host block or the device block

field.name: ID0
field.description: Port 0 ID pin value.

field.name: ID0_EN
field.description: Port 0 ID pin pull-up enable.

field.name: DEV_ENABLE
field.description: If this bit is set to one, one of the ports will behave as a USB device.

field.name: SW_CTRL_PDCOM
field.description: This bit indicates if the PHY power-down input is controlled by software or by hardware.

field.name: SW_PDCOM
field.description: This bit is only used when SW_CTRL_PDCOM is set to 1b.

register.name: CTRL
register.description: Is control register to enable and operate Hash and Crypto

field.name: Mode
field.description: The operational mode to use, or 0 if none. Note that the CONFIG register will indicate if specific modes beyond SHA1 and SHA2-256 are available.

enumeratedValue.name: AES
enumeratedValue.description: AES if available (see also CRYPTCFG register for more controls)

enumeratedValue.name: ICB_AES
enumeratedValue.description: ICB-AES if available (see also CRYPTCFG register for more controls)

enumeratedValue.name: SALSA20
enumeratedValue.description: Salsa20/20 if available (including XSalsa - see also CRYPTCFG register)

enumeratedValue.name: CHACHA20
enumeratedValue.description: ChaCha20 if available (see also CRYPTCFG register for more controls)

field.name: New_Hash
field.description: Written with 1 when starting a new Hash/Crypto. It self clears. Note that the WAITING Status bit will clear for a cycle during the initialization from New=1.

enumeratedValue.name: START
enumeratedValue.description: Starts a new Hash/Crypto and initializes the Digest/Result.

field.name: DMA_I
field.description: Written with 1 to use DMA to fill INDATA. If Hash, will request from DMA for 16 words and then will process the Hash. If Cryptographic, it will load as many words as needed, including key if not already loaded. It will then request again. Normal model is that the DMA interrupts the processor when its length expires. Note that if the processor will write the key and optionally IV, it should not enable this until it has done so. Otherwise, the DMA will be expected to load those for the 1st block (when needed).

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_USED
enumeratedValue.description: DMA is not used. Processor writes the necessary words when WAITING is set (interrupts), unless AHB Master is used.

enumeratedValue.name: PUSH
enumeratedValue.description: DMA will push in the data.

field.name: DMA_O
field.description: Written to 1 to use DMA to drain the digest/output. If both DMA_I and DMA_O are set, the DMA has to know to switch direction and the locations. This can be used for crypto uses.

enumeratedValue.name: NOTUSED
enumeratedValue.description: DMA is not used. Processor reads the digest/output in response to DIGEST interrupt.

field.name: HASHSWPB
field.description: If 1, will swap bytes in the word for SHA hashing. The default is byte order (so LSB is 1st byte) but this allows swapping to MSB is 1st such as is shown in SHS spec. For cryptographic swapping, see the CRYPTCFG register.

field.name: WAITING
field.description: If 1, the block is waiting for more data to process.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_WAITING
enumeratedValue.description: Not waiting for data - may be disabled or may be busy. Note that for cryptographic uses, this is not set if IsLast is set nor will it set until at least 1 word is read of the output.

enumeratedValue.name: WAITING
enumeratedValue.description: Waiting for data to be written in (16 words)

field.name: DIGEST_aka_OUTDATA
field.description: For Hash, if 1 then a DIGEST is ready and waiting and there is no active next block already started. For Cryptographic uses, this will be set for each block processed, indicating OUTDATA (and OUTDATA2 if larger output) contains the next value to read out. This is cleared when any data is written, when New is written, for Cryptographic uses when the last word is read out, or when the block is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: READY
enumeratedValue.description: Digest is ready. Application may read it or may write more data

field.name: ERROR
field.description: If 1, an error occurred. For normal uses, this is due to an attempted overrun: INDATA was written when it was not appropriate. For Master cases, this is an AHB bus error; the COUNT field will indicate which block it was on.

enumeratedValue.name: ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: An error occurred since last cleared (written 1 to clear).

field.name: NEEDKEY
field.description: Indicates the block wants the key to be written in (set along with WAITING)

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_NEED
enumeratedValue.description: No Key is needed and writes will not be treated as Key

enumeratedValue.name: NEED
enumeratedValue.description: Key is needed and INDATA/ALIAS will be accepted as Key. Will also set WAITING.

field.name: NEEDIV
field.description: Indicates the block wants an IV/NONE to be written in (set along with WAITING)

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_NEED
enumeratedValue.description: No IV/Nonce is needed, either because written already or because not needed.

enumeratedValue.name: NEED
enumeratedValue.description: IV/Nonce is needed and INDATA/ALIAS will be accepted as IV/Nonce. Will also set WAITING.

field.name: ICBIDX
field.description: If ICB-AES is selected, then reads as the ICB index count based on ICBSTRM (from CRYPTCFG). That is, if 3 bits of ICBSTRM, then this will count from 0 to 7 and then back to 0. On 0, it has to compute the full ICB, quicker when not 0.

register.name: INTENSET
register.description: Write 1 to enable interrupts; reads back with which are set.

field.name: WAITING
field.description: Indicates if should interrupt when waiting for data input.

field.name: DIGEST
field.description: Indicates if should interrupt when Digest (or Outdata) is ready (completed a hash/crypto or completed a full sequence).

enumeratedValue.name: NO_INTERRUPT
enumeratedValue.description: Will not interrupt when Digest is ready

enumeratedValue.name: INTERRUPT
enumeratedValue.description: Will interrupt when Digest is ready. Interrupt cleared by writing more data, starting a new Hash, or disabling (done).

field.name: ERROR
field.description: Indicates if should interrupt on an ERROR (as defined in Status)

field.name: WAITING
field.description: Write 1 to clear mask.

field.name: DIGEST
field.description: Write 1 to clear mask.

field.name: ERROR
field.description: Write 1 to clear mask.

register.name: MEMCTRL
register.description: Setup Master to access memory (if available)

field.name: MASTER
field.description: no description available

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_USED
enumeratedValue.description: Mastering is not used and the normal DMA or Interrupt based model is used with INDATA.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Mastering is enabled and DMA and INDATA should not be used.

field.name: COUNT
field.description: Number of 512-bit (128-bit if AES, except 1st block which may include key and IV) blocks to copy starting at MEMADDR. This register will decrement after each block is copied, ending in 0. For Hash, the DIGEST interrupt will occur when it reaches 0. Fro AES, the DIGEST/OUTDATA interrupt will occur on ever block. If a bus error occurs, it will stop with this field set to the block that failed. 0:Done - nothing to process. 1 to 2K: Number of 512-bit (or 128bit) blocks to hash.

register.name: MEMADDR
register.description: Address to start memory access from (if available).

field.name: BASE
field.description: Address base to start copying from, word aligned (so bits 1:0 must be 0). This field will advance as it processes the words. If it fails with a bus error, the register will contain the failing word. N:Address in Flash or RAM space; RAM only as mapped in this part. May also be able to address SPIFI.

register.name: INDATA
register.description: Input of 16 words at a time to load up buffer.

field.name: DATA
field.description: Write next word in little-endian form. The hash requires big endian word data, but this block swaps the bytes automatically. That is, SHA assumes the data coming in is treated as bytes (e.g. "abcd") and since the ARM core will treat "abcd" as a word as 0x64636261, the block will swap the word to restore into big endian.

field.name: DATA
field.description: Write next word in little-endian form. The hash requires big endian word data, but this block swaps the bytes automatically. That is, SHA assumes the data coming in is treated as bytes (e.g. "abcd") and since the ARM core will treat "abcd" as a word as 0x64636261, the block will swap the word to restore into big endian.

field.name: DIGEST_OUTPUT
field.description: One word of the Digest or output. Note that only 1st 4 are populated for AES and 1st 5 are populated for SHA1.

field.name: OUTPUT
field.description: One word of the 2nd half of the output when used.

register.name: CRYPTCFG
register.description: Crypto settings for AES and Salsa and ChaCha

field.name: MSW1ST_OUT
field.description: If 1, OUTDATA0 will be read Most significant word 1st for AES. Else it will be read in normal little endian - Least significant word 1st. Note: only if allowed by configuration.

field.name: SWAPKEY
field.description: If 1, will Swap the key input (bytes in each word).

field.name: SWAPDAT
field.description: If 1, will SWAP the data and IV inputs (bytes in each word).

field.name: MSW1ST
field.description: If 1, load of key, IV, and data is MSW 1st for AES. Else, the words are little endian. Note: only if allowed by configuration.

field.name: AESMODE
field.description: AES Cipher mode to use if plain AES

enumeratedValue.name: CTR
enumeratedValue.description: CTR mode (see details on IV/nonce). See also AESCTRPOS.

field.name: AESDECRYPT
field.description: AES ECB direction. Only encryption used if CTR mode or manual modes such as CFB

field.name: AESSECRET
field.description: Selects the Hidden Secret key vs. User key, if provided. If security levels are used, only the highest level is permitted to select this.

enumeratedValue.name: NORMAL_WAY
enumeratedValue.description: User key provided in normal way

enumeratedValue.name: AESSECRET_1
enumeratedValue.description: Secret key provided in hidden way by HW

field.name: AESKEYSZ
field.description: Sets the AES key size

field.name: AESCTRPOS
field.description: Halfword position of 16b counter in IV if AESMODE is CTR (position is fixed for Salsa and ChaCha). Only supports 16b counter, so application must control any additional bytes if using more. The 16-bit counter is read from the IV and incremented by 1 each time. Any other use CTR should use ECB directly and do its own XOR and so on.

field.name: STREAMLAST
field.description: Is 1 if last stream block. If not 1, then the engine will compute the next "hash".

field.name: XSALSA
field.description: Is 1 if XSalsa 128b NONCE to be used vs. 64b

field.name: ICBSZ
field.description: This sets the ICB size between 32 and 128 bits, using the following rules. Note that the counter is assumed to occupy the low order bits of the IV.

enumeratedValue.name: BITS_32
enumeratedValue.description: 32 bits of the IV/ctr are used (from 127:96)

enumeratedValue.name: BITS_64
enumeratedValue.description: 64 bits of the IV/ctr are used (from 127:64)

enumeratedValue.name: BITS_96
enumeratedValue.description: 96 bits of the IV/ctr are used (from 127:32)

enumeratedValue.name: BIT_128
enumeratedValue.description: All 128 bits of the IV/ctr are used

field.name: ICBSTRM
field.description: The size of the ICB-AES stream that can be pushed before needing to compute a new IV/ctr (counter start). This optimizes the performance of the stream of blocks after the 1st.

register.name: CONFIG
register.description: Returns the configuration of this block in this chip - indicates what services are available.

field.name: DUAL
field.description: 1 if 2 x 512 bit buffers, 0 if only 1 x 512 bit

field.name: DMA
field.description: 1 if DMA is connected

field.name: AHB
field.description: 1 if AHB Master is enabled

field.name: SHA512
field.description: 1 if SHA2-512 included

field.name: AES
field.description: 1 if AES 128 included

field.name: AESKEY
field.description: 1 if AES 192 and 256 also included

field.name: SECRET
field.description: 1 if AES Secret key available

field.name: SALSA
field.description: 1 if Salsa included

field.name: CHACHA
field.description: 1 if ChaCha included

field.name: ICB
field.description: 1 if ICB over AES included

register.name: LOCK
register.description: Lock register allows locking to the current security level or unlocking by the lock holding level.

field.name: SECLOCK
field.description: Write 1 to secure-lock this block (if running in a security state). Write 0 to unlock. If locked already, may only write if at same or higher security level as lock. Reads as: 0 if unlocked, else 1, 2, 3 to indicate security level it is locked at. NOTE: this and ID are the only readable registers if locked and current state is lower than lock level.

enumeratedValue.name: UNLOCK
enumeratedValue.description: Unlocks, so block is open to all. But, AHB Master will only issue non-secure requests.

enumeratedValue.name: LOCK
enumeratedValue.description: Locks to the current security level. AHB Master will issue requests at this level.

field.name: PATTERN
field.description: Must write 0xA75 to change lock state. A75:Pattern needed to change bits 1:0

field.name: MASK
field.description: A random word.

register.name: CTRL0
register.description: Contains the offsets of AB and CD in the RAM.

field.name: ABBPAIR
field.description: Which bank-pair the offset ABOFF is within. This must be 0 if only 2-up

field.name: ABOFF
field.description: Word or DWord Offset of AB values, with B at [2]=0 and A at [2]=1 as far as the code sees (normally will be an interleaved bank so only sequential to AHB). Word offset only allowed if 32 bit operation. Ideally not in the same RAM as the CD values if 4-up

field.name: CDBPAIR
field.description: Which bank-pair the offset CDOFF is within. This must be 0 if only 2-up

field.name: CDOFF
field.description: Word or DWord Offset of CD, with D at [2]=0 and C at [2]=1 as far as the code sees (normally will be an interleaved bank so only sequential to AHB). Word offset only allowed if 32 bit operation. Ideally not in the same RAM as the AB values

register.name: CTRL1
register.description: Contains the opcode mode, iteration count, and result offset (in RAM) and also launches the accelerator. Note: with CP version: CTRL0 and CRTL1 can be written in one go with MCRR.

field.name: ITER
field.description: Iteration counter. Is number_cycles - 1. write 0 means Does one cycle - does not iterate.

field.name: MODE
field.description: Operation mode to perform. write 0 means Accelerator is inactive. write others means accelerator is active.

field.name: RESBPAIR
field.description: Which bank-pair the offset RESOFF is within. This must be 0 if only 2-up. Ideally this is not the same bank as ABBPAIR (when 4-up supported)

field.name: RESOFF
field.description: Word or DWord Offset of result. Word offset only allowed if 32 bit operation. Ideally not in the same RAM as the AB and CD values

field.name: CSKIP
field.description: Skip rules on Carry if needed. This operation will be skipped based on Carry value (from previous operation) if not 0:

enumeratedValue.name: SET_AND_SKIP
enumeratedValue.description: Set CTRLOFF to CDOFF and Skip

register.name: LOADER
register.description: Contains an optional loader to load into CTRL0/1 in steps to perform a set of operations.

field.name: COUNT
field.description: Number of control pairs to load 0 relative (so 1 means load 1). write 1 means Does one op - does not iterate, write N means N control pairs to load

field.name: CTRLBPAIR
field.description: Which bank-pair the offset CTRLOFF is within. This must be 0 if only 2-up. Does not matter which bank is used as this is loaded when not performing an operation.

field.name: CTRLOFF
field.description: DWord Offset of CTRL pair to load next.

register.name: STATUS
register.description: Indicates operational status and would contain the carry bit if used.

field.name: DONE
field.description: Indicates if the accelerator has finished an operation. Write 1 to clear, or write CTRL1 to clear.

field.name: CARRY
field.description: Last carry value if operation produced a carry bit

field.name: BUSY
field.description: Indicates if the accelerator is busy performing an operation

field.name: DONE
field.description: Set if the accelerator should interrupt when done.

field.name: DONE
field.description: Written to clear an interrupt set with INTENSET.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_INTERRUPT
enumeratedValue.description: If written 1, do not Interrupt when done

register.name: INTSTAT
register.description: Interrupt status bits (mask of INTENSET and STATUS)

field.name: DONE
field.description: If set, interrupt is caused by accelerator being done.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_CAUSED
enumeratedValue.description: Not caused by accelerator being done

field.name: REG_VALUE
field.description: Register to be fed into Multiplier. Is not normally written or read by application, but is available when accelerator not busy.

field.name: REG_VALUE
field.description: Register to be fed into Multiplier. Is not normally written or read by application, but is available when accelerator not busy.

field.name: REG_VALUE
field.description: Register to be fed into Multiplier. Is not normally written or read by application, but is available when accelerator not busy.

field.name: REG_VALUE
field.description: Register to be fed into Multiplier. Is not normally written or read by application, but is available when accelerator not busy.

field.name: REG_VALUE
field.description: Register to hold working result (from multiplier, adder/xor, etc). Is not normally written or read by application, but is available when accelerator not busy.

field.name: REG_VALUE
field.description: Register to hold working result (from multiplier, adder/xor, etc). Is not normally written or read by application, but is available when accelerator not busy.

field.name: REG_VALUE
field.description: Register to hold working result (from multiplier, adder/xor, etc). Is not normally written or read by application, but is available when accelerator not busy.

field.name: REG_VALUE
field.description: Register to hold working result (from multiplier, adder/xor, etc). Is not normally written or read by application, but is available when accelerator not busy.

field.name: MASK
field.description: Mask to apply as side channel countermeasure. 0: No mask to be used. N: Mask to XOR onto values

field.name: MASK
field.description: Mask to apply as side channel countermeasure. 0: No mask to be used. N: Mask to XOR onto values

field.name: LOCK
field.description: Reads back with security level locked to, or 0. Writes as 0 to unlock, 1 to lock.

field.name: KEY
field.description: Must be written as 0x73D to change the register.

enumeratedValue.name: KWY_VALUE
enumeratedValue.description: If set during write, will allow lock or unlock

peripheral.name: POWERQUAD
peripheral.description: Digital Signal Co-Processing companion to a Cortex-M v8M CPU core

register.name: OUTBASE
register.description: Base address register for output region

field.name: outbase
field.description: Base address register for the output region

field.name: out_formatint
field.description: Output Internal format (00: q15; 01:q31; 10:float)

field.name: out_formatext
field.description: Output External format (00: q15; 01:q31; 10:float)

field.name: out_scaler
field.description: Output Scaler value (for scaled 'q31' formats)

register.name: TMPBASE
register.description: Base address register for temp region

field.name: tmpbase
field.description: Base address register for the temporary region

field.name: tmp_formatint
field.description: Temp Internal format (00: q15; 01:q31; 10:float)

field.name: tmp_formatext
field.description: Temp External format (00: q15; 01:q31; 10:float)

field.name: tmp_scaler
field.description: Temp Scaler value (for scaled 'q31' formats)

register.name: INABASE
register.description: Base address register for input A region

field.name: inabase
field.description: Base address register for the input A region

field.name: ina_formatint
field.description: Input A Internal format (00: q15; 01:q31; 10:float)

field.name: ina_formatext
field.description: Input A External format (00: q15; 01:q31; 10:float)

field.name: ina_scaler
field.description: Input A Scaler value (for scaled 'q31' formats)

register.name: INBBASE
register.description: Base address register for input B region

field.name: inbbase
field.description: Base address register for the input B region

field.name: inb_formatint
field.description: Input B Internal format (00: q15; 01:q31; 10:float)

field.name: inb_formatext
field.description: Input B External format (00: q15; 01:q31; 10:float)

field.name: inb_scaler
field.description: Input B Scaler value (for scaled 'q31' formats)

field.name: decode_opcode
field.description: opcode specific to decode_machine

field.name: decode_machine
field.description: 0 : Coprocessor , 1 : matrix , 2 : fft , 3 : fir , 4 : stat , 5 : cordic , 6 -15 : NA

field.name: inst_busy
field.description: Instruction busy signal when high indicates processing is on

field.name: inst_length
field.description: Length register. When FIR : fir_xlength = inst_length[15:0] , fir_tlength = inst_len[31:16]. When MTX : rows_a = inst_length[4:0] , cols_a = inst_length[12:8] , cols_b = inst_length[20:16]

field.name: cppre_in
field.description: co-processor scaling of input

field.name: cppre_out
field.description: co-processor fixed point output

field.name: cppre_sat
field.description: 1 : forces sub-32 bit saturation

field.name: cppre_sat8
field.description: 0 = 8bits, 1 = 16bits

field.name: inst_misc
field.description: Misc register. For Matrix : Used for scale factor

field.name: cursory
field.description: 1 : Enable cursory mode

field.name: cordic_x
field.description: Cordic input x

field.name: cordic_y
field.description: Cordic input y

field.name: cordic_z
field.description: Cordic input z

register.name: ERRSTAT
register.description: Read/Write register where error statuses are captured (sticky)

field.name: OVERFLOW
field.description: overflow

field.name: NAN
field.description: nan

field.name: FIXEDOVERFLOW
field.description: fixed_pt_overflow

field.name: UNDERFLOW
field.description: underflow

field.name: BUSERROR
field.description: bus_error

field.name: intr_oflow
field.description: 1 : Enable interrupt on Floating point overflow

field.name: intr_nan
field.description: 1 : Enable interrupt on Floating point NaN

field.name: intr_fixed
field.description: 1: Enable interrupt on Fixed point Overflow

field.name: intr_uflow
field.description: 1 : Enable interrupt on Subnormal truncation

field.name: intr_berr
field.description: 1: Enable interrupt on AHBM Buss Error

field.name: intr_comp
field.description: 1: Enable interrupt on instruction completion

field.name: event_oflow
field.description: 1 : Enable event trigger on Floating point overflow

field.name: event_nan
field.description: 1 : Enable event trigger on Floating point NaN

field.name: event_fixed
field.description: 1: Enable event trigger on Fixed point Overflow

field.name: event_uflow
field.description: 1 : Enable event trigger on Subnormal truncation

field.name: event_berr
field.description: 1: Enable event trigger on AHBM Buss Error

field.name: event_comp
field.description: 1: Enable event trigger on instruction completion

field.name: intr_stat
field.description: Intr status ( 1 bit to indicate interrupt captured, 0 means no new interrupt), write any value will clear this bit

field.name: gpreg
field.description: General purpose register bank

field.name: compreg
field.description: Compute register bank

field.name: FLASH_RULE
field.description: Security access rules for the whole FLASH : 0x0000_0000 - 0x0009_FFFF

register.name: sec_vio_addr[%s]
register.description: most recent security violation address for AHB layer n

field.name: SEC_VIO_ADDR
field.description: security violation address for AHB layer

register.name: sec_vio_misc_info[%s]
register.description: most recent security violation miscellaneous information for AHB layer n

field.name: SEC_VIO_INFO_WRITE
field.description: security violation access read/write indicator, 0: read, 1: write

field.name: SEC_VIO_INFO_DATA_ACCESS
field.description: security violation access data/code indicator, 0: code, 1

field.name: SEC_VIO_INFO_MASTER_SEC_LEVEL
field.description: bit [5:4]: master sec level and privilege level bit [7:6]: anti-pol value for master sec level and privilege level

field.name: SEC_VIO_INFO_MASTER
field.description: security violation master number

register.name: SEC_VIO_INFO_VALID

register.name: SEC_MASK_LOCK
